loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal S. lives with her husband and two young children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 5- and 6-year-old children go to a local kindergarten. Her husband is a public bus driver. Otgonjargal and her husband got married in 2002 and lived in their parents' house until 2006.

In 2005, Otgonjargal S. started running a small stall for selling various belts in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. As her business expanded, she opened another stall in the Hantalst market and an additional stall in the Narantuul market. These stalls also specialize in various belts. She and her husband were also able to build a new house for themselves with their business profit. Recently, she hired a saleswoman because she needed more time to go to China and import more products for her stalls. She has a keen interest in fashion. In the future, she hopes to open her own fashion shop.

Otgonjargal S. requests a loan to purchase more belts for resale, as there is an increasing demand for her products.

loans.use: To buy belts from China for resale

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is 43 years old and is married with five children. She sells grocery products and has been in this business for a long time. She has applied for a loan of 150,000 NGN ($1,025) to purchase more grocery products to sell. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz has lives in a mid-size city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past 10 years.  Shanaz belongs to a family of farmers.  In her childhood, she used to get milk from buffaloes.  

Her husband runs a dairy business, so she helps him by getting milk.  Presently, they have two buffaloes at their home.  Shahaz is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk selling business.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 65 years old and married with six children. He sells motor spare parts.  Felix has been in this business for a long time.  He hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts for motor to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L., 50, of Jimenez, is married to a welder mechanic. They are blessed with one child who is a second year high school student.

The earnest desire of the couple is to see their only son finish college and have a bright future ahead. And so, hard work and patience are the only keys they have had.

Teresita joined Paglaum to access finances for additional capital for snack vending so she can help her husband and make money in her own way. Her customers are her neighbors, cousins and nearby canteens.

loans.use: Buy snack vending items to sell.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed has lives in Riwind, Pakistan for 10 years.  Her husband runs a garment shop in the cloth market.  He has six years of experience in this business.  Khurhseed is the mother of two daughters.  Both help her in her animal food selling business.  She does this work to pay the utility bills of her house.  She is applying for a loan to buy garments for her husband’s garment shop.

loans.use: Buy garments for resale.

loans.name: Ifeanyenwa

texts.en:
Ifeanyenwa is 42 years old and married with six children. She produces and sells snakes. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria and has been in this business for a long time.

She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more snake materials for production and to sell. Ifeanyenwa is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more snake materials for production and to sell.

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en:
In 2000, Hadbaatar M., 46, started a small retail business selling organs with his wife. With the business profit, Hadbaatar's family was able to afford his two children’s weddings. Last year, they began to produce a type of oil made by boiling organs. This oil is commonly used to cook food.

The family also has a small farm with chickens. In addition, Hadbaatar fixes broken cars during his free time. Hadbaatar is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial man. In the spring, the demand for oil products usually increases.

Hadbaatar's family has four children. The oldest two children are married and live independently from their parents. Today, Hadbaatar lives with his wife and two young children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their 21-year old daughter is a student at the local university. Their youngest son is a high-school student.

Hadbaatar requests a loan to buy more organs before the season comes when oil is most in demand. Seen in the photograph is Hadbaatar's wife, Tsetsegmaa, at their organ stall.

loans.use: to buy organs to make oil.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg T. is a single mother who lives with her 11 year-old son in Uvurhanghay province, one of the southern provinces of Mongolia.

In 2004, the government laid off a significant number of high school teachers due to a structural change in the higher education of Mongolia. Erdenetsetseg was one of them. After the layoff, she started a small retail business in school related products such as pens, pencils and notebooks. She purchases the products from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar..

Since she was a high school teacher, she knows what school children need during the school season. Maybe because she used to work in education, she hopes to make sure that her only child receives the best possible education. Her dream is to send her son to one of the best universities in the world. She requests a loan to purchase more products for her retail shop.

loans.use: Buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past five years.

Riwind city is famous for its shrine places. Parveen husband runs a grocery shop. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: Buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sells provision and drinks to people living in her community. She is 31 years old and single. Joy lives in Delta State, Nigeria and has been in this business for years.

Joy needs a loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She has been a LAPO client for eight years. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more provision and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Munh-Orgil

texts.en:
Munh-Orgil O. lives with her husband in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

In 2004, she started running a small stall for cell phone accessories in the Bayanzurh market, one of the largest markets in Ulaanbaatar. As of today, she runs two stalls for cell phone accessories and her husband is mostly in charge of running these two stalls. Besides the cell phone accessories business, Munh-Orgil's husband also uses his car as a taxi, to boost his family income.

She frequently travels to Ereen, China, (a major trade city where many Mongolian small business owners import cheap products) to bring in products for her retail business. Since its inception, Munh-Orgil has gained significant experience in this type of business. As her profits allow, she hopes to build a small house on the land where they now lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent). She requests a loan to imports more products and pay rent on the additional stall.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone accessories and pay rent for a retail stall.

loans.name: Shahida Parveen

texts.en: Shahida parveen K. A. has lived in the city of Riwind, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Her husband, K. A., has been in the dairy business for the past five years and currently owns one buffalo. Shahida runs a business sewing clothes. She earns an income by taking clothing orders from her relatives and neighbors. She saves her income as part of a collective in hopes of covering wedding expenses for her single daughter. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her family's dairy business.

loans.name: Tumurtogtoh

texts.en:
Well-respected locally, Tumurtogtoh D. lives with her husband and two grown children in Uvurhanghay province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. They've called Uvurhanghay home for 24 years, and along with her daughter, Tumurtogtoh operates a small retail stall for men's and women's apparel in the Khuleg shopping center.  Once a month her daughter, Luusenjiimaa, goes to Ereen, a Chinese border town, to buy wholesale clothing, while Tumurtogtoh works as a saleswoman at the stall. 

Their business capital is 4.3 million tugrug ($1 USD=1,500 MNT), and with this loan, her daughter will purchase spring clothes to increase their business inventory.

loans.use: To buy apparel.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya G. is a widow with three children. She lives with her two young children in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a senior in a local high school and her 6-year-old daughter goes to a kindergarten.

Since 1997, she has been selling TV remote controls for various consumer electronics in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She started the business with a capital of 500,000 MNT (1 U.S. dollar equals approximately 1,500 MNT), and currently her business capital is about 4,000,000 MNT. Compared to when she started, her business has stabilized with some trusted clients.

In addition to selling new remote controls, she repairs old remote controls and resells antiques. Her business profit is the only source of income for her family. Her husband passed away three years ago and her only son is a soldier in the army.

In the future, she would like to make sure that her two daughters will be able to go to university without financial strains. She requests a loan for purchasing more antiques and remote controls.

loans.use: To buy more electronic remote controls and antiques to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells medicine in her store. She is forty-three years old and married with nine children.  She lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for years. She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more medicine in order to satisfy her customers' needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar baji is the wife of M. A. and has lived in a mid-sized city named Riwind in Pakistan for the last ten years. Her husband runs a dairy business. He has six years of experience in this business. Currently, he owns one buffalo.  Kosar baji and her husband get up at 4:00 am, milk the buffalo and fill milk pots. After that, M. A. goes to the milk shops to sell the milk. Kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand the dairy business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Batsuh G. is a married father of a fifteen-year-old son and a ten-year-old daughter. Both his children attend elementary school. The family lives in a condo in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Together with his wife, Batsuh has run a grocery store for the past seven years. Batsuh buys the goods wholesale and his wife, along with one saleswoman, runs the store. They pay $330 per month in rent on the store.  Their average daily gross income is $200. About 20 percent of that is profit. They pay their saleswoman $100 a month. Batsuh owns a minibus for transporting goods for his business. Their dream is to one day have their own supermarket. Batsuh is a very open and cheerful person. They are requesting a Kiva loan to buy bread, flour, rice and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: Khurshud B. is sixty-one years old. He is married with five children. Khurshud sells fruit and vegetables in the small village of Imishli city. He rents a small shed where he keeps products. His business is located in the central street of the village where he lives. He has been running his own small business together with his wife for eight years. Khurshud retired many years ago and his pension is too small to cover their needs. Income from the business provides for family expenses. Khurshud`s children are independent adults so all his efforts are to provide himself and his wife with a comfortable old age. Today he requests $1200 to increase the number of products he sells. Khurshud thanks everyone for support and promises to pay back the loan on time. Khurshud also keeps a cow and took a loan from AqroInvest to buy it. He recommended himself as a trusted client and has a good loan history.

loans.use: increase number of products

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin Q. is a forty-six year old, married father of two children. He provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store he owns where he sells toys for children. He is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months to increase the stock of goods available at his store. Shahin is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children's efforts to get a good education. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more toys to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty-five years old and married with seven children.  She produces and sells garri.  Garri is made from mature cassava, first dried and then fried.  She lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for years. She needs a loan amount of $700 to purchase more cassava for the production of garri. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava for making garri to sell

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra baji has been a citizen of a city named Riwind in Pakistan for the last eight years. She is not educated because her parents couldn't afford the expense. She is married to a man named A. A., and he bakes and sells bread in the community. He sells each loaf for $.06.  He has three years of experience in this business. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy flour to be used in her husband’s bread making business.

loans.use: To buy flour for making bread

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Хабибов Хуршед, молодой человек 24 лет, занимается продажей  запчастей и электро предметов для домашнего обихода. Кроме этого бизнеса он работает в кондитерском цехе по замесу теста. Его жена работает в детском саду помощницей воспитателя. Для  расширения своего бизнеса Хуршед хочет получить очередной кредит, закупить товар с оптового рынка. Его ассортимент составляет электрические плитки, розетки, кабеля и.т.д.
texts.en:
Hurshed H., a young man of 24 years, sells replacement parts and home electronics. In addition to this businesss, he works in a confectionary shop kneading dough. His wife works as an assistant caregiver at a daycare center. Hurshed wants to get another loan to expand his business by purchasing goods on the wholesale market. His inventory consists of electric hot plates, outlets and cables, et cetera.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electronics

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.ru: Хасанов Мавлон  кредитуется   с начало открытия Микроинвест. Он и его жена торговали небольшим ассортиментом. Теперь они торгуют большим ассортиментом, что позволило  Мавлону  расширить свой бизнес и магазин.  Его жена ездит за товаром со своими подругами.  Они ездят на такси, а товар отправляют общим грузом в контейнере, где встречает  Мавлон.  После наступления кризиса, он вынужден снизить цену на некоторый вид товара.  Но весной очень хороший спрос на мужскую одежду. Поэтому у Мавлона сейчас сезон продаж мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Mavlon H. has been a client since MicroInvest opened its doors. He and his wife sold a limited range of good, but now they trade in a board assortment that has permitted Mavlon to expand his business and store. His wife and her friends keep the store stocked. They go by taxi and send back a container of items for Mavlon to meet. At the onset of the financial crisis, he was forced to reduce the price of some goods, but in the spring the demand for men's clothing is high so now is the time to sell menswear.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan Q. is a poor and vulnerable person. He is fifty years old and lives with his wife and five children. Khasan has a small grocery store and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why Khasan has applied for a loan of $1200. This loan will allow him to buy a larger supply of goods for re-sale and to better provide for his family. With the money he saves he hopes to be able to provide his children with a better education. With your help he’ll be able to realize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: Buy a larger supply of goods

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta is thirty-three years old and married with five children. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She produces and sells garri, and has been in this business since 2000. She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more cassava for producing garri to sell. She says thanks to all who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for producing garri to sell

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.ru: Мирганов Хакимчон мужчина 26 лет, недавно женился. Работает частным таксистом. Кроме своей работы он имеет бизнес животноводства. Сейчас у него дома одна корова. Для покупки ещё двух коров Хакимчон хочет получить кредит. Для начала он хочет купить одну корову и если он сможет нормально погасить займ, то в дальнейшем будет продолжать кредитоваться. Хакимчон благодарен , что можно в кредит купить скот
texts.en:
Hakimjon M. is a 26-year-old man who recently married. He works part-time as a taxi driver. In addition to this line of work, he raises livestock. At the moment he has one cow at home. Hakimjon would like to take out loans for the purchase of two additional cows. Initially he wants to buy one cow, and if he is able to successfully repay his loan, then he will take out another in the future. Hakimjon is grateful that he is able to get credit to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and Selling Cattle

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en: Ibadet Q. is a successful young father and a dedicated husband. He has an adorable daughter. Ibadet began a small food store six years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown larger and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1225 so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Ibadet is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Jecinter Atieno

texts.en: Jecinter Atieno A. is 37 (ish) years old and has six children; they are 20, 18, 15, 14, 10 and 8 and all in school. Her husband is a bicycle mechanic. Jecinter, on the other hand, is a farmer and she plants kale, spinach, black nightshade, onion, and cabbage. She wants a loan of 10,000 to buy more seeds and land so she can expand her farming area. She said she would be grateful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and land

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina sells provisions and foodstuffs to people living in her community. She is 40 years old and married with four children.  She lives in Delta State, Nigeria and she has been in this business for years. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provision and foodstuff to sell. She is a LAPO. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Борлиева Хатича  замужем , 1966 года рождения, у нее 4 детей.   С Микроинвест сотрудничает месяц. Дома содержит скот,  после откорма продает на рынке. Муж находиться в России на заработки, время о времени присылает деньги, для ее и детей.  Основной доход продажа скота и посев сельского хозяйства. Весной продает зелень и корневые плоды, летом фрукты, и осенью овощи, а также виноград, который идет на завод для обработки вина и других изделий. Ей тяжело одной без мужа и поэтому  она решила получить кредит, что бы улучшить семейное положение.
texts.en:
Halicha B. is married, she was born in 1966 and she has 4 children. Halicha has been working with MicroInvest for one month. She raises livestock at home, after fattening it, she sells it at the market. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and from time to time sends money home for her and for the children. Halicha’s main income comes from selling livestock and from agriculture. In the spring she sells greens and root vegetables, in the summer fruits and in the autumn vegetables. In addition, she sells grapes which are sent to a plant for making wine and other grape products. It is hard for Halicha to be alone without a husband and this is why she decided to take out a loan, in order to improve her family situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. O. is a 21-year-old mother of three children, aged 7, 3 and 1. Her 7-year-old is in school, and she plans to send the other two as well. She is married to a “hawker” – someone who sells small wares on the street in downtown Kisumu.

From her own store in the Nyamasaria slum, Judith sells second-hand clothes. She hopes to use this loan to expand her business and then to finance a plot of land on which she will build rental houses. Judith says that a plot of land in the Nyamasaria slum typically costs between 80,000 and 100,000 KSH. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 shillings.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell, and to buy land

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo F. O. is a 19-year-old mother of one child, aged 6 months. Her husband is currently looking for work, so F. sells fast-food items like chips, mandazi (like donuts) and chai to support her family.

Adhiambo lives and works in the Nyamasaria slum, and she buys her goods from the main market in downtown Kisumu. She says the biggest challenge she faces right now is meeting the demands of her customers because she currently doesn’t have the capital to keep up her stock. She also hopes to help her husband set up a kiosk to sell paraffin (kerosene) near her own kiosk. She is asking for 50,000 shillings.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell and to set up a kerosene kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Converting	 passenger van to run on natural gas

loans.name: Prisila Akumu

texts.en: Prisila Akumu O. is the 45-year-old mother of three children ages 16, 12 and 8. All her children are in school and she is married to a carpenter. She lives and works in Nyamasaria slum where she has a food kiosk. Her main dishes are maize and beans (Nyonyo) and porridge. She says she works hard so she can pay for her children’s school fees and is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Elizabeth Kasaya

texts.en: Elizabeth Kasaya O. is a 27-year-old mother of five children aged 10, 8, 6, 2, and 4. All are in school. She is married to a “hawker” who sells small items on the street. Elizabeth, on the other hand, is a farmer and grows spinach, black nightshade and tomatoes. While she lives in Nymasaria, she grows her vegetables outside a small fishing village near Kisumu called Dunga. She hopes she can buy more seeds to grow more and be an intensive farmer – selling more of her vegetables rather than just eating them. She is asking for 10,000 KSH for seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. If she does very well, she says, there is definitely a market for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.ru: Лутфи женщина,которая каждый день сидит и торгует на рынке Худжанда.Следующий займ она хочет использовать для закупа редкого товара, бананов и киви.Сейчас она торгует яблоками , грушами и мандаринами.Товар ей привозят сами поставщики по оптовым ценам .Лутфи рада сотрудничать с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Lutfi is a woman who sits and trades everyday at the Khujand market. She would like to use her next loan in order to purchase rare products: bananas and kiwi. Right now she sells apples, pears and mandarin oranges. Her suppliers bring her the products at wholesale prices. Lutfi is happy to work with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas and kiwi for sale

loans.name: Judith Akinyi

texts.en: Judith Akinyi A. is a 24-year-old mother of two children aged 9 and 3. They are both in school. She sells dry maize and chips. To make the chips, she peels potatoes, heats oil and then dips the potatoes in hot oil before draining the oil. She serves the chips with a little salad. Her husband is a tailor. She is asking for 15,000 KSH to purchase more dry maize and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and potatoes

loans.name: Nak Bakht Group

texts.en:
Nak Bakht is the group leader of Nak bakht group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Nak Bakta wants to take a loan for her bakery business because she needs more flour for her bakery. Hzraw wants a loan for the business of tailoring. Salma wants a loan for her husband, who does carpentry. Roya wants to take a loan for tailoring because she needs more materials for her business.

They have requested a group loan of 58800 Afghani for a term of 10 months They would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: To expand her bakery

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
Зебинисо Азизова 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Торгует продуктами питания, а точнее конфетами, на рынке "ПАМИР". Товар ей привозит знакомый и поставщики , она считает, что выгодней так и удобней. С Микроинвест начала сотрудничать в 2007 году. Она  одна зарабатывает и помогает семье как может. Дети взрослые , но они живут отдельно и у них свой отдельный бюджет. 
Поэтому она благодарит Микроинвест и за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Zebiniso A. was born in 1958, is married and has 2 children. She has a college education. Zebiniso sells food products, specifically candy and the “PAMIR” market. Her acquaintance and suppliers bring her the products to sell, which she thinks is more profitable and more convenient. Zebiniso started working with MicroInvest in 2007. She is the only one earning money and helps her family as best as she can. Her children are grown but they live separately and have separate budgets. This is why she is grateful to MicroInvest and for KIVA’s support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy

loans.name: Mah Jan Group

texts.en:
Mah Jan is the group leader of the Mah Jan group. There are two members. Each of them wants to take a loan to expand their businesses.

Mah is a carpet weaver who wants to buy materials. Sediqa's loan will help her son’s business, a fuel selling shop. They request a group loan of 21000 Afghani for the term of 8 months. They want to say that Kiva is the best process.

loans.use: Expand business opportunities.

loans.name: Josephine Achieng

texts.en: Josephine Achieng O. is a 30-year-old single mother of three children, ages 14, 9 and 5. To pay for their school fees, she sells Chapati (deep-fried flour or maize). She is asking for 10,000 KSH to help her buy more ingredients so she can cook more Chapati. She lives and works in the Nyamasari slum.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for chapati

loans.name: Irene Akoth

texts.en:
Irene Akoth O. is a 29 year old mother and widow. Her child is 6 years old and is currently in school. Irene sells water, purchased from the Keywasco company. She will use the loan to buy hand-carts that will make transporting the water easier.

Irene recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase Hand-Carts to transport water

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old and is married with 5 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Madaline

texts.en: Madaline is 53 years old and is married with 7 children. She has a store where she sells provisions like milk, detergent, bathing soap and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru: Кутфи, клиентка в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она торгует на большом рынке города Худжанда по названию"Сомон".У неё вначале деятельности был один маленький отдел, а сейчас она арендует два больших контейнера на рынке.Для увеличения летнего ассортимента детской одежды Кутфи дала заявку на параллельный займ.По результатам мониторинга было выявлено , что для её оборота необходимо дать возможность на параллельный займ, т.к. у неё хороший поток клиентов.
texts.en:
Kutfi has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. She trades at the big market in the city of Khujand, called “Somon.” When she started her business she had a small location, but now she rents two large containers at the market. In order to increase her product selection of children’s clothing, Kutfi applied for a parallel loan. The loan monitoring results showed that it is necessary to give her a chance to receive a parallel loan, because she has a good stream of customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Jane Atieno Demba

texts.en:
Jane Atieno Demba O. is an incredible vivacious woman and one of the initial recipients of the K-MET revolving loan fund.

Jane is 42-years-old and the mother of seven children ages 24, 23, 22, 18, 16, 14, and 12. Her husband recently retired from public work. Jane is the quintessential entrepreneur. She owns a butcher shop at the local market, a community pharmacy and is a community-based health worker.

She has taken out three loans so far for 10,000, 20,000 and 30,000 KSH. She finds them very helpful and has been able to buy four acres of farmland where she grows sugar cane. She has been slowly growing and expanding her businesses over the years and recently added a two-family rental house.

With her community based health work, she sees 18 clients a week and often gives them extra meat. She is asking for 50,000 KSH so she can do more farming for sugar cane and increase her acreage. Jane uses some of her extra profit to feed patients.

She wants Kiva lenders to know that the loans she has received have seen her through so many things, she doesn't know how to describe how grateful she is for them.

loans.use: Buy land.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 24-year-old mother of two children ages 9 and 1. The older child is currently in school and Margaret plans on sending her youngest when ready.  She works as a tailor while her husband sells shoes, both in the Nyamasaria slum where they live and work. She is requesting 10,000 KSH which she will use to expand her business, purchase livestock and poultry to increase her food security. In her free time, she takes care of the poultry she currently owns.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia O. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells crates of drinks and hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan of 80 000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She sends thanks to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin E. is 38 years old and married with eight children. He sells and repairs electronics, and is requesting a loan of 50 000 NGN to purchase more electronics to sell. Edwin is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Misitura

texts.en: Misitura A. is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She sells cosmetics and has been in this business for a long time. Misitura is requesting a loan of 50 000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар женщина , которая самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом, сама ездит в Бишкек за товаром, сама продаёт.Дилбар хочет дополнительно получить параллельный займ для завоза весеннего товара.Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов.Дилбар на свой товар ставит маленькую наценку, поэтому она имеет хороший поток клиентов.Микроинвест рад выдавать кредит таким клиентам , как Дилбар,т.к.она имеет хороший моральный облик.
texts.en:
Dilbar runs this business on her own. She travels to Bishkek for items and sells them herself. Dilbar wants to take out a loan for delivery of goods for spring. She has regular customers. Dilbar adds a small markup to her wares. MicroInvest is happy to furnish loans to clients such as Dilbar, because of her upstanding character.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade in children's clothing

loans.name: Sharafbonu

texts.ru: Гафурова Шарафбону 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Она разводит скот во дворе. Дети пасут малый рогатый скот на пастбище, а крупно рогатый скот содержат дома. Муж сажает  арахис в 4 гектара земли, а также лук. Как только поспеет урожай, собирают и продают на рынке. До продажи  скота можно продавать арахис и лук. А потом  когда закончиться посев и урожай, можно и продать скот и жить на этом. Благодаря поддержки Микроинвест развивают свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharafbonu G. was born in 1958, she is married and has 2 children. Sharafbonu has a college education. She raises livestock in her yard. The children take the smaller livestock out to pasture and feed the large livestock at home. Sharafbonu’s husband plants peanuts on 4 hectares of land, he also plants onions. Afterwards when planting and harvesting are over, they can sell their livestock and live on the proceeds. Thanks to the support of MicroInvest they are growing their business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She sells palm oil, both wholesale and retail, to her customers, and has been in this business for a long time.

Mary is requesting a loan of 70 000 NGN to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy N. is 28 years old and married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients, and has been in this business for a long time. Happy is requesting a loan of 70 000 NGN to purchase more stock to sell. She sends thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Aïche

texts.fr:
Madame Aiché C. est une femme mariée de 40 ans, mère de deux enfants qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Sanankoroba  deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Pour des raisons financières, elle quitta très tôt l’école pour exercer le petit commerce d’articles de beauté pour femmes, d’une façon ambulante. Aiché est très réputée pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de l’institution depuis maintenant 5 ans. Après 5 prêts  de groupe (prêt solidaire)  elle est à son quatrième  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Elle compte acheter un important stock de produits de beauté à Bamako (capitale du Mali) de différentes sortes qu’elle va  vendre dans son magasin de Sanankoroba à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 .000 FCFA qui lui permettra de rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à ses propres besoins.
Elle désire dans les jours à venir, augmenter le montant de son prêt pour avoir d’autres articles de meilleure qualité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle croissante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aiché C. is a 40-year old married woman with two children, and lives in a traditional household in Sanankoroba, the second administrative region of the Republic of mali. Due to financial reasons, she left school very early to start a travelling business selling beauty products for women. Aiché is renowned for the quality of her products. In her search for supplementary financial resources, she decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 group (solidarity) loans, she is seeking her fourth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She intends to buy a sizable stock of beauty products of different types in Bamako (the capital of Mali), which she will sell at her store in Sanankoroba to a clientele that is mostly female. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and meet her own needs. In the days to come, she hopes to obtain a larger loan to have other top quality items in order to better satisfy her growing clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for women

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary U., a 36-year-old married mother of three, sells medicine. She started her business in 2006 and hopes to expand it. Rosemary is requesting a loan of 80 000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She sends thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Козибобоева Матлуба 1980 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Она  хорошая домохозяйка и портниха. Дома она шьет платья и другие национальные одежды. Кроме этого она дома содержит скот который после откорма подают на рынке. Также коровы которые у них есть дают молоко. Они продают молоко и другие молочные изделия и на рынке. Таким образом у них есть постоянный источник  дохода. Муж и братья  помогают выводить скот на рынок. С поддержкой мужа и Микроинвест она развивает свой бизнес швеи и откорм скота.
texts.en:
Matluba Koziboboeva was born in 1980, is married and has two children. She has a high school education. Matluba is a good homemaker and dressmaker. She sews dresses and other traditional clothing at home. In addition, she raises livestock that is sold at the market after it is fattened. In addition, cows that they own provide milk. They sell milk and other dairy products at the market. This provides them with a constant source of income. Her husband and brothers help her to drive the livestock to market. With the help of her husband and MicroInvest, Matluba is growing her dressmaking and livestock businesses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Mr. B. is a new member of the Cooperative: he joined in September 2008. He is married and has 6 children. Mr. B. is a "manangiti," the Bisayan term for coconut toddy gatherer.

Guillermo has asked for PHP 2,000.00 as his first loan from the cooperative and PHP 5,000.00 as his present loan amount. He will use it to buy chicks for poultry raising and wood & nails for the repair of his house. After 6 months of membership he has said that Paglaum is really the best of all the micro-finance organizations that he has encountered, because of the unique services they offer that really help.

Mr. B. hopes that his poultry business will be successful and that he will someday have a concrete house. He also wants the rest of his 3 children to finish college.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks for poultry raising

loans.name: Shukur

texts.ru: Шукур пунктуально погасив свой кредит, подал заявку на очередной кредит.Этот займ он хочет потратить на закуп коров и корма для них.Шукур очень опытный в бизнесе животноводства.Его коровы в день дают по 7 литров молока.Из которого его жена производит домашний кефир.Шукур рад сотрудничать с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Shukur after punctually paying off his loan, has applied for another one. He would like to use this loan to purchase cows and feed. Shukur is very experienced in the livestock business. His cows produce 7 liters of milk per day per cow. Shukur’s wife makes homemade yogurt from the milk. Shukur is happy to work together with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows and feed

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Mrs Lydia B. has been a good member of the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC since 2004. She is 44 years old, blessed with four children and married to Benjamin B., a fisherman. Last March 18 Lydia asked for PHP 15,000 for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store, and to acquire fish coral for her husband's fishing materials. They both help each other to support the needs of the family.

loans.use: For sari-sari store inventory and fishing supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda C., 52 years of age, lives in Lao Santa Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is asking for an amount of PHP 7,000 to grow her business. She wants to make a living and at the same have fun with it.  She is comfortable raising pigs which is an advantage of doing it in her own backyard.  She said that Paglaum has been there for all her capital needs. She is positive that one day, her little business will grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for raising pigs

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Coudou

texts.en: Codou S. is 48 years old and has been a member of the Bayof Pout village bank for several years.  She sells fruit and would like a loan to be able to purchase fruit in bulk to resell.  Depending on the season, she normally sells mandarins, watermelons, oranges, mangoes, or melons.  She is married and intends to use the profits from her loan to take care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase fruit for selling.

loans.name: Diouma

texts.en: Diouma is married and has been a member of the Bayof Pout village bank for three and a half years.  She sells fruit in season, which depending on the season, could be mandarins, papayas, oranges, mangoes, and/or melons.  She intends to use the loan to purchase fruits in bulk and to strengthen her business.  The profits will be used to pay for the care of her children.

loans.use: Purchase frut in bulk.

loans.name: Ndèye Fallo

texts.fr: Ndèye F N. est mariée et membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout depuis 03 ans. Son activité est la vente de fruits( mandarines, oranges, melons, pastèques et mangues). Elle achète en gros et revend. Ndèye veut renforcer son commerce pour avoir plus de revenus et faire face à ses besoins familiaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye F N. is married, and has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout for 3 years. Her business consists in selling fruits (mandarins, oranges, melons, watermelons, and mangoes). She buys wholesale and resell. Ndèye wants to bolster her business in order to increase her income to provide for her family. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Sergiu

texts.en:
Sergiu P. grows vegetables, like radishes in greenhouses. He has five years experience.

He requests the loan to purchase seeds of tomato and spare parts for automobile repair.

Sergiu has one swine, one cow and a calf, In the future, he plans to increase the number of animals.

loans.use: Purchase seeds of tomato and spare parts for automobile repair..

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Kodjo a commencé très tôt le commerce de vente de bijoux garanties, il est très dynamique et très travailleur, beaucoup de ses clientes l’apprécient car il est très rare de voir les hommes exercer ce commerce,il fait parfois son commerce de façon ambulante.Il s’approvisionne au BENIN voisin et en Côte d’ivoire. Sa clientèle étant grandissante, il doit par conséquent agrandir son stock pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en bijoux garanties. N’étant pas marié, son statut de célibataire lui permet de bien gérer son activité
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo A. started his business very early on. It consists in selling jewelry, which he sometimes does as an ambulant salesman. Mr. A. is very energetic and hard-working, and many female customers appreciate him because it is uncommon to find a men doing this sort of business. He gets his supplies in Benin and in Côte d'Ivoire. He needs to bolster his stock since his customers are increasing. This is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to get new supplies of necklaces. Being unmarried, he is able to manage his business in a good manner.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She says one in tertiary, while the other is in senior high school.

She works to make some income to support her husband financially, to take care of the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and Ruth is a trader.

Ruth deals in all kinds of textiles – shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. Ruth also treks to villages to sell. Ruth has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. She hopes to improve her living standard and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy bails of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Etant mariée  avec un monsieur qui est assistant médical avec qui elle a eu  02 enfants, cette dame a commencé depuis 2006 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, plus tard afin de diversifier  son commerce elle a associé à la vente de charbons la vente de bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs. Actuellement son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé aussi elle souhaiterai commencer le commerce de maïs cela lui faciliterai aussi l’approvisionnement pour la vente de bouillie, ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES elle demande son deuxième crédit pour acheter 07 sacs de charbons de bois, 04 sacs de maïs et divers produits nécessaires pour son activité
texts.en:
This woman is married to a gentleman who is a medical assistant, with whom she's had two children. In 2006, she started selling sacks of charcoal, and, later, to diversify her business, she also started selling porridge made out of corn flour. She's currently out of stock of charcoal, and also need to get supplies of corn. She's therefore seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 7 sacks of charcoal, 4 sacks of corn, and other products that she needs for her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of charcoal and 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is 37 years old. She is married with four children. All are in school - junior high and primary school. Her husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She cooks rice and stew in her house and sells at the community centre in the mornings. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community. Mariama has been in this business for nineteen years.

Mariama wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is 30 years old. She is a divorced mother of five children. Akua says her children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools.

She works to make income to take care of the family, since she gets support from no where else. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader. She deals in second hand textiles such as bed sheets, shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to villages to sell. Akua has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. She is hopeful to improve her living standard and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: Procure second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Très tôt cette dame a commencé le commerce de pagnes, de tissus, chaussures et divers articles de façon ambulante.son point d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé,elle fait ce commerce depuis 1990 ce qui a fait qu’à ce jour  elle a une parfaite maîtrise de son activité. Elle a une clientèle à majorité composée de femmes, à ce jour le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande élevée de sa clientèle, elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de sortie, des Tissus et pagnes, 20 chaussures  et divers articles. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Very early on, this woman started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, shoes, and various other items, as a saleswoman. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She's been in this business since 1990, and has now learned all its ins and outs. Her clientele is mostly composed of women. At this time, her stock does not enable her to meet high customer demand. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 25 handbags, fabrics and pagnes, 20 pairs of shoes, and various other items. She's married and has four children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 handbags, fabrics and pagnes, 20 pairs of shoes, and various other items

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la contacto fue la Señora Irmina P. quien vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel  D. Ciudad Del Este. Ella es madre D. 2 hijos y ella se dedica a la Venta D. comidas. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Torype Oñondivepa”, está constituido  por 18  señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas D. la misma zona.
  
Las señoras retiran un crédito D. Gs 500.000 a Gs 1200.000 c/u.  El Crédito destinaran a la compra D. mercaderías y artículos D. primera necesidad para la venta.

Irmina E. 	Venta D. Comida 
María P. 	        Modista
Solana R. 	        Modista 
Florinda Báez 	        Venta D. Productos Avon 
Trinidad P. 	Venta D. Comestibles
Felicia E. 	Venta helados
Fidencia P. 	Venta D. Mercería 
María Vázquez 	        Venta Verduras 
Liliana G.	Venta D. Frazadas 
Julia D. G. 	Venta D. Frutas 
Francisca B. 	Venta D. Frutas 
Reina Báez 	        Despensa 
María P. 	        Venta D. Ropa
Zulma G. 	        Venta D. Ropa
Amelia D. 	        Venta D. Hamburguesas
María Pabla O. 	Confección D. Ropa 
Epifania B. 	Venta D. Confites
Patricia F. 	Venta D. Comidas
texts.en:
The group was founded by Mrs. Irmina Portilla. She lives in the area of Barrio San Miguel in the Cuidad Del Este. She has 2 children, and she sells food. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in her area. The group’s name is Torype Oñondivepa. It is maD. up of 18 active and supportive women from the same area. The women are asking for a loan of between $100 and $235 for each member. The loan is to buy merchandise and basic goods to sell. Irmina E. Sells Food María P. Seamstress Solana R. Seamstress Florinda Báez Sells Avon Products Trinidad P. Sells Foodstuffs Felicia E. Sells Ice Cream Fidencia P. Haberdashery María Vázquez Sells Vegetables Liliana G. Sells Blankets Julia D. G. Sells Fruit Francisca B. Sells Fruit Reina Báez Mini Market María P. Sells Clothes Zulma G. Sells Clothes Amelia D. Sells Hamburgers María Pabla O. Makes Clothes Epifania B. Sells Confections Patricia F. Sells Food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, fruit, breads, blankets, clothes, ice cream and basic needs items

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena T. is 23 years old. She is married with one child. According to Abena, her child is yet to attain school age. Abena’s husband is a carpenter by profession while she is a food vendor. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akua cooks and sells rice with stew. She cooks the food in her house and sells by the street in the evenings. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community. She has been in this business for three years.

Akua wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her child in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia F. C. lives in an agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside of the city of Cusco. She has five children, four of whom are also members of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank. Julia and some of her children live in a lovely yellow home with two cows painted on the front, a means to alert passers-by of the milk-selling business she runs from her home. Julia has several cows, which usually yield anywhere from ten to fifteen liters of milk per day. She then sells the milk to an intermediary for 80 centimos (~US 26 cents) per liter. The intermediary then takes the milk to the city of Cusco, where it is resold for 1 nuevo sol (~US 30 cents) per liter. 

Julia is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles in order to help her sons buy a station wagon to use as a taxi. Her two sons currently share a car, which they take turns driving to and around the city of Cusco. They have some money saved, but need another 3,000 nuevos soles to buy a second car. With two taxis, they can work simultaneously and earn twice as much as they currently do. They will also be able to rent out one of the cars to other drivers as an additional source of income.

loans.use: Help sons buy a station wagon

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina B. is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. Currently, the last born is in primary school while the rest are in senior and the junior high schools. Ernestina lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town. Her husband is farmer while she is a trader.

Ernestina trades in eggs. She procures eggs from the poultry farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market and at times travel to nearby markets to sell. Ernestina also supplies eggs to retailers and food vendors (beverage sellers).

Ernestina has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin to cater for her children.

loans.use: Procure crates of eggs.

loans.name: Benedicta Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 66 years old and lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside the city of Cusco. Aquilina is a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank, along with six of her children: Damiana, Jose Luis, Juan Carlos, Luis Alberto, Basilia Sulema and Rosa, the group's current president. 

Aquilina buys beans, grains and potatoes from area farmers and brings them to Cusco to resell. She has been in this business since she was very young. Aquilina currently works with her daughter, Sulema, who has her own market stall in Cusco. Aquilina is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy more potatoes to sell in the city.

Aquilina has been a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank for about five years and has always been very responsible about making her repayments on time. The group's loan officer, Franklin, says that it's often considered a bad idea to have many family members participate in one village bank (because many individuals are dependent on a single business, or may all be taking out money to give to a single family member). However, Aquilina and her six children are involved in different businesses, are long-time Arariwa clients, and have always been very reliable.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to sell in Cusco

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products and implement her food sales business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu B. is 32 years old. She is a widowed mother of three children. All of her children are in primary school or junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.

Salamatu is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She purchases cosmetics such as creams, body spray, powder, etc. from wholesalers in the nearby towns. She sells in the local market and, at times, treks to nearby markets to sell. Salamatu has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase different kinds of cosmetics in bulk so she can increase her profit margin to care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela H. is a member of the San Pedro D. Katañiray Village Bank, along with her daughter, Irma. Manuela is a grandmother and a widow. She lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about one hour outsiD. of the city of Cusco. Her village bank, maD. up of 21 members, meets once a month at the local church to make their repayments and attend training and educational sessions.

Like many others in Anta, Manuela travels to Cusco to work, since there are many business opportunities in the city and very few in the area where she lives. Manuela brings milk from local farms to Cusco to sell from door to door. Depending on the season, she also buys and sells broad beans (habas), potatoes and cheeses. Manuela is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy potatoes from local farmers, which she will sell in Cusco.

Manuela has been a member of the San Pedro D. Katañiray Village Bank for multiple loan cycles and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual. She has pledged to make each of her repayments in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to resell in Cusco

loans.name: Kuña Tekorory Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la contacto fue la Señora Joquina Vda. de Sanchez quien vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel  de Ciudad Del Este. Ella es madre de 5 hijos y ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Kuña Tekorory”, está constituido por 16 señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas de la misma zona.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de comidas, sabanas , ropas ,etc.  Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 1100.000 c/u. El crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.

Severiana M. 	Venta De Sabana.
Lurdes F. 	Venta de Comida 
Delia B. 	Venta de Cosméticos 
María M. 	Despensa 
Idalina B.	Despensa 
Feliciana C. 	Venta de Comida 
Norma M. 	Despensa
María C.	Despensa 
Petrona G. 	Venta De Comida 
Rosa C. 	Venta de Verduras
Lucia Solís 	Venta de Azúcar
Isabel B. 	Despensa 
Maria V. 	Venta de Cortinas 
Cinthia P. 	Venta de Joyas de Plata 
Cintia G. 	Venta de Hamburguesas
Antonia M. 	Venta de Ropa
texts.en:
In forming this group, the main contact was Mrs. Joquina Vda. de Sanchez, who lives in the Barrio San Miguel neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She is the mother of five children, and she works selling chickens. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in this neighborhood. The group is called “Kuña Tekorory” and consists of 16 very active and united women, all from the same area. They have different activities like selling food, blankets, clothing, etc. The ladies are taking out a loan of 300,000 to 1,100,000 guaranis each. The credit will be used to purchase merchandise and primary necessities for selling. Severiana M. - Blanket sales Lurdes F. - Food sales Delia B. - Cosmetics sales María M. - Shop Idalina B. - Shop Feliciana C. - Food sales Norma M. - Shop María C. - Shop Petrona G. - Food sales Rosa C. - Vegetable sales Lucia Solís - Sugar sales Isabel B. - Shop Maria V. - Curtain sales Cinthia P. - Silver jewelry sales Cintia G. - Hamburger sales Antonia M. - Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, cosmetics, clothing, groceries, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside the city of Cusco. Luis Alberto is a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank, along with his mother and five of his brothers and sisters: Damiana, Jose Luis, Juan Carlos, Basilia Sulema and Rosa, the group's current president.

Luis Alberto has been working as a taxi driver for the past two years and has his own car. He is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles to perform maintenance on his taxi.

Luis Alberto is beginning his second loan cycle with the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank. His mother and some of his siblings have been members of the bank for more than five years. The group's loan officer, Franklin, says that it's often considered a bad idea to have many family members participate in one village bank. Franklin suggests this because many individuals are often dependent on a single business, or may all be taking out money to give to a single family member. However, Luis Alberto and his family have always been very reliable clients. Luis Alberto has pledged to repay his Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B., 31, is married and a mother of four children, two males and two females. All of her children are in school – junior high and the basic schools. Rebecca lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason by trade.

She works very hard to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Rebecca runs a grocery store in her community. She sells products such as tins of milk, sugar, bread, milo, etc. She has been in this business for two years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She hopes to sponsor all of her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To procure goods for a grocery store

loans.name: Basilia Sulema

texts.en:
Sulema is married and has two young school-age children. She lives in a predominately rural, agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside of the city of Cusco. Sulema is a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank, along with her husband, her mother, and five of her brothers and sisters. The group consists of 21 members from the area, most of whom are friends, neighbors, and family members. Sulema's husband drives a taxi, and she works with her mother, Aquilina. She buys potatoes from local farmers, then resells them from her market stall in the city of Cusco.

Sulema is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more potatoes to resell in Cusco. Sulema is a long-time member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual. Her group's loan officer, Franklin, says that it's often considered a bad idea to have many family members participate in one village bank. Franklin suggests this because many individuals are dependent on a single business, or may all be taking out money to give to a single family member. However, Sulema, her mother, her husband, and her siblings are involved in different businesses and have always been very reliable clients. She has pledged to repay each installment of her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to resell in Cusco

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina es una madre amorosa y muy preocupada por el bienestar de su familia, vive en su propia casa, con sus 3 hijos; Omar de 22, Adolfo de 17 y Oliver de 14, a los cuales quiere dar una buena educación. Dina divide su tiempo entre dos negocios, tiene una tienda de abarrotes y unas cabinas de internet, ella trabaja desde que amanece, atendiendo a los clientes que concurren a su tienda muy temprano, a quienes siempre recibe con una sonrisa. A las 9 de la mañana abre su otro negocio, las cabinas de internet, esta actividad es muy rentable, debido a la gran demanda que hay por el servicio de Internet. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es atender los dos negocios a la vez, por eso cada vez que pueden sus hijos la ayudan a atender sus cabinas. Lleva 5 años realizando ambas actividades y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, anhela hacer crecer sus dos negocios y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Dina con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual, ya que ahorró mucho para pagarlo, en su banco comunal es una socia  muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Dina is a loving mother who is very worried about the wellbeing of her family. She lives in her own home with her three children: Omar, 22; Adolfo, 17; and Oliver 14, all of whom she wants to have a good education. Dina divides her times between two businesses. She has a grocery store and Internet cubicles. She works from sunrise, tending to customers who come to her store very early and always receive a smile. At 9 in the morning she opens her other business, Internet cubicles, which is a very lucrative business thank to the high demand there is for Internet service. The most difficult thing is tending to the two businesses at the same time, so her children help her out with the Internet cubicles anytime they can. She has done both activities for five years, and the thing she enjoys the most is talking with her customers and finding out about what's going on in the community. Her goal is to grow both businesses and thus grow economically as well. This is Dian's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she was very punctual with her first since she had already saved a lot to pay for it. She is a very happy and supportive member of her community bank. With the money she is requesting she will purchase more products to better set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is 46 years old. She is married and a mother with two children. Currently one is in the university and the last born is also in senior high school. Her husband works with a cocoa nut grove hotel. They live together in their hometown called Elmina in the central region of Ghana.

Araba loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She has been selling yams, gari (cassava grits), cassava, and plantains for twenty years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of food items from the farmers. This saves her the expense of middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, she wants to buy yams, gari, plantains and cassava in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to keep her children in school. Araba belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Beba’ meaning "God will come". She would be grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty-five years old. She is married with five children, two males and three females. One of her children is pursuing a tertiary programme and another in senior high school. The rest are in junior high and the basic schools.

Adwoa is a businesswoman. She sells all kinds of goods. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adwoa sells items such as yams, maize, clothes, cosmetics, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby towns and villages and sells in the local market square. Adwoa also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years. She wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to send her children to school up to high levels.

loans.use: To procure goods for re-sale

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny es una mujer soltera, que a sus 25 años lucha por mejorar su futuro, vive en un cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a Puno desde su natal Desaguadero (Distrito de Puno) y espera forjarse una buena vida. Desde muy niña le gustó la cocina, sentía mucha felicidad jugando con los utensilios de su madre y le encantaba verla cocinar para toda su familia, actualmente tiene una tienda de utensilios de cocina en el centro de la ciudad, ella trae los utensilios desde Desaguadero y los vende a muy buen precio a los clientes que concurren a su tienda. Lleva ya 5 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es escoger los novedosos modelos que traerá para vender a Puno, ya que le gusta ver que sus clientes tengan una gran variedad de dónde escoger. Lo que no le gusta es tener que viajar constantemente para adquirir los utensilios, puesto que se cansa mucho en el camino. Fanny desea que su tienda sea más grande en el futuro y se convierta en una de las más importantes de la ciudad. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, puesto que sabe que ellas confían plenamente en ella. Fanny invertirá los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados en comprar más mercadería de para abastecer mejor sus tienda de utensilios.
texts.en:
Fanny is a single woman, who at her 25 years of age fights to improve her life in the future. She lives in a room she rented when she arrived in Puno from her native Desaguadero (Puno District) and she hopes to forge a good life for her. Since she was a little girl he liked cooking, she was very happy playing with the tools of her mother and she loved watching her cook for all her family. At present, she has a store of kitchen tools in the center of the city, she brings the tools from Desaguadero and sells them at very good price to her clients. She has had her business for 5 years and what she likes more is to choose the novelty products that she brings to sell to Puno since he likes seeing her clients having a big variety to choose from. What she doesn't like is having to travel constantly to acquire the tools, since she gets very tired from the trip. Fanny wishes to have a bigger store in the fututre and to turn into one of the most important of the city.This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva's partner) and she is ready to repay all of her quotas on time, since she doesn't want to affect the other partners of her communal bank, because she knows that they trust her. Fanny will invest the loan in buying more merchandise to better supply her kitchen tools store.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.en:
Zenovia is 50 years old and married with three sons, all of whom are now working adults. Her oldest son drives a taxi, her middle son works on a cruise ship and speaks English, and her youngest son is a tour guiD. in the Cusco area and is also studying languages. She is very proud of her children and their accomplishments, and speaks about them lovingly.

Zenovia has a restaurant where she serves different meals throughout the day. She serves mostly traditional Cusqueñan food, like fried beef, breaded trout, and baked cuy (guinea pig). She usually works at the restaurant all day (her niece fills in for her when she has to go to her monthly village bank meetings or run other errands). She has had her restaurant since 1998, the same year she first joined a village bank at Asociacion Arariwa. Zenovia is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy more meat, rice, vegetables, and oil for the restaurant. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy meat, rice vegetables and oil

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is 54 years old; she is divorced but a mother two children, one girl and a boy. Currently both her children are independent. She got divorced 17 years ago, after her husband disappeared out of the blue and never informed her he was going. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana.

Elizabeth is a trader who deals with assorted products such as cooking utensils, clothing, ladies' slippers, etc. and mostly sells through hawking, that is house-to-house selling. She has been in the trade for 22 years now. With her humorous behavior, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her.

Elizabeth treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She request a loan amount to buy more supplies of such products as cooking utensils, clothing, and ladies' slippers, which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers.

With the loan she should be able to make lots of profit to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She belongs to a village bank called Bethel. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of  cooking utensils, clothing, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Djimba Labo

texts.fr: Madame T. Djimba Labo-pou  est une résidente du quartier de hedzranawoé, un quartier de Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de casse croûte faite à base de farine de blé, de sucre, d'arachide, d'huile et de beurre, ensuite mise à chaud dans un four puis mise en bouteille et en sachets, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004 les gens viennent acheter les casses croûtes chez elle pour leur occasion de fête ou d’événements heureux, elle a aussi la chance de vendre à côté d’une école, à la sortie les écoliers viennent acheter les casses croûtes en sachets chez elle. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de produits de première nécessité entrant dans la préparation des casses croûtes notamment 4 bols de farine de blé, 2 bols et demi de sucre,  1 sachets de beurre et 3 litres d’huile. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants
texts.en:
Ms. T. Djimba Labo-Pou is a resident of Hedzranawoé, a district of Lomé. Her work involves selling snacks made from wheat flour, sugar, peanuts, oil, and butter. It’s baked and then put into bottles and bags. She started this business in 2004. People come to buy the snacks from her for holidays and happy events. She also has the opportunity to make sales next to a school. There, at the exit, the students come to her to buy the packaged snacks.

Wanting to expand her stock of goods, she’s requesting a loan to buy the necessary ingredients for making snacks, particularly four bowls of flour, two and a half bowls of sugar, one bag of butter, and three liters of oil. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, peanuts, butter, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. All of her children attend school - junior high and the basic schools. She is a seamstress by profession. Elizabeth lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

She owns a shop where she works as a seamstress. Elizabeth procures all kinds of materials from Kumasi and sews many designs for sale. She also sews for clients who come with their own materials. Elizabeth says she has some apprentices, who she is training currently. According to her, a number of the apprentices have graduated and run their own businesses. She has been in the sewing business for 26 years.

She requests a loan to procure more fabric and other sewing accessories. She hopes to pay for her children's school at higher levels.

loans.use: Procure fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es una mujer que ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, a sus 59 años vive en la casa de su hermana, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Cuando Filomena llegó a la ciudad de Puno, hace 40 años, desde su natal Ilave (Distrito de Puno), no se imaginó que se convertiría en una de las distribuidoras de materiales de construcción más importantes de la ciudad. Actualmente trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (Distrito de Puno, límite con Bolivia) la mercadería, ya que le sale más barato y la distribuye por las ferreterías de la ciudad a un muy buen precio, lo que hace que tenga mucha demanda.
Filomena disfruta de salir a distribuir los materiales de construcción, ya que le da la libertad de recorrer la ciudad libremente, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es traer la mercadería desde tan lejos, puesto que le resulta cansado. Anhela tener su propia tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los materiales de construcción, ya que desea tener una vejez pacífica y sin necesidades. Es el primer préstamo de Filomena con MFP y se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad, tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales de construcción para distribuirlos a más ferreterías.
texts.en:
Filomena is a woman who has fought hard to stand out in life. At her age of 59 she lives at the house of her sister, and her biggest wish to have a calm old age. When Filomena came to the city of Puno 40 years ago, from her native Ilave (District of Puno), she never imagined that she become one of most important distributors of construction materials of the city.
