At present she brings the merchandise from the city of Desaguadero (District of Puno, border with Bolivia), since it is cheaper and then she distributes all the products among the hardware stores of the city at a very good price, for this reason she has great demand. Filomena enjoys going out to distribute the construction materials, since it gives her the freedom of covering the city freely. She has been doing this activity for 14 years and the most difficult thing for her is having to bring the merchandise from that far, because she gets really tired. Her wish is to have her own shop where she could sell the construction materials herself, since she wants to have a calm old age and without needs. It is the Filomena's first loan with MFP (Kiva's partner) and she feels very happy for this opportunity and she wants to repay her quotas on time, since she wants to have access to other loans later. With the requested loan she will buy more construction materials to distribute them to more hardware stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana C. is 30 years old, single, and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is a trader and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags, and cloth for the past three years. Joana says her working capital was provided by herself, but is not adequate for her business. She is not able to purchase high quality products.

She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality and large quantity to scale up sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies' wear, cloth, and slippers to increase her inventory. Joana mostly sells through hawking that is house-to-house selling. She believes that your support will enrich the success of her business. She belongs to a village bank called Maranatha.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, cloth, and slippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité fue la Señora Blanca O. quien vive en la zona del km 7 ½ Bº Maria Auxiliadora Ciudad Del Este. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está constituido por 21 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.  Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta de Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, Ajo, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, Trapo de piso, detergente, suavizante, Carnes etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 800.000 c/u.  El crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.

Miran I.	Venta de Plásticos
 Teófila G.	Despensa
Blanca O.	Costura
Mirian Pereira	Cantina
Maria B.	Venta De Pollo y Huevo
Ana Maria R.	Despensa
Rosani S.	Venta de Verdura
Mirian R.	Venta de Comidas
Sabina R.	Venta De Huevo
Maria Luisa F.	Venta de Ropa
Catalina M.	Venta de Ropa
Idalina A.	Venta de Verdura
Valentina V.	Copetín
Nancy B.	Venta de Bebidas
Catalina V.	Venta de Ropa
Luz Álvarez	Despensa
Gloria A.	Venta de Bijouteries
Blanca T.	Venta de Cosméticos
Ana C.	Venta de Ropa
Fidelina Vázquez	Copetín
Liz A.	Costura
texts.en:
This group was formed by Mrs. Blanca O., who lives in Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in this neighborhood. This group, called “Maria Auxiliadora”, consists of 21 very active and united women from the same area. They have different activities like selling pants, T-shirts, tomatoes, onions, garlic, face creams, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, floor coverings, detergent, fabric softener, meats, etc. Others are starting a new job and need a fixed income. The ladies are taking out a loan of 300,000 to 800,000 guaranis each. They will use the loan to buy merchandise and primary necessities to sell. Miran I. - Plastics sales Teófila G. - Shop Blanca O. - Tailoring Mirian Pereira - Cantina Maria B. - Chicken and egg sales Ana Maria R. - Shop Rosani S. - Vegetable sales Mirian R. - Food sales Sabina R. - Egg sales Maria Luisa F. - Clothing sales Catalina M. - Clothing sales Idalina A. - Vegetable sales Valentina V. - Snack sales Nancy B. - Beverage sales Catalina V. - Clothing sales Luz Álvarez - Shop Gloria A. - Jewelry sales Blanca T. - Cosmetics sales Ana C. - Clothing sales Fidelina Vázquez - Snack sales Liz A. - Tailoring

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, chickens, cosmetics, caramels, beverages, blankets, plastics, clothing, groceries, ice creams, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura a sus 35 años ha decidido hacer progresar el negocio que tiene, vive en L. casa que le dejaron sus padres, junto a sus 2 hijos; Ronaldo D. 3 años y Rosmeri D. 6 meses. Laura sabe lo que es trabajar sin descanso, incentivada por el amor a sus hijos trabaja arduamente en L. venta D. chocolate con leche, actividad que realiza desD. muy temprano en las ferias D. L. Ciudad D. Juliaca. Su día comienza a las 5 D. L. mañana, cuando se levanta a preparar el delicioso chocolate que luego lleva para vender a las personas que desean tomar una bebida caliente a esas horas D. L. mañana. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene el resto del día para dedicarse a otras actividades, como cuidar a sus hijos o realizar un trabajo eventual que se presente. Lleva 3 años realizando es negocio y anheL. tener un puesto donD. pueda vender su chocolate con mayor comodidad, lo más difícil D. su trabajo es salir tan temprano todos los días y soportar el intenso frió que hace, pero aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo, ya que quiere darle a sus hijos un buen futuro. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo cual se siente en L. responsabilidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a muchos más, en su banco comunal le tienen mucho cariño ya que es muy solidaria. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados con para comprar más ingredientes para preparar su delicioso chocolate con leche, además adquirirá ollas para aumentar L. cantidad D. porciones.
texts.en:
Laura at her 35 years of age has decided to make her business progress, she lives in the house that her parents left to her. She has two children, Ronaldo who is 3 years old and Rosmeri who is 6 months old. Laura knows what is to work without rest, encouraged by the love to her children, she works hard selling chocolate milk. She sells her product very early at the fairs of the City of Juliaca. Her day starts at 5 a.m., when he gets up to prepare the delicious chocolate that then takes to the fairs to sell the people who want to have a warm drink at these early hours of the morning. What she likes more about her work is that she has the rest of the day to do other activities, like to take care of her children or do some other last minute job. She has had this business for 3 years, and her wish is to have a stand where she could sell her chocolate milk with more comfort for her and her clients. The most difficult part of her work is having to go out so early every day and to endure the intense cold, but nevertheless she knows that she has to do it because she wants to give her children a good future. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva's partner), and she feels the responsibility of repaying on time, since she wants to have access to many more. With the requested loan besides buying more ingredients to prepare her delicious chocolate milk, she will also acquire pans to increase the quantity of the portions.

Translated from Spanish by Ana GabrieL. Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare the chocolate milk she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to set up her grocery store

loans.name: Yanet Luisa

texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. Two of her children are adults, while the youngest is in fifth grade. For the past 12 years, Yanet has worked in a hair salon, where she does cuts, color, perms, highlights and any other service that her clients request.

Yanet is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to put towards paying for her children’s education. Her two older children are studying nursing and accounting, and both are almost ready to graduate. After her children graduate from college, Yanet’s dream is to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: Pay for children's college education

loans.name: Miyagi

texts.es: Miyagi es un joven muy alegre, tiene 20 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares, ya que se siente en la responsabilidad de darles una vejez tranquila. Aunque todavía es muy joven, ya ha incursionado en el comercio de aderezos, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo hace con mucho gusto, ya que sabe que así puede ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, él divide su tiempo entre su negocio y sus estudios universitarios, los cuales no descuida, ya que quiere ser un buen profesional y no defraudar a sus padres. Lo que más le gusta es que con su negocio evita que sus padres trabajen más de lo necesario y tengan más tiempo para ellos, anhela ver crecer su negocio y tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus condimentos. Lo más difícil para él es moler, debido a que las espacias molidas cuando vuelan por el aire le irritan los ojos, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar con lo que ha comenzado y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer crédito y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es un joven muy atento y alegre, que disfruta de trabajar con las demás socias. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más hierbas y condimentos; además de otro molino para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Miyagi is a very happy young man. He is 20 years old and lives at home with his parents, whom he wants to help with family expenses and feels responsible for giving them tranquility in old age. Although he is still very young, he already has familiarized himself in the commerce of seasonings. He has seven years experience in the activity and does it with a lot of pleasure since he knows he will be able to help his parents with expenses. He divides his time between his business and his university studies, which he does not neglect because he wants to be a good professional and not disappoint his parents. What he most enjoys is that with the business his parents don't have to work more than what's necessary and they have more time to themselves. His goal is to grow his business and have a very large store where he can sell her seasonings and condiments. Grinding is the most difficult part of his work because the spices can get into the air and irritate his eyes, but he knows that he has to continue what he has started and wants to work very hard to make headway. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he was very punctual with his first loan and hopes to be timely with this one as well. He is a very attentive and happy young man at his community bank who enjoys working with the other members. With the money he is requesting he will purchase more herbs and spices, as well as another mill to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another mill and more spices

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy Q. is 52 years old. She is divorced and the mother of five children. Two of her children are independent (married) and the rest are in school. She has been in trading on top of a table for thirty years now, taking care of the home. She divorced her husband when he refused to accept responsibility for the children needs.

She sells food spices other food ingredients like onions, tomatoes, etc., in the community market where she lives. She also sells dried fish and smoked fish to her existing customers. She purchases most of her goods from the main market of Cape Coast and retails them to the community. She has been struggling to buy more from the market. She requests a loan to buy foodstuffs like spices and other ingredients. She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. Lucy belongs to a village bank called ‘Maranatha’.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, spices and smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia es una mujer que desde muy joven supo lo que es trabajar duro, vive en su propia casa, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, Elías de 12, Andrés de 10 y Luisa de 7 años, espera poder mejorar su vida, para darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos. Sale desde muy temprano de su casa a vender sus deliciosos panes, camina junto a su inseparable triciclo por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, en espera de encontrar un cliente que le compre su producto. Los deliciosos panes que vende Octavia son preparados por su esposo, quien desde las 3 de la madrugada hornea los panes con mucha paciencia y tranquilidad, para luego dárselos a su esposa para que los venda. Lo que más le gusta a Octavia de su trabajo, es que mientras vende puede ir saboreando los panes que horneo su esposo y así evita pasar hambre, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y anhela tener una panadería más adelante donde pueda vender sus panes con una mayor comodidad, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace por las mañanas, lo cual la ha llevado a estar enferma muchas veces. Octavia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida, puesto que con el primer préstamo pudo terminar de construir su horno, ahora espera pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y no perjudicar a su banco comunal. Con lo mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará un nuevo triciclo para llevar a vender sus panes, ya que hace unas semanas sufrió el robo del suyo, lo cual ha perjudicado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Octavia is a woman who learned to work hard at an early age. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three sons, Elias (12), Andrés (10), and Luisa (7). She hopes to improve her quality of life in order to provide her children with a good education. She leaves the house early to sell her delicious breads, walking with her inseparable tricycle cart on the streets of the city of Juliaca, hoping to find customers. The breads Octavia sells are made by her husband, who patiently bakes them at 3:00 in the morning to give to his wife to sell. What Octavia loves most about her work is that she can savor the bread her husband bakes and avoid hunger. She has spent 8 years doing this and longs for her own store where she can sell her bread comfortably since the most difficult part of her job is braving the intense cold in the morning, which has often made her sick. This is Octavia's second loan with MFP and she is very grateful; she used the first loan to finish building an oven. She will pay her loan back on time to avoid hurting her local bank. With this new 1500 sole loan she will buy a new cart to sell bread since her old one was stolen a few weeks ago, hurting her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace her stolen tricycle cart for selling bread

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is 38 years old and married. She has given birth to three kids. Currently all are in school in the community where they live. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread, or taken with what we called 'Kose'. 'Kose' is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales. She hopes to earn a good income to support her kids in school. She treks to Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. With the loan, she believes she can buy more from the farmers which will prevent her from having to travel frequently.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 46 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children: two daughters, who are 22 and 12, and a son who is 14. Maria Elena runs a bar/restaurant in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. She has had the restaurant for many years, and serves a variety of meals: soups, breakfasts, and a daily set lunch for 3 soles (US$1). Most of the food she serves is traditional local food, like rice with eggs. She usually works alone, though sometimes her children help her.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients to prepare meals (like rice, eggs, oil and meat). Her goal for the future is to have a large restaurant of her own. She smiles and her eyes sparkle when she talks about the restaurant of her dreams.

loans.use: Buy rice, eggs, oil and meat

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es: Ursula tiene 34 años, vive alquilada en la casa de uno de sus familiares, junto a su esposo y a sus 4 hijos; Milagros de 17, Luis de 14, Kevin de 10 y Antonela de 1 año y 4 meses, a quienes desea darles una buena vida. Para Ursula alquilar vestidos es una distracción más que un trabajo, desde que era niña siempre le gustó probarse la ropa de sus hermanas y ver cuáles combinaban mejor. Actualmente tiene un stand en una céntrica galería de la ciudad de Puno, en la cual atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y felicidad. Lleva ya 4 años realizando este negocio y disfruta mucho de hacerlo, ya que le gusta aconsejar a sus clientes sobre qué vestido les quedará mejor. Ursula desea en el futuro tener una tienda muy grande, donde no solo alquile vestidos, sino que también pueda vender ropa juvenil, lo más difícil de su trabajo es cuidar y mantener los vestidos, puesto que estos siempre tienen que estar bonitos y nuevos, para que sean alquilados con mayor facilidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por las demás socias, ya que es muy activa y solidaria. Ursula invertirá los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita en comprar más vestidos, para implementar mejor su stand y tener una mayor variedad para mostrar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ursula is 34 years old. She rents from a relative with her husband and 4 children, Milagros (17), Luis (14), Kevin (10) and Antonela (16 months). She hopes to give them a good life. For Ursula, renting out dresses is more an enjoyable pastime than a job; since she was young she always enjoyed trying out and matching her sisters' clothing. She has a stand in a shopping gallery in the center of the city of Puno, in which she kindly and happily serves her customers. She has spent four years in this business and enjoys it very much, since she likes advising her customers which dress looks best on them. She hopes to own a large store in the future in which she would not only rent dresses but also sell children's clothing. The hardest part of her work is caring for the dresses, as they must always be pretty and new so that they are easy to rent. This is her second loan with MFP; she has always been timely with her payments and will be so now. She is well-loved at her local bank by the other members since she is very active and supportive. She will use the 1500 new soles for more dresses in order to improve her stand and provide more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new dresses to rent to customers

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is 41 years old. She is a married woman with six children. Her first-born is still in the senior high school and the rest are still in school. She lives at Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Her husband is a taxi driver and has driven for more than three years.

For the past 7 years she is been baking and preparing pastries like chips, cake, doughnuts, etc. She bakes bread and other pastries and supplies them to the villages around her and also sells some through hawking. Demand for the pastries has increased as a result of her having a constant supply and just-in-time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they arrive, their order is ready. She says that the price of commodities is increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market.

Kate needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood to restock her inventory. She said your assistance would be much welcome and helpful to her. Kate belongs to a village bank called ‘Yehyebre,’ which means Destiny.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina K. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children. All her children attend school in the community of Elmina of Cape Coast where she lives. Her husband has been supportive to her in terms of taking care of the children. Her husband drives a taxi cab in the community.

Georgina is a designer who designs tie-dyed batik. As creative as she is, she has attracted lots of customers. Apart from the tie-dye business she also sells plastic products like lunch boxes, basins, cups, etc., and she sells through hawking. She has been selling these for six years now.

Georgina sells at a tourist area where lots of tourists buy tie-dyed dresses, but she claims that demand for tie-dye has fallen due to a reduction in the fishing catch. She requests a loan to buy a stock of raw materials for the tie-dye batik and plastics. With her strength alone, she says she can’t do it. She therefore asks for your help. Georgina belongs to a village bank called ‘Yehyebre,’ which means Destiny.

loans.use: To buy materials, dye and plastic products.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old and a widow with two children: a 20-year-old son and a 15-year old daughter. Juana is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank in Cusco, Peru. She has an auto accessory/car parts store in Wanchaq, a commercial district of Cusco. She has been running the store for the past 11 or 12 years. It belonged to her husband, and when he passed away, she took it over. She sells replacement parts and accessories like lights, seatbelts and fan belts.

Juana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more accessories to sell in her store. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

Juana’s dream for the future is to buy a plot of land to build her own house on and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: Buy car parts/accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is 42 years old. She is a widow with four children. Her first-born is still in senior high school and the rest are still schooling. She lives at Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Her husband died through a prolonged illness and that was three years ago. The family responsibility rests on her shoulders as a single parent.

Elizabeth is a caterer who takes orders from customers and prepares things like cake, bread, chips, etc. She makes a survival from this business and has done this business for nineteen years now. She also sells some of those through hawking.

Elizabeth says that demand for her pastries and other foodstuffs have increased as a result of constant supply and on-time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it should be ready. She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market.

Elizabeth needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, an additional electric oven, and firewood etc. to restock her inventory. She said your assistance would be very welcome and helpful to her. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yehyebre’ which means "Destiny".

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, an electric oven, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 28 años, es natural D. L. ciudad D. Huánuco, vive con Patricia, su esposa y su hija Stefany D. 9 años D. edad, en su casa propia. Él es chofer D. un minibús, en el cual su esposa es L. cobradora, trabajan juntos desD. hace 9 años, estando muy contentos, ya que pueden estar juntos a lo largo del día y generar los ingresos necesarios para los gastos D. su hogar y L. educación D. su pequeña Stefany. DesD. que era muy niño siempre le han gustado los carros, es por eso que está ahorrando para en un futuro pueda comprar su minibús propio y trabajar con su esposa, para no tener que pagar un porcentaje D. ganancias al dueño D. L. movilidad. Jorge espera hacer D. sus sueños una pronta realidad, ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque muchas veces el tráfico y el movimiento suelen ser muy estresantes, pero aún así, piensa trabajar mucho más en beneficio D. su familia, a quienes espera brindarles lo mejor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita realizará una revisión técnica del carro para brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old, from the city of Huánuco. He lives in his own house with his wife Patricia and their 9-year-old daughter Stefany. He drives a minibus which his wife conducts; they have been working together for nine years. They are very happy together since they can spend most of the day together and earn the money needed for household expenses and Stefany's education. Jorge has always loved cars since he was a child and is saving money so that in future he can buy his own minibus and work with his wife without having to pay a percentage of his earnings to the bus' owner. He wants to make his dreams a reality soon, as he enjoys his work (though the traffic can be stressful) he wants to work more to proviD. the best for his family. This is his first loan with MFP, and he plans to pay it back on time. With this loan he will be able to get an auto inspection and proviD. better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Service and inspection for the minibus he drives

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la sra. AUGUSTA, ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba, en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, tiene 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años de edad y están estudiando en la etapa superior.

La socia alterna sus labores domésticas con la dirección de su pequeña tienda abarrotes ubicada en su misma casa, de este modo junto a sus esposo dan a sus hijos una mejor educación y desean que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar productos no perecibles y de este modo implementar mas su tienda abarrotes, para tener mejores ingresos.

La socia se compromete a hacer efectivo el pago de su préstamo en el tiempo programado y de manera total quedando muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindaron de hacer realidad sus sueños personales.
texts.en:
Augusta is 49 years old and married. She was born in the province of Urubamba, in the heart of the sacred valley of the Inca. She has two children, 22 and 24 years old, studying in higher education. She juggles housework with running a small grocery store in her own house with her husband in order to provide a good education to their children. She hopes that they will become professionals. She needs a loan to buy non-perishable goods and improve her grocery store in order to raise her income. She promises to pay the loan back as scheduled and is entirely grateful for the opportunity you are providing her to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba G. is forty-five years old and a petty trader. She is divorced with three children. All are currently attending school through the help of government free compulsory education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them better future life. She divorced when her husband was not faithful to her, she said.

Through the help of God, Aba owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stocks of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to repay the loan on time because she believes the loan will boost her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called "God is alive".

loans.use: to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married, with three daughters, who are 18, 14 and 8 years old. Bertha has a snack bar/pub in the Santiago neighborhood of Cusco, where she prepares traditional Cusqueñan food like soups and ribs. She has had her restaurant for the past 20 years, and runs it with the help of her children and her husband.

Bertha is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to improve her restaurant and buy more ingredients to prepare meals (like rice, oil and meat). She has been a member of her village bank at Asociacion Arariwa for two or three years now, and has been a responsible client. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

Bertha’s dream for the future is to provide her three daughters with a good education. “That’s why I work,” she says.

loans.use: Improve restaurant, buy rice, oil and meat

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is 42 years old. She is married with five children and all her children are currently in school. Her husband is a terrazzo contractor; she said her husband has been very supportive to her, especially in the upbringing of the children.

Augustina owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently requested by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education. Augustina belongs to a village bank called "God is alive". She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old and married with five children. Her older children are in college, while her youngest son is just four years old. Marcelina buys and sells foods like rice, dried olives, corn, sugar, and spices. She buys her products straight from farmers or producers, then resells them to local stores. She also sells her goods to cooks for tour groups hiking the Inca Trail, a four-day, three-night excursion that leaves daily from Cusco. She receives regular orders from her clients, and buys her wares at the Saturday market in Wanchaq. She has been in this business for the past ten years, so she has a number of regular customers. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more dried foods to sell. She invests most of her profits in her children’s education, of whom the three oldest study tourism at the local university. She is very proud of her children, and her goal for the future is to open her own tourism agency with their help.

Marcelina has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

loans.use: Buy dried foods (rice, corn, oil, sugar, spices)

loans.name: Awo

texts.en:
Awo M. is thirty-nine years old. She is widowed and the mother of twins (a boy and a girl) who are currently in school. Her husband died through a lorry accident two years ago, so the responsibility of her family rests on her. She has been a local manufacturer of coconut oil for eight years now. Coconut oil is produced from coconut. The coconuts are processed through several stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like “banku," “waakye,” and fried fish. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side. As a result of low working capital, she cannot afford a machine for processing the coconuts.

Awo wants to use this loan to buy more coconuts from coastal areas like Cape Coast and an electric milling machine to increase her output efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support her family and their education. Awo belongs to a village bank called God is alive. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and a milling machine

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy A. is 33 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school, while the youngest is still breastfeeding. She is supportive of her loving husband, an electrician, who wires people's houses with hydroelectric power. She lives at Elmina, a coastal area in the central region of Ghana. Dorothy is hardworking, trading in fresh fish and hawking ladies' underwear. She buys the fresh fish from fishermen and sells them by the seashore to her loyal customers. Dorothy has been selling fish for seven years now. She manages to combine her two businesses by ascertaining when the market is good for her varied products. She says the catch of fish has dropped drastically, which has increased the cost of fish in the market place. She requests a loan to buy more fish. With the loan, she believes that she can be more of a resource to support her husband in taking care of their family. Dorothy belongs to a village bank called Holy Cross.

loans.use: To buy fish and ladies' clothing for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia MARIBEL; Es natural del distrito de Calca de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene 39 años  de edad y es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos  de 18 y 3 años.

La socia Maribel solicita el préstamo en razón de que ella tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de carnes rojas, para lo cual el préstamo solicitado le servirá para comprar carnes rojas (vaca, ovinos, alpaca, cordero), esta actividad ella comprarte con sus labores de ama de casa.

Ella esta muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y así mismo esta comprometida con este medio para hacer efectiva su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Maribel is from the Calca district in the Urubamba province. She is 39 years old and lives with her partner and her two children, 18 and 3. In addition to housework, she owns a small business selling red meat. This loan will help her buy more meats (beef, mutton, alpaca, and sheep). She is very grateful for this loan and is dedicated to paying her debts back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell beef, mutton, alpaca and sheep

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia P. operates a successful colomado (mini-market) in the community of Gautier. She is a proud mother and grandmother, and an active member of her Bank of Hope. She plans to use this loan for a cement floor for her house, which includes her colomado. After visiting with Alicia, Esperanza's Home Improvement team is confident this loan will improve her quality of life and her business. Thank you for making Alicia's dream possible!

loans.use: New cement floor for colomado and house

loans.name: Ubaydullohon

texts.ru: Убайдуллохон сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже 2 года. Он арендует часть помещения в большом универмаге и продает продукты питания. Ему 26 лет, не женат. Проживает с родителями. Товар приобретает на оптовом рынке за 100 километров от дома и здесь же на местных рынках. Убайдуллохон хочет добавить в ассортимент своих товаров еще несколько наименований и подал заявку на получение займа.
texts.en:
Ubaydullohon has been in collaboration with MicroInvest for two years now. He rents part of a space in a large supermarket and sells food. He is 26 years old and not married. He lives with his parents. He gets his merchandise on the wholesale market 100 kilometers from his home as well as on the local markets. Ubaydullohon wants to add new items to the assortment of his goods and has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. He is 34 years old and lives with his two children who are 10 and 8 years old. He owns his own car which he drives as a taxi around the city of Cusco. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past five or six years, and his wife has a small restaurant which she has been running for the past year or so. She serves mainly soups and traditional Peruvian entrees. 

Washington is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy provisions (rice, vegetables) and tables for his wife’s restaurant. He has pledged to repay his Kiva loan in full and on time. 

Washington’s dream for the future is to own his own home (he currently rents). He would also like to own many vehicles and start his own taxi company.  He could then manage other drivers wouldn’t have to work as a taxi driver anymore.

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables, and tables

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is forty-year-old trader. She lives with her husband and five children in Elmina, Ghana. Two of her children are working while the rest attend school. Her husband is a renowned fisherman. Francisca has traded bags of rice and ground nuts (peanuts) in the community market for the past fifteen years. She has been very resourceful for her family. She treks to the farming communities such as Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of goods and sells them to her customers. Francisca is also a food vendor who prepares and sells food like rice and stew in the market. She is, however, constrained by a lack of funds to expand her business.

Francisca wants to use this loan to buy a larger supply of rice and peanuts to serve her customers throughout the season, which is especially important in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. Francisca belongs to a village bank called Lift Me Up.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of rice and peanuts.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice T. is 28 years old. She is a divorced woman with two kids. One is schooling while the newborn is breastfeeding. She lives with her family in Elmina in the central region of Ghana.

For the past four years, Beatrice has been baking bread to take care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc., and retails them to her customers. She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance and before they come, the orders are ready. Beatrice also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast. And she sometimes sells some through hawking it herself.

Beatrice says the price of commodities is increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand of bread is high. She says she bakes at most 350 loaves of bread in a day. Beatrice needs this loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be most welcome. Beatrice belongs to a village bank called Shepherd. She hope to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia A. is 30 years old and the widowed mother of one child. Currently her son is in school. She lost her husband a year ago through a minor sickness which no one thought would kill him. She lives in Elmina in the central region of Ghana.

Emelia is a trader who deal with assorted products like cooking utensils, clothing materials, drinking glasses, etc. She mostly sells through hawking (house-to-house selling). She has been trading for eight years and two months now. With her humorous behavior, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods.

Recently Emelia has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products like cooking utensils, clothing materials and drinking glasses, which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will have the resources to make lots of profits and be able to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the streets to sell. She belongs to a village bank called Shepherd. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, clothing materials, drinking glasses, and gari to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos, Patricia de 25 y Víctor de 22, quienes ya viven con sus propias familias. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos derivados de la leche (quesos, yogurt, etc.), además de algunas frutas y bocaditos desde su casa, donde ofrece estos nutritivos productos, dedicándose a ello desde hace 5 años. Esta es una labor que le permite pasar más tiempo en su hogar, ya que desde que sus hijos se fueron se quedaba sola sin una actividad que realizar, es por ello que ahora le pone mucha dedicación a su negocio, el cual le viene arrojando buenos ingresos para el bienestar de ella y su pareja; así como para brindarle algunos gustitos a sus nietos a quienes le gusta engreir. María es una mujer muy alegre y siempre está rescatando las cosas buenas de la vida, por ello que tiene muchas esperanzas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, porque sabe que tiene mucho más para dar. Es una cliente muy antigua de MFP, siempre ha trabajado con bancos comunales, pero este es su primer crédito de forma individual, y promete ser tan puntual como lo fue con sus anteriores préstamos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará gran cantidad de productos lácteos para la venta, además de frutas y otros bocaditos para hacer crecer sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, married, and lives with the father of her two children. Their children, Patricia, 25, and Víctor, 22, live with their own families. She buys and sells dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc) in addition to some fruit and snacks. She has sold these nutritious products from her house for 5 years. This work allows her to spend a lot of time in her home. Since her children moved out she has had a lot more free time, allowing her to put a lot of work into her business. Her business brings in good income to support her and her husband and allows her to give treats to her grandchildren, whom she likes to spoil.

María is a very happy woman and she always sees the brighter side of life. This is why she has hopes of improving and growing her business, because she knows it can make more money. She is a longtime client of MFP. She has worked a lot with communal banks, but this is her first individual laon and she promises to be as punctual as she was with her previous loans. With the money she is requesting she will purchase a large amount of dairy products, fruits, and other snacks, to resell and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the merchandise of her store

loans.name: Albert Lika

texts.fr: Monsieur Albert Lika T. est un barman sis au quartier Mbour 1 de Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Il est marié et a démarré son activité par ses propre fonds.  Il a sollicité ce prêt pour renforcer son activité à fin de pouvoir faire face aux fêtes de Pacques.  L’activité consiste a l’achat et revente de boissons alcoolisées.  Les revenus lui permettent de bien vivre avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Albert Lika T. is a bartender located in the Mbour 1 district of Thiès, a city situated 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. He is married and started his business with his own funds. He requested this loan to bolster his business in response to the Easter holidays. His work consists in buying and reselling alcoholic drinks. The revenues enable him and his family to live decently.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks for resale

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty R. started her fish sales fifteen years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Gifty prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a high customer base and customers travel from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She has also added the sale of sachet water to her business.

Gifty is now 40 years old and a married mother of five children. Her husband is a producer of salt. Currently her firstborn is at the polytechnic and two other children are in senior high school.

She wants to use this loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and the growth of her business. She belongs to a village bank called Truth. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a delightful woman, who would like to repair the broken cement floor in her house. She is a mother and grandmother, and operates a used clothing business. After visiting her home, Esperanza's Home Improvement Department concluded that a completely new cement floor is needed to repair her existing one. Maria is approved for this new loan, because of her success with Esperanza's small business loans. Thank you for helping make her dream a reality!

loans.use: New cement floor

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo Juan Carlos de 50 años y sus 4 hijos; María de 28, Jessica de 26, Denise de 23 y Juan Daniel de 11 en su casa propia. Se dedica a la costura desde que tenía 20 años, trabajando para talleres de producción de prendas, al jubilarse decidió poner su propio taller en su casa, de esto ya 6 años, en los cuales el negocio ha sido de gran provecho, pues le arroja buenos ingresos a su hogar. A Nelly siempre le ha gustado la costura, pues se siente muy bien realizando prendas, cortinas, cubrecamas, sábanas, etc.  A cada prenda que realiza le pone mucha dedicación y gran cariño, esperando alcanzar un buen acabado, es por eso que su clientela va en aumento, pues todos se van contentos despues de ver el acabado de las prendas que solicitaron, pero este no es un trabajo nada fácil, ya que debe ser muy minuciosa en la costura y aveces suele tener problemas con la máquina de coser, la cual falla en algunos casos y además su vista ya no es la de antes. Aún así Nelly es muy empeñosa y espera seguir trabajando para agrandar su taller y lograr mejores ingresos a su economía. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos, ella pertenece al grupo denominado “El buen porvenir de San Felipe”. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de telas e hilos, en todas las variedades y colores, para así hacer más llamativas sus prendas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 51 years olds and lives with her husband Juan Carlos, 50 years old, and their four children Maria, 28, Jessica, 26, Denise, 23, and Juan Daniel, 11, in their own house. She has been a seamstress since she was 20 years old, working in clothing assembly workshops. Upon retirement she decided to start her own workshop in her house. In the 6 years since then, her business has been very profitable and has brought in a lot of income to her household.

Nelly has always enjoyed sewing, because she enjoys making clothes, curtains, bedspreads, sheets, etc. She puts a lot of dedication and care into each piece of work, trying to produce a good finished product. For this reason her clientele is increasing, because people are very happy with the products that they order from her. This has not been an easy job, because she has to be very detailed and she sometimes has problems with the sewing machine, which breaks down from time to time. Also, her eyesight is not as good as it was before. Still, Nelly is very hardworking and she hopes to continue working to improve her workshop and increase her income even more.

This is her first loan from MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her payments. She belongs to the group "El buen porvenir de San Felipe" ("The good future of St. Philip"). With the requested money she will buy more material and thread of all varieties and colors to make her products even more eye-catching.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia LUCILA; nació en la provincia de Calca, ella tiene 55 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos de ( 30, 27, 24, 16) años de edad.

La socia alterna sus labores de ama de casa con la actividad del comercio  minorista, ella tiene en sus casa un pequeño negocio, vende platos típicos y chicha, la chicha es una bebida a base de maíz macerado; para lo que nuestra socia necesita el capital de trabajo lo cual le permitirá implementar su pequeño negocio y comprar maíz, e insumos básicos.

La socia Lucila agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este nuestro medio y  se compromete al pago del mismo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in the province of Calca. She is 55 years old, married and has four children, aged 30, 27, 24, and 16.

Lucila alternates her work as a housewife with retail trade. She has a small store in her house. She sells traditional dishes and chica, which is a fermented corn drink. For this, Lucila needs capital that will allow her to set up her store and buy corn and basic ingredients and materials.

Lucila is grateful for this loan and promises to pay it back within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling traditional dishes and chicha

loans.name: Mariaelena

texts.en:
Mariaelena is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 39 years old and is married with two children who are 13 and 9 years old. Mariaelena and her husband own a van, which they use as a school bus for local children. Her husband usually drives the van, but if he is busy or has to travel Mariaelena fills in or hires a replacement driver. She first bought a van with the help of a loan from Arariwa several years ago. Since then, she has replaced that van (which she laughingly describes as “fifth-hand”) with a newer one.

Mariaelena and her husband also have a farm in Mollepata, about two hours outside of the city of Cusco, where they seasonally harvest apples, pears, and beans.

Mariaelena is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles to redo the upholstery in her van and to buy different varieties of beans to plant. She has been working with Asociación Arariwa for the past three years, and has been a very responsible, reliable client. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full. 
 
Mariaelena’s dream for the future is to finish construction on the home she is currently having built for her family. She would like to take out an individual loan from Asociacion Arariwa in order to do so.

loans.use: Re-upholster van, buy bean seeds to plant

loans.name: Néné Galle

texts.fr: Madame Néné Galle D. dit Ousmany est une commerçante restauratrice à la gare routière de Thiès, Sénégal depuis 7 ans.  Elle habite au quartier Mbour 1 de Thiès, et elle est mariée.  Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, elle veut se lancer dans le commerce des basins et d’Indigo.  Ainsi elle sollicite ce prêt pour financer ces activités.  Elle maitrise le domaine et veut développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Néné Galle D., also called Ousmany, has been a restauranteur-merchant at the bus station of Thiès, Sénégal, for seven years. She lives in the Mbour 1 district of Thiès, and she is married. To diversify her sources of revenues, she wants to start doing commerce in tubs, basins, and indigo. She’s therefore requesting this loan to finance her activities. She’s a master in her domain and wants to develop her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins and indigo

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 28 años, convive con su pareja Yoliset, con la que tiene una pequeña hija de 8 años llamada Kimberly, viven en la casa de la madre de Pedro. Él se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi desde hace 5 años, trabajando de 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, en una jornada en la que tiene que lidiar con el duro tránsito de la ciudad, siendo una labor nada fácil, ya que al finalizar el día resulta muy agotado con el fuerte calor del verano. A Pedro siempre le ha gustado conducir, oficio que aprendió desde muy joven y el cual le brinda independencia, ya que él decide a qué horas trabajar y también los momentos para compartir con su familia, además le resulta muy rentable, debido a que realiza muchos servicios al día y al ser su carro propio, todas las ganacias son para él y su familia. Como se lo ha demostrado la experiencia, se saca buenos ingresos en el trasporte de pasajeros, es así que está pensando invertir en la compra de un motocarro, el cual le permita obtener mayores ingresos y brindar una oportunidad laboral para algún joven trabajador como él. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siendo siempre muy puntual en los pagos, y agrádándole mucho el trabajo en su banco comunal, él es el presidente y realiza esta labor con gran responsabilidad. Con el dinero solicitado quiere refaccionar su carro, además, dar las cuotas iniciales para comprar su motocarro y registrarlo para empezar a trabajar con él.
texts.en:
Pedro is 28 years old and lives with his partner Yoliset, with whom he has a young daughter of 8 years old called Kimberly. They live in Pedro's mother's house. For 5 years he has been a taxi driver, working from 7am to 8pm. During the day he has to deal with the heavy traffic of the city. It is not an easy job, as at the end of the day he is exhausted from the strong summer heat. Pedro has always liked driving, a trade that he learned when he was very young and that gives him a lot of independence because he can choose when he works and when he spends time with his family. In addition it has been very profitable: he has many passengers every day and he uses his own car, so all of the earnings go to him and his family.

As experience has shown him, driving a taxi earns good money, and this is how he intends to finance his investment in a three-wheeler van (like a tuk-tuk or auto rickshaw), which will allow him to earn more money and provide employment to another young worker like him. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has always been punctual with his payments. He very much enjoys working with his communal bank, for which he is the president and and carries out his work with great responsibility. With the money he requests, he wants to refurbish his car, and in addition, pay the initial installments on his three-wheeler van and register it to start using it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his taxi and invest in a three-wheeler van/Refaccionar su auto y aumentar el monto para comprar un motocarro

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia ROSARIO, es natural de Calca, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de (17,15, 13) años.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella ha aperturó una pequeña tienda abarrotes en su domicilio de la calle Grau 670; la socia necesita implementar su negocio para lo cual requiere el préstamo, ella implementará su pequeño negocio para tener mayor productividad.

L a socia Rosario queda muy agradecida con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a pagar su préstamo en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosario is a native of Calca. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 children of 17, 15, and 13 years old.

She alternates her household activities with retail trade. She has opened a small general store in her home at 670 calle Grau. She needs a loan to set up her store and make it more productive.

Rosario is very grateful for your support and promises to pay back her loan within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up her general store

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris and her husband live with their two children outsiD. of Boca Chica. She operates a successful street vending business right outsiD. of her house. She has repaid three small business loans with Esperanza, and financially qualifies for this floor loan.

While the Esperanza Home Improvement Team visited with Damaris, we noticed her youngest son crawling on the dirt floor. Damaris' living conditions are inadequate and unhealthy for her family. Please help improve their situation and fund this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: New cement floor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana A. M. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband works in a hotel as a clerk. Currently, the kids are in school. She has been sewing for eleven years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are first class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kid's school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Joana has two apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the village bank called Truth. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo Martín y sus 4 hijos; Betzabeth de 21, Sonia de 15, Jesús de 10 y Víctor de 8 años de edad, en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican al alquiler de luces y equipos de sonido, desde hace 3 años en un espacio que acondicionaron en su casa, proveen estos equipos para fiestas de cumpleaños y reuniones sociales diversas. Les favorece mucho tener este negocio, ya que les arroja buenas ganancias, a demás de ser un trabajo tranquilo, en el cual pueden apoyarse mutuamente. Sonia quiere ofrecer siempre novedades a sus clientes, por ello, esperan agrandar su negocio con mejores equipos para obtener mayores ganancias, y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Hace un año que trabaja con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de luces más modernas, así como parlantes y mejores accesorios para fiestas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives with her husband Martín and their four children, Betzabeth, 21, Sonia, 15, Jesús, 10, and Victor, 8, in their own house. She and her husband have rented out lights and sound equipment for three years from a space they set up in their house. They provide this equipment for birthday parties and various social gatherings. It suits them to have their own business, because it brings in good earnings and is a tranquil job in which they can support each other. Sonia wants to offer new innovations to her clients, which is why she wants to improve their business with better equipment. This way, they can earn more money and increase their family's standard of living. Sonia has worked with MFP for one years and has always been punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting is to buy more modern lights, along with speakers and better accessories for parties.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lights and equipment to rent out for parties

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es:
NANCY ISABEL M. R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, ubicada en el Jr. Corpac Mz E Lt 6, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 44 años D. edad, 01 hija, su esposo es docente D. nivel superior.es socia D. Manuela Ramos hace 07 años.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y se dedicaba a la crianza beneficio y venta D. animales menores, pero dejo el negocio porque era un poco difícil beneficiarlos, luego D. haberlos criado con tanto esmero, comenta que algunos animales eran tan tiernos que al matarlos era como matar a una mascota, lo cual era un poco difícil.

Luego D. dejar el negocio anterior se dedicó, junto con su esposo, a dictar clases D. mecánica, teórico-práctico, un oficio que le agrado y pudieron desarrollarse, hoy tienen un convenio con un centro superior D. enseñanza.
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará carpetas y algunas  herramientas necesarias para las clases prácticas.

Comenta: “Me Agrada la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos, el sistema que tiene, el orden, así como las orientaciones que dan, he puesto en práctica algunos tips que me ayudaron a mejorar mi empresa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank called "Manos Unidas", located in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 44 years old and has one daughter. Nancy's husband teaches at a secondary school. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 7 years. With the first loan she received, she began raising and selling small animals, but she left that business because she realized that after putting so much effort into raising the animals, killing them felt like killing her pets, and she found that very difficult.

Afterwards, together with her husband, she began to teach classes for mechanics, theory and practical courses, which was a traD. she liked and could develop. Today they have an agreement with a teaching center for advanced learning. With the loan, they will purchase materials and tools that they need in the classes.

Nancy says she appreciates the way that Manuela Ramos works, the system they have and the structure, as well as the orientations they proviD., She says that she has put into practice many of the tips they've given her to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the mechanics classes she and her husband teach

loans.name: Kodjovi Satomé Edem

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Kodjovi edem est un résident du quartier de Kégué, il est marié et a un enfant, pour subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille il a entamé depuis 2008 le commerce de produits pharmaceutiques. Son stock actuel étant limité il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrait de se réapprovisionner. C’est avec le revenu tiré de cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjovi Edem A. lives in the neighborhood of Kégué, he is married and has one child. In 2008, he started to sell pharmaceutical products in order to properly provide for his family's needs. His current supply being limited, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES. this loan will enable him to get more supplies. With the income from this activity he provides for his family's expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia RICARDINA, es natural D. la provincia D. Calca, ella tiene 70 años D. edad y tiene 5 hijos los mismo que hicieron su propia familia, ella vive con la menor D. sus hijas D. 22 años.

Nuestra socia tiene su negocio D. venta D. verduras en el mercado central en calca, ella venD. todos los días sus verduras, para lo cual necesita el préstamo para comprar verduras a l por mayor y así ella seguir vendiendo en el mercado, la socia nos manifiesta que siempre ha trabajado en la venta D. diferentes productos pero ahora lo hace con verduras por que es mas fácil para ella transportar este producto por su edad, pero también nos indica que trabajando D. esta manera ella se siente más joven y disfruta su trabajo.

La socia Ricardina esta muy contenta con el préstamo otorgado y previo un saludo manifiesta que se compromete a pagar el préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Member Ricardina is a native of Calca province. She is 70 years old and has 5 children, all of whom have families of their own now. She lives with her youngest daughter who is 22 years old.

Our group member's business is selling fruit at the Calca central market. She sells her vegetables every day. Therefore she needs this loan in order to buy vegetables wholesale, and in this way continue selling in the market. This member tells us that she has always worked selling different types of products, but now she focuses on vegetables because it is easier at her age to transport produce. She also notes that working in this way makes her feel younger and that she enjoys her work.

Group member Ricardina is very please with the granted loan. Before sending her hellos, she pledges to repay the loan over the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. started her fish sales fifteen years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Aba prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. No wonder her husband is a fisherman. She also sells foodstuffs like bags of maize. She treks to Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo to buy her foodstuffs. She has a high customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She is now 51 years old, married and a mother with four children. Her husband is a seaman who fishes in the sea. Currently all her children are fully independent. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fish and bags of maize to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the village bank called Holy Ghost. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more fish and bags of maize.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred T. is 47 years old and the married mother of six children. Currently three of her children are in school, while the rest are schooling. She lives in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Her husband owns a printing press in the community. 

Winifred sells clothing materials and cosmetics through hawking (that is, house-to-house selling). She has also managed to erect a wooden structure in front of her house where she sells cereals, like rice, and other foodstuffs. To support her children, she has been selling cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients through hawking. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to sponsor her children's education. Winifred belongs to a village bank called Tabitha Kum.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
NENA P. D. GALÁN, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con su negocio ubicado en el Jr. Salvador AllenD. N° 425, Distrito D. Callería tiene 58 años D. edad, 05 hijos, su esposo traba como vigilante, pero se encuentra en reposo por una operación.
Para ayudar a su esposo con la economía del hogar, se puso a vender comida en las tardes y noches en la puerta D. su casa, acondicionando lo que tenia y con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, implemento mejor su negocio, hoy tiene clientes ganados y sigue adelante.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá invertir en la compra D.: arroz un saco, azúcar un saco, aceite una caja, una mesa y sus sillas, vajilla y vasos una docena, así como cubiertos.  También se ha provisionado D. carbón y hojas en los que envuelve el Juane y la patarashca (comida típica D. la zona) y tiene todo listo para seguir adelante.
Dice estar muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos, ya que su pareja no pueD. trabajar, su negocio le ha ayudado a sostener su familia en tiempos difíciles”.
texts.en:
Nena P. D. G. belongs to the Community Bank “Las Rosas” (The Roses), with her business located in Jr. Salvador AllenD. N° 425 in the Callería District. She is 58 years old. She has five children. Her husband works as a guard but is currently recovering from an operation. In order to help her husband with household expenses, she began to sell food from their doorway in the afternoons and nights. Using what she had and her first loan of $100 (300 PEN), she created a well-run business. Today she has a following of customers and is moving forward.

With this loan of $325 (1000 PEN), she will be able to invest in the purchase of a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, a bottle of oil, a table and chairs, and a dozen sets of plates and glasses to make place settings. She also has provisions of coal and leaves that are used to wrap juane and patarashca (typical local foods). She has everything ready to move forward.

She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos as, with her husband unable to work, her business has helped her to sustain her family in these difficult times.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients in bulk. Buy dishes and glasses. Buy tables, chairs.

loans.name: Dossa

texts.fr: Monsieur  A. Dossa a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de cartes de recharges, il y a beaucoup de société de téléphonie à Lomé ce qui fait que ce commerce est très rentable à Lomé. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de faire face convenablement à la demande ; pour cela il sollicite de WAGES son  premier crédit pour acheter des cartons de cartes de recharges
texts.en:
Mr. Dossa A. earns a living selling rechargeable phone cards. In Lomé there are a lot of telephone companies which makes the business of selling phone cards very profitable. His current supply does not enable him to properly meet the demand; for this reason he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy boxes of rechargeable phone cards.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
El socio QUINTIN, es natural D. L. provincia D. Calca, donD. residió toda su vida, el tiene 58 años D. edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos D. (34, 20, 16) años D. edad.

El socio Quintín, es profesor jubilado, en L. actualidad, el ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores, para lo cual requiere el préstamo, uno D. sus hijos esta en L. universidad y el menor está preparándose para ingresar a L. universidad en una academia particular, es por esta razón L. urgencia del socio en adquirir el préstamo.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a pagar el mismo, el plazo determinado; él recibe una pensión del estado con lo que tiene previsto pagar sus cuotas mensuales hasta el pago final D. L. deuda.
texts.en:
Group member Quintin is a native of Calca, where he has lived his entire life. He is 58 years old. He is married and has three children ages 16, 20 and 34.

Group member Quintin is a retired teacher. Currently he is helping his children pay for higher education, for which he needs a loan. One of his children is in college, and the youngest is getting ready to start college at a private school. Therefore it is urgent that he receive the loan.

Our group member is grateful for and values the loan. He pledges to payback the loan over the established period. He receives a pension from the state with which he anticipates paying monthly installments until the final payment of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Higher educaiton for his children

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur D. Kodjo est un informaticien de formation, n’ayant pas trouvé à faire jusqu’à l’an dernier, il a lancé alors ses propres affaires qui sont la restauration et la vente de boissons. Actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé il sollicite de WAGES un autre crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 10 casiers de boissons, et divers produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo D. is a computer specialist by trade, but until last year, he had not been able to find work. He then started his own business which is catering and the sale of beverages. Currently, he is out of stock and he is requesting another loan from WAGES to re-supply with 10 beverage racks and various goods essential for his catering activity.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverage racks and goods essential to catering activity

loans.name: Rosario Ysabel

texts.es:
ROSARIO YSABEL S. PEÑALOZA, desde hace 3 años pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, con domicilio ubicado en la Av. Santa Clara Mz. D Lt. 17 del Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo temporal independiente.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo usó para incrementar su pequeño negocio, compró artículos de pasamanería, y de primera necesidad, con un local acondicionado en su casa, el negocio siguió progresando.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará mas mercadería al por mayor y artículos escolares, ya que se encuentra al costado de un colegio. Rosario está lista para seguir adelante este año, pues con la buena atención y el optimismo que tiene, está segura que seguirá progresando.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos y está conforme con el trabajo que viene realizando en la región, es una ayuda para las mujeres que quieren seguir adelante, apoyando al ingreso económico de las familias.
texts.en:
Rosario Ysabel S. P. has been a member of the "Manos Unidos" ("Hands Together") Village Bank for the past three years. She is 36 years old and has two children; her husband is a temporary worker. Rosario lives on Santa Clara Ave in Manantay District. Rosario's first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles (about US$100). She used the money to restock her small business and to buy decorative accents, which were very necessary. Now that she has an appropriate space in her home, her business is continuing to progress. With this loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles (US$400), she will buy more bulk merchandise and school supplies, since her business is located next door to an elementary school. Rosario is ready to keep moving forward this year. Since she offers good customer service and is very optimistic, she is certain that she will continue to make progress. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos and is in favor of the work the institution has been doing in her area, since it is a great help for women who want to continue to move forward and help financially support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Madame B. rachidatou est une résidente du quartier de kégué, elle est mariée et a 03 enfants son mari est un chauffeur.  Afin d’aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer elle a entamée depuis 2003 le commerce de charbons de bois, elle vend ses charbons de bois en gros et en détail. Pour réaliser de bons bénéfices sur ses ventes elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays notamment à Tchébébé. Son stock actuel est épuisé pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ms. B. Rachidatou is a resident of the Kégué district. She is married and has three children to support. Her husband is a chauffeur. In order to help her husband with day-to-day household expenses, she started doing commerce in charcoal in 2003. She sells charcoal at the wholesale and retail levels. To realize good profits on her sales, she acquires her stock from the country’s interior, notably in Tchébébé. Her stock right now is exhausted. To stock up again, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr: Mame Coumba D., 68 ans, mariée, avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Palal depuis 12 ans. Son activité est la vente d’arachide et de bois de chauffe. Elle veut renforcer son commerce .Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mame Coumba D., age 68, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Bayouf Palal for twelve years. Her work involves selling peanuts and firewood. She wants to bolster her business. The loan she’s requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanuts and firewood

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Yao a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de friperies, il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1998 et fait ce commerce au marché local de hedzranawoé qui constitue en même temps son lieu d’approvisionnement. Actuellement son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 ballots de friperie. Il est marié, c’est ce commerce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres charges et à ceux de sa femme.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Yao earns an income from commerce in second-hand clothing. He started in this business in 1998 and works at the local marketplace of Hedzranawoé which is also where he stocks up. Currently, since his stock of merchandise is exhausted, he’s requesting his first loan with WAGES to buy three bundles of second-hand clothing. He is married. His commerce is what enables him to support himself and his wife.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D. âgée de 37 ans est mariée. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Palal depuis 10 ans et demi. Son activité est le petit commerce.  Binta achète et revend des produits de consommation  Son dernier prêt lui avait permis de vendre des fruits. Binta veut renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
