El señor Nazario Z. tiene ya más de 11 años dedicándose a la venta de tacos este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Don Nazario solicita un préstamo para poder acondicionar el puesto ya que le están haciendo falta mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan con sumir sus alimentos cómoda mente y tengan una mejor atención.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio ya que le ayudan su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Nazario Z. has worked selling tacos for more than 11 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. Nazario is seeking a loan to improve his post since he is missing tables and chairs to allow his customers to eat comfortably and receive better attention. He plans to repay the loan with the profits from the business to support his wife and two children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair food vending post

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El señor Noe B. desea el préstamo para las protecciones de su casa, la cual adquirió por medio de un crédito gubernamental, tiene poco de vivir en su propiedad, Don Noe trabaja en una línea de trasportes y su horario de trabajo es la mayor parte del día, en la casa solo se quedan su esposa la señora María Victoria Rivera y su hijo de pequeña edad.
 Es portal motivo que están solicitando el préstamo para las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas de su casa, y así podrá ir a trabajar un poco más tranquilo dejando, a su familia con puco más de seguridad. (En la foto ha parecen  su esposa e hijo ya que él señor Noe  se encontraba en horario de trabajo).
texts.en:
Mr. Noe B. desires the loan to protect his house, which he obtained through a government loan. He has not lived on his property for very long. Mr. Noe works for a transportation line and his work schedule is mainly during the day. His wife, Mrs. María Victoria Rivera and his young son stay home alone during the day. The reason he is asking for a loan is to add protection to the windows and doors of his home and in that way he will be able to go to work more at ease, leaving his family a little safer. (His wife and son appear in the photo because Mr. Noe was working).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make the doors and windows of his home safer

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos M. tiene ya mas de 16 años dedicándose ha su negocio de ventas de artesanías mexicanas.
      Este negocio es la fuente de  ingreso de su familia, en el cual se dedican atenderlo el y su esposa la señora Melissa Contreras. En este momento le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía pero no cuenta con el dinero necesaria para surtir ya que le están ofreciendo un nuevo diseño de artesanía a muy buen precio. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que le están ofreciendo. 
Don Carlos ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Carlos M. already has more than 16 years of experience of selling Mexican handicrafts. His business is the source of his family’s income and they help him and his wife Melissa Contreras. At the moment he needs more variety in his merchandise but does not have the money required to buy a new design of handicraft that is being offered to him at a very good price. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy the merchandise that is being offered to him. Carlos has now had four loans through FVP all of which he has repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his handicraft business

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es:
El señor Isaías Marques y su esposa la señora Leonor Tapia ya son personas grandes de edad y sus hijos que tiene sus propias familia. En esté momento ellos están viviendo con uno de sus hijos, y desean tener su propio vivienda.
Esta solicitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental) pero le está haciendo falta una cantidad para completar la vivienda y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para pagar la diferencia, por tal motivo nos solicita un préstamo para completar y así le pueden entregar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Isaias Marques and his wife Ms. Leonor Tapia are mature adults and their children already have their own families. Right now they are living with one of their children and they would like to have their own house. He is requesting a house through a government program called Infonavit but lacks the full amount to complete the house. Right now he does not have the money to pay the difference. He is requesting a loan to finish it so he will finally be given his house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of a home through Infonavit program

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La señora Sara R. V. es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos y es empleada de una maquiladora. La casa en la que ella vive  es una de las que otorgo el gobierno del estado a un costo muy bajo ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras con prestamos otorgados de esta institución, primero  puso barda y barandal al frente de su hogar, construyo un cuarto y quiere instalarle el vitropiso. Cuando le entregaron su vivienda solo constaba con un recamara y un baño con las mejoras que le ha hecho ya tiene dos recamaras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara Rodríguez V. is a single mother with 3 children. She works at an assembly plant. The house she lives in was given to her by the state government at a low cost. She has been making improvements using the loans given to her from this institution. First, she put a fence and security bars in front of her home. She built a room, and she would like to install tile flooring. When she was given her home it only had one bedroom and a bathroom. With the improvements she has made it now has two bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to put down tile flooring

loans.name: Cuauhtemoc

texts.es:
El señor Cuauhtemoc P. A. trabaja como operador en una maquiladora el tiene 2 hijos los  cuales estudian, su esposa es mujer de hogar.
La casa en que viven es de interés social por lo que le descuenta por nomina. El siempre a soñado en una casa bien arreglada por lo que poco a poco le ha hecho mejoras pero aun no han terminado por falta de dinero, Ahora el recurre a nosotros con un proyecto en mente  levantar barda enfrente de su casa para mayor seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Cuauhtemoc P. A. works as a machinist in a large factory. He has 2 children who are students, and his wife is a housewife. The house they live in is publicly subsidized, and mortgage payments are deducted from his paycheck. He has always dreamed of having a well kept house. Little by little he has made improvements, but he has not finished for lack of money. He comes to us with a project in mind. He would like to build a wall in front of his house to provide better security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es casado y trabaja como auxiliar de correo en el servicio postal mexicano desde hace ya 20 años, su hija Nancy trabaja en un banco de la localidad ella es casada y vive con sus papas por lo que les ayuda a cubrir los gastos de la casa. Con el transcurso del tiempo le han ido haciendo  muchas mejoras a su vivienda esta es de interés social y son muy pequeñas. 
Ellos no gastan en mano de obra ya que entre el y su esposa se ayudan a construir el proyecto, la señora le ayuda a cargar botes con mezcla o ya se cargar blocks como el levantar paredes, etc. Pero sus ahorros se han agotado por lo que recurren a nosotros pidiendo dinero para material por  que quieren poner losa en el cuarto de enfrente.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has worked as a mailman for the Mexican postal service for the past 20 years. His daughter Nancy works at a local bank. Nancy is married and lives with her parents and she is helping them cover the household expenses. Overtime they have been fixing their home. They do not spent money on labor to fix their home, Mario and his wife work together to complete the construction projects. She helps by carrying buckets of mixtures o cinder blocks to make walls, etc. But their savings have been diminishing and that is why they are asking for a loan to be able to buy material for tiles in the front room. (Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay tile in their home

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio labora para una universidad como intendente (en el área de limpieza) desde hace 1 años, demostrando  lealtad y  perseverancia, su esposa la señora Mayra Alejandra trabaja como secretaria en una escuela desde hace 6 años;  ellos como tienen 3 hijos por los cuales luchan para salir adelante y brindarles un mejor futuro, ya que la familia esta creciendo y cada quien requiere de su espacio desean ampliarse el cual es el motivo por el cual  están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sergio has been working as a janitor at a university for one year demonstrating loyalty and perserverence. His wife, Mayra Alejandra, has been working as a secretary at a school for six years. They have 3 children that they work hard for and raise well so that they will have a bright future. Their children are growing and they need more room in their house. They want a bigger space to live in and this is why they are soliciting this loan.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The addition of a room to their house

loans.name: Raudel

texts.es: El señor Raudel es pensionado y solamente vive con su esposa la señora María Esther, ellos tienen un matrimonio estable y muy unido, les han inculcado a sus hijos a ser personas responsables. Tienen su casita cómoda por que le han estado haciendo mejoras poco a poco con sus ahorros, pero les esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar y pintar su hogar, y este es por lo que están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Raudel is retired and he receives a pension. He lives with his wife, Maria Esther. They have a stable marriage and raised their children to be intelligent and responsible. They have been fixing their home little by little with their savings. At this point, they need to make their home waterproof and also paint their home. This is why they are asking for a loan.

(Translated by Thatcher of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof the roof of their home

loans.name: Soh

texts.en: With a good, manageable attitude there lives a family along the Tonle Sap lake in Pursat Province, Cambodia. M., 32, is married to Sah, 25, who sells fish in the local market. M. earns his living fishing along the river and he has been in this business since 2000. M. wakes in the dark sky to go fishing with his wife. When the sun rises, Sah hurries to take the fish to the village to retail. Sometimes, Sah has to buy fish from the other fishermen. The family earns a good income. M. is requesting a loan of $300 to buy a new, small boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy a new, small boat for fishing

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: La señora Norma Aracely tiene 2 años poniendo su pulguita, motivo por el cual ya tiene su clientela, ingreso extra que le ayuda de apoyo a su esposo el señor Nasir que trabaja en una maquiladora, lugar donde dieron muy buenas referencias laborales, comentando que son personas muy responsables y de palabra; la señora Norma quiere invertir en mas mercancía para su puesto obteniendo mas variedad y por consecuencia mas ingreso.
texts.en:
Norma Aracely has been putting a stand in the flea market for the past two years. She now has her own customers and extra income that contributes to her husband's income and helps to provide for the family. Her husband, Mr. Nasir, works in a factory. He has vary good references from his job. People that work with him say that he is very responsible and he is a man of his word. Norma wants to invest more money in her stand by purchasing a greater variety of products to sell. This way she will be able to increase her sales and her income.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business of selling at the flea market

loans.name: Claudia Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Araceli vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, ella trabaja en una fabrica desde hace 3 años, y a parte obtienen otro ingreso mediante la venta de quesos y chorizo. Su esposo el señor Ramón labora para una panadería con una antigüedad de 8 años. 
Como una familia responsable, trabajadora y unida, están solicitando este crédito para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Araceli lives with her husband and three children. She has worked in a factory for the past 3 years. She also makes money by selling cheeses and chorizo. Her husband Mr. Ramon has worked in a bakery for the past 8 years. As a responsible family they work hard and they are close. They are asking for a loan so that they will be able to buy more merchandise.

(Translated by Ryan of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and chorizo to sell

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elsa es una señora de edad adulta que no por ser grande no le permita desarrollarse en algo. Desde hace cinco años ha atendido una tienda la cual es llamada “estanquillo González” donde ella vende de todo como; refrescos, papitas, abarrotes en general. Su tienda antes la tenía ubicada en una casa de renta ya que aun a su marido no le entregaban la que ahora tiene. 
Los clientes que acudían al local aquel recurren al nuevo con la confianza de que la señora Maria Elsa le va a tender con tal amabilidad. Ahora ella requiere de compra de mas mercancia para tener mejor mercancia y calidad.
Su esposo trabaja de chofer en una constructora de la cuida con lo que ella le apoya es con su negocio para mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Elsa is an adult woman who has a desire to take on some type of activity. For five years now, she has tended to a store called “General Store González” where she sells all types of items such as beverages, potato chips, and an assortment of groceries. Her store was previously located in a rented house. The customers she had at that location now frequent her new site, confident that Maria Elsa will care for them with the same level of friendly service. Currently, she needs to buy more products to have more to sell and a higher quality of items. Her husband works as a driver at a construction company and her contribution helps to support their household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La señora Ofelia tiene una tiendita de abarrotes llamada “Providencia “desde hace un año, lo cual comprueba que tiene una estabilidad económica, su esposo el señor Raúl Arturo trabaja para una empresa en su puesto de operador donde tiene una antigüedad de 11 años. La señora Ofelia esta solicitando este crédito para surtir mas mercancía para su tiendita y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Ofelia has had a small grocery store called “Providencia” for one year, which confirms that she has some economic stability. Her husband, Raúl Arturo, works as an operator at an enterprise where he has been for 11 years. Ofelia is requesting this loan to supply her store with more merchandise, and she counts on the support of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Argelia

texts.es: La señora Argelia vive con su esposo el señor Isaidel y tienen una niña; ella tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. nachos con queso, fritos con queso, paletas D. hielo, etc. Y su esposo trabaja para una empresa con un buen ingreso desD. hace una año, el esta apoyando a su esposa en solicitar este crédito para la compra D.  mercancía para su negocio.
texts.en:
Argelia lives with her husband, Isaidel, and they have one daughter. She has a small business selling nachos with cheese, cheese fries, frozen ice pops, etc. Her husband has worked at an enterprise for one year, earning a good income. He is supporting his wife in this loan request, for the purchase of merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El señor Fausto es originario de Veracruz y  vino a radicar a Piedras Negras desde hace 15 años, buscando un mejor futuro para el y su familia, el es pensionado y aparte tiene un ingreso extra económicamente muy bueno como empleado de un centro comercial, en una área donde le brindan trabajo a personas pensionadas, y con capacidades diferentes, su esposa la señora Eduarda también es pensionada, ellos tienen 5 hijos los cuales todos están casados y son personas muy responsables, pero que también contribuyen al apoyo económico de sus padres; don Fausto y la señora Eduarda están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de un portalito en el frente de su casita  y pasar las tardes viendo juntos como un matrimonio estable y unido el atardecer.
texts.en:
Fausto is originally from Veracruz, and came to relocate to Piedras Negras 15 years ago looking for a better future for himself and his family. He is retired and also enjoys a good additional income as an employee at a commercial center in an area that provides work for retired persons who have different skills. They have 5 children who are married and are also very responsible individuals, but who also contribute to the financial support of their parents. Fausto and Eduarda are requesting this loan to build an entrance in front of their home; from there, they can spend their afternoons together watching the evening approach as a stable, unified married couple.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front entrance for his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio tiene una familia integrada por 2 hijos y su esposa la señora Juana; el señor trabaja para Comisión Federal de Electricidad desde hace 11 años, su esposa es pequeña comerciante ya que vende zapatos por catalogo.
Están solicitando este crédito para construir un portal en el frente de su casita para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio has a family comprised of 2 children and his wife, Juana. He has worked for the Federal Electrical Commission for the past 11 years. His wife is a merchant who sells shoes by catalog. They are requesting this loan in order to build an entrance at the front of their house, so the family can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front entrance for their house.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
C., 39, is a mother of three children; all of them are students. She is married to Choy, 38, who is a local farmer on a plot of farmland which he got from his parents in 1990.

C. is a local farmer and she has been in this field for more than 19 years. She always harvests twice a year because there are only two seasons a year in Cambodia, This year she wants to spread her farming by owning another plot of land, so she is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy a small plot of farmland for her farming. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland for her farming

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
La señora San Juana es empleada del área de limpieza de unas oficinas cuenta con un año de antigüedad, obtiene un ingreso extra ya que percibe una pensión, su esposo el señor Tomas Carrizales es pensionado municipal; ellos cuentan con el apoyo económico de su hija la señorita Elvira Magdalena que labora para un consultorio medico como secretaria. 
Son una familia estable y trabajadora que luchan por vivir más cómodamente y por lo mismo están solicitando este crédito  para la colocación de un techo de madera y de lámina.
texts.en:
Mrs. San Juana has been employed as a local office cleaner for a year. She has an extra income now that she receives a pension. Her husband, Mr. Tomas Carrizales, is a state pensioner. They rely on the financial help of their daughter, Miss Elvira Magdalena who works as a medical secretary. They are a stable and hardworking family who are fighting for a more comfortable life and to this end they are asking for this loan so that they can put in a wooden and laminate roof.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wooden and laminate roof

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo labora para una plaza comercial en el área de frutería desde hace 2 años, su esposa la señora Imelda es empleada domestica de una residencia con una antigüedad de 3 años, cuentan con el apoyo económico del señor Ramón que es papa de la señora Imelda tiene tres hijos a los cuales les enseñan a ser personas responsables y trabajadoras, juntos están tramitando este crédito para la elaboración y colocación de un portón en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Eduardo has been working in a shopping centre in the fruit section for 2 years. His wife Imelda has been a domestic employee in a private house for 3 years. They rely on Ramon, Imelda’s father, for financial support. Imelda has three children whom she is bringing up to be responsible and hardworking people. Together they are asking for this loan in order to manufacture and install a front door to their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacture and installation of a front door for their house

loans.name: Ramshed

texts.ru: Рамшед и его отец арендуют торговое место в универмаге поселка Нефтеабад. Они торгуют здесь уже несколько лет и имеют своих постоянных клиентов. Рамшед женат, ему 24 года. За товаром ездит он сам в неделю 2 раза. За счет умеренной цены у него много покупателей. Рамшед собирается немного расширить свой оборотный капитал и поэтому подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Ramshed and his father rent a vendor space in a supermarket of the Nefteabad village. They have been selling there for several years and has regular customers. Ramshed is married, he is 24 years old. He travels to bring the merchandise twice a week. Because of low prices he has many buyers. Ramshed plans to increase his working capital a bit and this is why he applied for a loan at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азизу 28 лет, он женат. Но пока не имеет детей. Азиз занимается предпринимательством и арендует торговое место в универмаге в поселке Нефтеабад. Азизу в его торговле помогают его родные. За товаром ездит на потовые рынки и приобретает тут же у местных оптовиков. Для получения хорошей прибыли необходимо иметь хороший ассортимент товаров, поэтому Азиз решил подать заявку на КИВА и добавить новые наименования товаров.
texts.en:
Aziz is 28 years old, he is married, but does not have any children yet. Aziz is a businessman and rents out a vendor space in the supermarket in the village of Nefteabad. Aziz gets help from his relatives in this business. He travels to the wholesale markets to buy the merchandise and also from local wholesalers. To make a good profit he needs to have a wide variety of goods, and this is why Aziz decided to apply for a loan at Kiva to add a few new products to his assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Bibishoy

texts.ru: Бибишой неоднократно получала займ на КИВА. Показала себя пунктуальной и ответственной клиенткой. За то время, которое прошло с прошлых раз, бизнес Бибишой изменился в лучшую сторону. Ассортимент товаров теперь включает все необходимое для дома: от продуктов питания до мелких хозтоваров. Бибишой внимательно следит за изменением спроса на товары и вовремя реагирует на это. С недавних пор ею было замечен и незамедлительно включен в ассортимент товаров и услуг карточки экспресс-оплаты сотовой связи. кроме этого она имеет в ассортименте препайд сим-карты. Для оптового закупа карточек Бибишой решила подать заявку на КИВА и собирается приобрести карточки 4 сотовых операторов
texts.en:
Bibishoy has taken out loans at Kiva several times. She has proven to be a punctual and responsible client. Bibishoy's business has improved during the time since her last loan. Her assortment of goods now includes all of the necessary things for the home: from food to small household products. Bibishoy carefully watches as demands for the goods change and reacts to it in time. Just recently she has noticed a demand for express-pay mobile phone cards and she very quickly included them into her assortment of goods and services. Besides that she also has prepaid SIM-cards. To buy these cards in wholesale Bibishoy has decided to apply for a loan at Kiva and plans to buy the cards for four different mobile providers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy express-pay mobile phone cards in wholesale

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
L. R. is 41 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children: one is a student and the other one is a garment worker. She is married to Soy, 48, who is a local farmer. 

L. R. has also been a local farmer since 1987 on a plot of land she got from her parents. She has a small pond that can be fished behind her house. She would like to start using the pond to start a fish farm and she is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a hundred kilos of fish to start this business. She dreams to have a degree for her child.

loans.use: To buy a hundred kilos of fish for her pond

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five members. Its leader, T., 38, is a mother of two children; one is a garment worker and another one is a student.

T. has planted vegetables on a plot of land she derived from her parents, for more than two years. She is a responsible neighbor and everyone admires her work and her struggle. She sells in the early morning and late afternoon. Recently she wanted to make another income. T. is applying for the loan to buy soft drinks to sell.

Another member is Sareth, 33, who works in the garment factory. She is taking a loan to buy soft drinks for her child to sell.

S., 35, who owns a shop selling disks, is looking for a loan to buy grocery products for her husband to sell.

Y., 60, sells vegetables and is looking for a loan to invest in her business.

M., 60, sells traditional noodles and is taking a loan to buy fruit to sell in the evening time.

They all live in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: Buy supplies to sell to make a profit.

loans.name: Jarlyn

texts.en:
Jarlyn P. is a 33 year old mother of four.  She is married to a fisherman.  Jarlyn joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Incorporated) four years ago to start up a variety store and have starting capital for food vending. 

However, her present income is not enough to support the needs of her family, especially the education of her children. 

Jarlyn applied for this loan to buy fishing nets, to be used in catching fry, and to repair their old fishing boat. 

She hopes that her new venture will help her save money so she can establish a bigger variety store, build a better house for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: Buy fish nets.

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en:
Chhon is the leader of a group of borrowers consists of three members. She is a mother of three children: all are still young. Chhon is married to Kaen, 37, who trades products in bulk and then distributes to the target market.

Chhon owns a number of rent rooms in the busy market. She is taking a loan to build another two rooms to rent.

The other two members are: O., 57, who sells traditional cakes, is looking for a loan to buy piglets for her pig pen. L., 41, sells fruit in the market and is taking a loan to invest in her business.

They live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

loans.use: Build another two rooms for rent.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna O. lives in Serei Sambatt village, in Kandal province. She and her husband, Nuth Nim, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. On this plantation, they face an obstacle because her field is infertile. In order to deal this problem, Vanna decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

She is a 49 year old mother of five children, one of whom breeds cows while another stays at home to do housework. The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: But fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Phum's Group

texts.en:
Phum is the leader of a group of borrowers consists of four members. Phum is a widow, mother of three children: all of them are students. She sells different kinds of vegetables such as cucumber, tomato, potato, salad, chili, etc. and she has been in this business for more than four years.

Phum has a lot of customers who always buy her vegetables in bulk because she is famous for her polite attitude. She also plants some vegetables behind her house.

Recently, Phum asked for a loan to buy fertilizer for her plantation. The other three group members are: P., 55, who sells vegetables in the local market; looking for a loan to buy more vegetables for selling. S., 58, who owns a plot of land for growing crops, is asking for a loan to buy a bicycle for her son to travel to school. R., 36, who sells vegetables, is taking a loan to invest in her business. They all live in the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom P. lives in Kampong Svay village, in Kandal province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Seng Long, owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, he is a fisherman.

Although they work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their lives, Mom decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She will use the rest of money to buy a machine to use with her husband's boat.

She is a 36 year-old mother of two children; one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding and a machine to use with her husband’s fishing boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal H. is 44 years old and he lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village, in Kandal province. He is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Chen Nary, is employed in a garment factory and earns a little salary. This couple has three children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the others attend the local school.

Visal is requesting a loan to pay for beauty school fees for his first child. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living after his children finish school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: Pay for beauty school for his first child.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa M. lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village, in Kandal province. She and her husband, Chhum Chhoeun, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables, to earn for living. They face an obstacle because they do not have rice seeds. Additionally, their field is infertile and far from an irrigation system.

In order to solve these problem, Channa decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to improve her crop.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Бурханов Фуркат 1969 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Он чинит машины, перекрашивает  и выставляет на  продажу. Но в основном он ремонтирует и делает переоборудование машин.  Его мастерская  находиться дома, он считает, что аренда очень дорого обходиться и не оправдывает его расходы. Для этого он сам переоборудовал гараж в мастерскую и занимается своим ремеслом.  Начал свой бизнес он год назад. Нехватка собственного капитала побудила его получить кредит В Микроинвест , и он благодарен что поддержали  его в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Furkat B. was born in 1969, he is married and has three children. He repairs cars and paints them and then puts up for resale. But mostly he just refurbishes and upgrades cars. His body shop is at his house because he think that renting a space is expensive and is not worth this expense. He has remodeled his garage for the shop and practices his craft there. He started his business one year ago. He does not have enough working capital and this has moved him to apply for a loan at MicroInvest. He is thankful to all who support him in his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of vehicles

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Jane T. is a 33-year-old married mother of two children, and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. For Mary, though raising children is an uphill task, it makes the parents’ struggle worth it. Since Mary was skilled and experienced in manicure/pedicure, she turned it into her business to earn a living. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in October 2008 to avail its loan facilities and benefits. In order to help her husband, who is a motor-cab driver, she started a new business of selling ready-to-wear (RTW) garments, aside from her manicure/pedicure service. She applies for PHP 10,000 to buy additional RTW garments and nail polish of various colors. Through this economic activity, she will be able to address the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional RTW clothes and nail polish

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en: Mrs. Cleofas T. is a 68-year-old widowed mother of three children, and lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. As she was skilled in dressmaking, she made it her business. She makes pillow cases and curtains and sells to her primary customers, which include her neighbors, friends and members of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative (PMPC). The cooperative has helped her especially in financial assistance aside from other benefits given to members. She applies for PHP 20,000 to buy additional material for making pillow cases and curtains. With this loan, she looks forward to making her business successful and hopes to open her own tailoring shop someday.

loans.use: to buy additional material for making pillow cases and curtains

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: A simple woman is Mrs. Marietta Buburan, 54 years old, married and a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a photographer, and that’s why they decided to open up a photo studio, which is also the family’s primary source of income. Mrs. Buburan works as the cashier at the studio. At first, they started only with one or two film rolls used for taking pictures. Later, they expanded their business and opened a photo shop. Their customers are mostly students, private and public employees and the like. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, financial incapacity has never been a hindrance for the Baburan family. PMPC has helped them through the years. Today, she applies for PHP 14,900 to buy films and additional capital for recopying of photos. She is looking forward to having a successful and profitable business ahead.

loans.use: to buy films and payment for recopying of photos

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Эргашев Уктам 1960 года рождения имеет 4 сына и 1 дочь. Высшего образования не имеет, но имеет хороший источник дохода. Он работает охранником  в АТК . Он разводит скот и перепродает на рынке. Сено и другой корм он почти не покупает. Так как ест земля где сажает жмых и другой корм для скота. Сейчас он хочет расширить  свой коровник, у него 2 коровника где можно держать еще несколько голов скота. Жена Уктама любит ухаживать за своей коровой, потому что корова дает много и очень хорошего молока, которые употребляют внуки и дети. Он узнал о Микроинвесте у своего сына и обратился  за кредитом.
texts.en:
Uktam Ergashaev was born in 1960 and has four sons and one daughter. He does not have a higher education, but has a good source of income. He works as a security guard at ATK. He also raises and resells cattle on the market. He rarely buys hay and other fodder because he has a plot of land where he grows oil meal and other fodder for the cattle. At this time he wants to expand the cow house. He has two cow houses where he can keep several more heads of cattle. Uktam's wife loves to take care of her cow because it gives a lot of very good quality milk which their children and grandchildren drink. Uktam has found out about MicroInvest from his son and has decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Mrs. Emely A. lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, is 32-years old, married and has six children, four of whom are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman. Her husband's catch is sold to neighbors. Last April 2006, she became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and had received several loans for several. Some of these loans were used for gasoline & fishing nets. Now, she is requesting a loan repair their damaged pump boat. She would be happy for all of her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: To repair pumpboat used for fishing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Mrs. Rosalie P., is 31-years old, married and lives at Catarman ,Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has one child. Her husband is a fisherman, and this is their primary source of income. Her husband's catch is sold to public markets or to their neighbors. Their fishing business, started with one boat, has sustained their daily needs despite the weather conditions. In later years, they were able to add another pump boat to thier business by receiving a loan from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative, who has helped them with financial assistance. Mrs. P. became a member last April 2006 and has received several loans. Today she is requesting a loan to paint their newly made pump boat. In the future, she hopes to own a stall in the public market for display of their fishes and acquire more pump boats.

loans.use: To paint the pump boat used for fishing business

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Каримов Умарбой удачно закончил свой кредит в марте месяце и решил получить ещё деньги, для расширения своего бизнеса животноводства. После предыдущего кредита у него увеличилось количество скота и корма для них. Теперь он хочет потратить кредит для купли породистых баранов. Умарбой , доволен сотрудничать с Микроинвест
texts.en:
Umarboy K. has successfully completed his previous loan in March and decided to get another loan to expand his animal husbandry business. After his previous loan he has increased the number of livestock and amount of fodder. Right now he wants to spend the loan to buy pedigree rams. Umarboy is very happy to collaborate with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил подал заявку на следующий кредит, для увеличения скота. Сейчас у него шесть коров и , которые дают жирное молоко. Его жена доит и продаёт в своём посёлке.
Абдучалил сам классный электрик, поэтому он без проблем погашает свои кредиты. На деньги  следующего, займа он хочет закупить больше корма для коров, а также и две коровы. Он благодарен KIVA за финансирование.
texts.en:
Abdujalil requested his next loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. Currently, he owns six dairy cows that supply rich milk. His wife milks the cows and sells the milk in their village. Abdujalil is an excellent electrician, and this is why he has no problems repaying his loans. With the money from this loan, he wants to purchase two additional cows and more feed for the cows. He is grateful to Kiva for the financing opportunities.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Chhuon's Group

texts.en:
S., 43, is a leader of a group consisting of five members. She is a mother of three children: one is married and the other two are students. She is married to Chantha, 50, who owns a tourist car transportation service. S. owns a service for laundry. She is taking a loan to buy materials for making palm sugar because this season is for palm sugar making.

The other four members are: L., 29, who sells grocery products, is taking a loan to invest in her business. V., 27, who sells fruit, is looking for a loan to buy more fruit to sell. S., 21, who owns a service of laundry, is asking for a loan to buy palm juice for making sugar. L., 32, owns a number of palm trees and is taking a loan to support her business. They all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy materials for making palm sugar.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб клиент в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Его бизнес, продажа продуктов питания и кулинарных изделий, тортов , пирожный.Поставляют ему поставщики с кондитерских цехов.Его магазин расположен в центре рынка города Костакоз.У него постоянно торговля кипит.Следующий займ он хочет потратить на закуп напитков, соков.Он благодарен всем инвесторам за финансирование и давшую ему возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Tolib has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. His business is selling food and bakery products, such as cakes and pastries. His suppliers are large bakeries. Tolib’s store is located in the center of the market in Kostakoz. His business is consistently booming. He wants to use this loan to purchase beverages and juice. He is grateful to all investors for the financing that enabled Tolib to grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food products

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada M. is a 57 yearold mother of four. She is married to a farmer who works a small parcel of land inherited from his parents. She raises pigs and barters for rice every harvest season. She trades soft drinks and bread for rice (palay) then resells to support her husband’s income. This livelihood of hers started 33 years ago, but improving the family's living conditions remains impossible.

Condrada applied for this loan to finance fertilizers and insecticides and to buy one piglet. She wants to buy these items in advance in order to get a lesser price, and to avoid borrowing money from her neighbor during planting season. When she borrows from her neighbor, she usually pays back in rice grains after harvest which is very disadvantageous to her. Condrada hopes that through her loan, she and her husband can save their harvest and get a better price at market. She wants to help support her grand children's education, buy another rice field, and build a better house for the family.

loans.use: Buy fertlizer and insecticides and one piglet.

loans.name: Zahera Group

texts.en: Zahera is the group leader of the Zahera group. There are three members in this group. They all want to expand their businesses. Zahera is a tailor and she has four years of experience in this business. She wants to take out a loan for her business to buy the necessary materials. Mah Gul’s husband has a retail shop and she wants to take out a loan for him. Bari Gul is a good embroiderer and wants to use the loan for expanding her business. They request a group loan of 18,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They all admire this process.

loans.use: Tailoring materials

loans.name: Chanthoen

texts.en:
Mrs Chanthoen C. lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province, Cambodia. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

Chanthoen C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates both rice and vegetables. However, she does not have enough resources to grow the vegetables and, in order to deal with this problem, she has asked for a loan to buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to the field. Her husband, Mr Suon Samnang (shown on the left of the photo), is a fisherman and also helps his wife in her work.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to the field

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is the group leader of the Farida group. The four members of this group all want to expand their businesses. Farida wants to take a loan for her tailoring business; Abinulyamin's loan is for his tire repairing shop; Jamila wants to take a loan for her embroidery business; M. Halem's loan is for his car workshop.

They have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani for the term of ten months. The group send many thanks to Kiva lenders for supporting entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To progress their businesses

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: S. is a 30-year-old mother of two young children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is married to Chhay, 36, who sells beef in the market. For more than two years S. has owned a shop where she sells breakfast and dinner. She has attracted a lot of customers because she is well known for her good cooking. She is taking a loan of $600 USD to buy a motorbike for her family's business. Her desire is to have a large house and for her children to obtain degrees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family's business

loans.name: Rose Clair

texts.en:
Rose Clair O. is a 22-year-old mother of two. Her husband is a tricycle taxi driver (a tricycle is a motorcycle with sidecar). At her young age, she wants to establish a business to help her husband. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in order to raise capital.

Presently, she grows vegetables to sell, and sometimes buys and resells charcoal. She applied for this loan to buy 25 heads of native chicken. She wants to venture into this business to increase her income to support the increasing needs of her children. She dreams of having a poultry farm, and buying a tricycle for her husband in the future (he rents now). She hopes to save more money to send her two daughters to a university and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy 25 native chickens

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Danaya de l’association Benkadi sont toutes mariées. Leur moyenne d’âge  se situe autour de 31 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Danaya vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Dalan de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  de friperie et de poissons fumés. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité.
 Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Danaya a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de friperie à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali), des cartons  de poissons fumés à Mopti et à San. Le poisson est vendu au comptant et en détail à la maison et dans les marchés environnants de San. Quant à la friperie, elle est vendue  au marché de San, à la maison et en ambulant au comptant et à crédit.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 60 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The nine women in the Danaya group from the Benkadi association are all married. Their average age is about 31 and they have an average of five children each. The Danaya group members live in traditional large extended families in the Dalan neighborhood of San (a town in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They all perform the same business activity: buying and selling used clothing and smoked fish. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Danaya group found a solution to their problems by joining the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy bales of used clothing in Bamako (the capital on the Republic of Mali), and cartons of smoked fish in Mopti and San. The fish are sold separately for cash from home and in the markets around San. As for the used clothing, it is sold at the San market, from home and door-to-door for cash or credit. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and smoked fish

loans.name: Heremakono (Dans L’Attente Du Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Heremakono sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 47 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  7 enfants. Les membres du groupe Heremakono vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Dah de la préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent la même activité de vente  de condiments alimentaires et d’arachide. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Heremakono  a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires à San, des sacs d’arachide pour les décortiquer et en faire de la pâte et des cacahouètes pour la vente. Les condiments sont vendus en détail à la maison et aux marchés proches. Quant à la pâte d’arachide et aux cacahouètes, elles  sont vendues  au marché de San  à la maison et en ambulant au comptant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 35 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Heremakono group are all married; they have an average age of about 47 and they have an average of seven children each. The Heremakono group members live in traditional large extended families in the village of Dah in the prefecture of San (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They all perform the same business activity selling condiments and peanuts. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Heremakono group found a solution to their problems by joining the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy condiments in San, and sacks of peanuts to shell and make peanut butter and also sell the peanuts. The condiments are sold retail from home and in nearby markets. As for the peanut butter and the peanuts, they are sold in the San market, from home and door-to-door for cash. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make an average profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts and condiments

loans.name: Meer Azam Group

texts.en: Meer Azam is the group leader of the Meer Azam group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Meer Azam wants to take a loan for the business of carpentry. Najellah wants to take a loan for tailoring. Torpayke wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Muhammad Maruf wants to take a loan for the business of carpentry. They requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They are all thankful to the Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: expanding their businesses

loans.name: Siguidia (Fait Bon Vivre) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Siguidia sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 27 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Les membres du groupe Siguidia vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Dalan de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent  la même activité de vente  de manioc frais et de poissons fumés. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité.
 Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Siguidia a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des cartons  de poissons fumés à Mopti et à Korientzé, quant au manioc il  est acheté au fur  et à mesure auprès des producteurs. Le poisson est vendu au comptant, en détail à la maison et dans les marchés environnants de San. Quant au manioc, il est vendu  au marché de San  à la maison et en ambulant, au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women in the Siguidia group are all married; they have an average age of about 27 and they have an average of four children each. The Siguidia group members live in traditional large extended families in the Dalan neighborhood of San (a town in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They all perform the same business activity selling fresh manioc and smoked fish. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Siguidia group found a solution to their problems by joining the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy boxes of smoked fish in Mopti and Korientzé. As for the manioc, it is purchased as and when from the growers. The fish are sold separately for cash from home and in the markets around San. As for the manioc, it is sold retail at the San market, from home and door-to-door for cash or credit. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make an average profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and manioc

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en: S., 30, is a leader of a borrowers group consisting of four members. He is a father of a child who is still young. He is married to Teap, 32, who sells vegetables in a local market. S. has been a local construction foremA. for more thA. one year. He is sought after for he is good at building. S. is tired of taking a motor taxi so he looking for a loA. to buy a motorbike for his business. R., 29, who sells vegetables in the market is taking a loA. to buy a motorbike for family transportation. S. A., 39, who sells vegetables in the market is asking for a loA. to invest in her business. And KeA., 25, who is a local construction worker is taking a loA. to buy a motorbike for traveling to his work. They all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business

loans.name: Djekabara  (Le  Travail Collectif) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Djekabara sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 34 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe  Djekabara vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le  village  Paridara au bord du fleuve (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté (elles appartiennent toutes à la même ethnie, Bobo de San). 
Elles font la même activité de confection  et  de vente  de Secco. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité et ont une grande réputation.
 Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djekabara a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  de la paille et la stocker avant la saison pluvieuse. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant en détail à la maison à Paridara au  bord du fleuve à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 60 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant une autre activité.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Djekabara are all married and average about 34 years of age and 5 children. The group members live in large traditional extended families in the village of Paridara on the riverbank (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship (they belong to the same ethnicity, the Bobo of San). They do the same work, making and selling secco. They are in high demand in this business of theirs and have a great reputation.

To satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members found that the solution to their problems was to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

They intend to use this loan to buy some straw and to stock it ahead of the rainy season. They make their sales in retail cash transaction at the house, in Paridara on the riverbank, to customers composed essentially of men.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing another business activity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy straw for making "secco"

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie M. lives near the Sulu Sea in the municipality of Pandan, at the northern end of Antique Province.  Small fishing boats dot the beach near her house, and much of the economic activity in her neighborhood revolves around the sea.  Marjorie has two daughters and two sons, ranging in age from seven to 14 years old; the youngest is in kindergarten and the oldest is in the sixth grade.  Her husband, Narciso, is a farmer and fisherman.Marjorie has been selling fish, salt, and rice for ten years.  She sells from her house, and walks from place to place selling her goods from a basket.  She plans to use the money from this loan as working capital to buy items to resell.She hopes God will grant her the good health to continue working, so she can grow her business and perhaps establish a fixed location outside her house to sell from in the future.  She wants to be able to earn enough to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Horogna (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Horogna sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes de ce groupe se situe autour de 35 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  6 enfants. Les membres du groupe Horogna vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles  élargies au  village de Paridara au bord du fleuve (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. 
Elles exercent presque la même activité  de vente de beurre de karité et de secco. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Horogna   décida d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter et stocker du beurre de karité et des Seccos qu’elles achètent avec leurs maris qui le confectionnent. Les Seccos sont vendus au comptant en détail au bord du fleuve à Paridara (où il n’y a pas  de marché). Quant au beurre de karité, il est vendu et à la maison et au marché de San. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 35 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Horogna are all married and average about 35 years of age and 6 children each. The group members live in large traditional extended families in the village of Paridara on the banks of the river (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do almost the same work, selling shea nut butter and secco butter. The women are in high demand in this business of theirs.

To satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

They intend to use this loan to buy and store shea nut butter and seccos that they buy with their husbands, who process it. The seccos are sold in retail cash transactions on the riverbank in Paridara (where there is no marketplace). As for the shea nut butter, it’s sold at the house and at the San marketplace.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea nut butter and "secco"

loans.name: Sabougnouman ((La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont toutes mariées, leur moyenne d’âge se situe autour de 42 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Sabougnouman vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le  village de Paridara au bord du fleuve (région de Ségou, république du Mali).
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté (elles appartiennent à la même ethnie Bobo). Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de toutes sortes de pièces détachées de moto et vélo. En plus, ces femmes Bobo vendent du tchapalo (boisson alcoolisée de fabrication locale à partir du mil). Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités.
 Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouman a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  des sacs de mil, et une quantité importante de pièces détachées   au marché de San avec  les grossistes. Les pièces détachées et le tchapalo sont vendus au comptant en détail à la maison à Paridara (où il n’y a pas de marché).
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en y ajoutant la vente du vin rouge.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Sabougnouman are all married. They average about 42 years of age and 5 children each. The group members live in large traditional extended families in the village of Paridara on the banks of the river (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship (they belong to the same Bobo ethnicity), and they do almost the same work, selling all sorts of spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles. In addition, these Bobo women sell tchapalo (an alcoholic beverage made locally from millet). The women are in high demand in these businesses of theirs.

To satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members found that the solution to their problems was joining the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). They intend to use this loan to buy sacks of millet and a sizable quantity of spare parts from wholesalers at the San marketplace. The spare parts and the tchapalo are sold in retail cash transactions at the house in Paridara (where there is no marketplace).

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 65,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by adding the sale of red wine.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts and some millet

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Supportive wife best describes Mrs. Marlene T., 55-years old, and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a furniture maker. Due to her husband's skill,  they are known not just in Panaon, but also nearby towns. Her husbandmakes chairs, cabinets, tables, etc. at a competitive rate. Joining Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative was a great opportunity for her & her family. She was able to send her children to college. She was able to renovate their house also. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase additional lumbers for furniture making. She’s hopeful that their business will attract many new of clients and many orders, with God’s blessing.

loans.use: To buy additional lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Benkadi  (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 38 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Les membres du groupe Benkadi vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Soloso  préfecture de San (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
L’activité  principale de ce groupe est la fabrication  et vente des articles en terres cuites (canaris, jarres, fumoirs, encensoirs etc.) Elles ont appris ce métier à bas âge avec les parents. En plus de l’artisanat, elles font le commerce des articles tels le beurre de karité. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, du beurre de karité en grande quantité  et  des chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffe (pour la cuisson des articles en terre glaise). Le beurre est vendu au comptant en détail à la maison et au marché de San, quant aux articles de l’artisanat, ils sont  vendus en gros au comptant dans le village aux autres femmes qui ne le font pas. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women in the Benkadi group are all married and average 38 years of age and 4 children. The members of the group live in large extended traditional families in Soloso, a village in the San Prefecture (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. The main business of the group consists in manufacturing and selling various terracotta pots (canaris, jars, thuribles, etc). They learned this business at a young age with their parents. In addition to handicraft, they also sell products such as shea butter. They are very much in demand in this business.

To meet the needs of its ever-increasing demand, the Benkadi group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.

The women intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of shea butter, and cartloads of firewood (to cook terracotta items). The butter is retailed for cash, at home and at the San market. Handicraft items are sold wholesale and for cash, to the other women in the village, who do not make them.

During this loan cycle, they hope to turn an average profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 130) each, to be used to repay the loan, and to provide for their extended families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea butter and firewood

loans.name: Rosenette

texts.en:
Rosenette P. lives in a beautiful spot in a rural area within the municipality of Pandan, at the north of Antique Province on the island of Panay.  The 45-year-old mother of four likes to garden, tending to a small plot of flowers near her house.  Her youngest child is in the fifth grade, two others are in college, and one has a university degree in commerce and works in Manila.  Her husband Warlito is a farmer.

Four years ago, Rosenette started a business making and selling bukayo, a sweet treat made from coconut, sugar, water, and vanilla.  Her father taught her how to make it.  The process involves frying up the mixture in a big iron pan over open flame.  Once it's cooked, Rosenette uses bamboo molds to shape it into bite-size pieces, puts five in a package, and seals it up.  In 2008 she was featured on national TV in a show about Pandan, which is becoming more popular as a travel desitnation. After the appearance she says she got many new orders as people text-messaged inquries to her.  Many of her new customers were Filipinos living and working overseas.

Business has been steady since her star turn, and Rosenette hopes to grow her bukayo-making operation.  She is applying for this loan to buy a coconut shredder -- an electric grinder to extract coconut meat from the shell -- and other tools to help boost her production capacity.  If she can grow her business, she says she'd like to be able to employ other women who are members of ASHI, the microfinance institution from which she borrows. She also wants to be able to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a coconut shredder and other tools used for confectionery production.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Mrs. Jhona M. is 58-years old, married and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occiedental. She has two children and her husband is a farmer. She helps the family's income by buying and selling various items like root crops, vegetables, or anything she can. She opened up a “sari-sari” store adjacent to their house, and is hoping to raise pigs for sell to increase her income. She became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This coop teaches women to have their own livelihood project to support their husband’s income. She has received several loans. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her new pig-raising business and to buy goods for her sari-sari store. Her husband is very supportive of her.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and basic commodities/goods for sale

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola M. is 25-years old, married, and has two children in school.  She is in the business of selling beer, and is requesting a loan to open a bar. She will also use the loan to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar

loans.name: Danaya  (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Danaya de l’association Kodiagnonna sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 49 ans  et elles ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Les membres du groupe Danaya vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Soloso  préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  de  soumbala  et de canaris. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Danaya a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré (pour les  transformer en soumbala) et  des canaris avec les  femmes forgerons de la localité. Le soumbala est vendu au comptant en détail à la maison et au marché de San quant aux canaris ils sont   vendus en détail, au comptant  et à crédit dans le village et au marché de San. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women in the Danaya group of the Kodiagnonna association are all married, and average 49 years of age and 4 children. The members of the Danaya group live in large extended traditional families in the Soloso village, in the San Prefecture (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship.

They run very similar businesses, consisting in selling soumbala (a condiment made out of néré seeds) and "canaris" (small containers). They are very much in demand in this business. To satisfy the needs of an ever-increasing clientele, the Danaya group found a solution to its problems by joining Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which it is seeking its third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.

The women intend to use this loan to buy sacks of néré nuts (to turn into soumbala), and canaris from the blacksmith women in the village. Soumbala is retailed for cash, at home and at the San market. Canaris are retailed for cash and on credit, in the village and in the San market.

During this loan cycle, the women hope to turn an average profit of XOF 55'000 (ca US$ 110) each, to be used to repay the loan and to provide for their extended families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts and canaris (small containers)

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Mrs. Rowena C. is 37 years old and lives at Punta Blanca, Oroquieta City. She has a common law husband who is a motor cab driver. They have been in a relationship for many years already but have not borne a child. She concentrates on earning for their daily needs and hopes that someday they will be blessed with at least one child.

She has opened a “sari-sari” store (general store) as another source of income. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, being a member since September 2008. Today, she is applying for PHP8,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store and to repair their motorcycle. Her plan is to have a happy and contented family of her own.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Mrs. Lolita M. is 39 years old, married and lives at Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. In her own little way, she wants to help her husband with selling fish. She plans to opens a “sari-sari” store (general store) in order to have another source of income. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in December 2005 and has availed of loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP3,000 to buy fishing nets. She looks forward to someday having a better future for all her children after they finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets & gasoline for fishing

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily S. is currently in the business of selling perfumes in a shop and is requesting a loan to buy shoes and bedsheets to sell. Lily is 45 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy shoes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta M. of Sebaste, Antique has been an active member of ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) for one year. She has five children, four have graduated college and presently all are employed. One of her children still lives at home. She joined ASHI not only for loans but for pleasure since every week the group meets at their center meeting.
