She wants to be involved in the community in order  to get out of the house and not be bored. She applied for a loan to buy pigs and raise capital for fish vending. She wants to venture in this business to save money for an operation on her chin.  She hopes that in the future she could have a sewing machine to practice her sewing ability, and dreams to have a beautiful house.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fish for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
"Hard-working woman" best describes Mrs. Teresita Q., who is 49 years old, married and lives at Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has 3 children. Fortunately, her husband works at the Mayor’s office as a regular employee receiving a regular salary. Her husband’s income sometimes is not enough to meet the needs of the family, especially when all her children demand for allowance and tuition fees. She has to borrow money from neighbors, relatives or a lending institution.

In July 2001, Mrs. Q. heard of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and joined. She has availed of loans several times already. “No regrets” - that’s what Mrs. Q. has said. She has been able to provide for the needs of her children; she was able to send 2 of her children to college, who have finished already. Now, she is venturing into the business of pig raising while she’s at home. She is applying for PHP14,900 to buy feed and bananas to sell. She’s looking forward to the success of this business.

loans.use: To buy feed & bananas to sell

loans.name: Makelina

texts.en:
Makelina J. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at her home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Makelina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a bar

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Mrs. Lea E. is 47 years old and married. She lives at Paypayan, Oroquieta City. She has 3 children. After she heard news about Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative, she got interested in it; that’s why she joined the co-op in February 2009. She’s happy that her project will come into reality because the cooperative will be able to finance her.

She started her dream business, which is raising pigs. She has applied for php 20,000 to buy sacks of feeds and an extension to her pig cage, for expansion. She hopes that someday her business will become successful and more profitable. She also wants to have a piggery one of these days.

loans.use: To buy feeds and an extension for the pigs' cage

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria S. lives steps from the Sulu Sea in the municipality of Bugasong, in the central part of Antique Province.  She has three young daughters, aged six, three, and two months old.  Her husband, Christopher, is a fisherman, as are many in their community.  Small fishing boats dot the beach near Gloria's house, and much of the local economy revolves around the sea. Gloria saw her own opportunity in all this: she realized that nobody in her neighborhood was selling basic fishing supplies, so she decided to start a business retailing materials like filament, hooks, and fabric used to make lures.  She plans to use most of the money from this loan to buy fishing supplies to start her business, and also wants to purchase one piglet to raise.Gloria hopes to be able to grow her business into an established operation, and wants to be able to earn enough money to send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fishing implements for resale, and to purchase one piglet.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosie M. is 33 years old and presently resides at Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with only one kid. Her husband is currently working abroad. Mrs. M. wanted to have her own income, so she joined Paglaum; she heard that Paglaum is offering credit services with a minimal interest rate. She became a member on October 23, 2006 and took a loan amounting to PHP 3,000.00 as her first loan. She used it as a starting capital for a banana and dried fish vending business. 

Mrs. M. is now on her sixth loan cycle. This loan, amounting to PHP 14,900.00, will be used to buy more stocks of bananas and dried fish. Her business is slowly growing. She was so very happy that she had her own income. She is sad that now we are facing a global crisis, so it is necessary for both husband and wife to look for a source of living.  Her hopes and aspirations are that her business will expand and become stable some day.

loans.use: Purchase addtional stocks of bananas and dried fish

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth Y. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Elizabeth is 48 years old and widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia P., currently in the business of selling green vegetables, is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Twenty-six years old and married to a soldier, Cicilia has two children, both attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to eventually buy a bus to transport passengers from place to place. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop.

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth S., currently in the business of selling smoked fish, is requesting a loan to buy more smoked and fresh fish to sell.  Elizerbeth, a 45-year-old widow,  has three children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay their school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members

loans.use: To buy more smoked and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs. Imelda B., presently living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is married to a soldier and they have five children, two of whom are married while the remaining three are still in school.  Imelda is engaged in the restaurant (carenderia) and variety (sari-sari) store business to help the family, having begun the enterprises with five thousand pesos capital. At the time she knew about Paglaum MPC's program and services, especially its financial assistance and insurance, and wasted little time in becoming a member. 

Imelda believes that their small businesses will elevate their living standard.  This will be her third loan seeking additional capital for the carenderia and sari-sari store. Her heart’s desire is to see her children finish college and secure bright futures.

loans.use: Additional capital for carenderia and sari-sari store.

loans.name: Masmilian

texts.en:
Mismilian J., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to buy more flour for the business.  Forty years old and widowed,  Mismilian  has four children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she eventually hopes to build a hotel at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more flour for baking bread.

loans.name: Rahmonazar

texts.ru: Рахмоназар женат ему 42 года, у него есть 4 детей. Имеет высшее образование , но после рапсада Союза остался без работы.  Ему пришлось идти по стопам отца откармливать и продавать скот. Более 10 лет он занимается разведением скота. В бизнесе помогают дети, когда он уходит на работу . Он работает охранником в Железно дорожной станции. У него есть дойная корова, и поэтому его жене не приходиться покупать молоко. На кануне он продал молодого бычка, для покупки более зрелого, за которого дают хорошую плату, ему понадобилось большая сумма. Он обратился в Микроинвест, и был благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahmonazar is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a higher education, but he was left without work after the fall of the Soviet Union. He had to follow his father’s steps and started raising and selling livestock. He has been in this business over 10 years. Rahmonazar’s children help with the business when he leaves for work. He works as a security guard at a train station. Rahmonazar owns a dairy cow; this is why his wife does not need to buy milk. He recently sold a young bull in order to purchase a more mature one, which will earn him a good pay. However, Rahmonazar needed more money for the purchase. He requested a loan at MicroInvest and is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро замужем ей 45 лет, у нее 5 детей. Имеет среднее специальное образование. Она торгует женским бельем, носками и другими вещами. На рынке торгует 20 лет. Основной товар который реализуется это носки и махси (национальные носки из кожи). Ее бизнес расширяется год от года. За товаром ездит сама. Она привозит товар, а иногда дает деньги своим знакомым , они являются соседями по бизнесу. Благодаря поддержке КИВА она развивает свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Zuhro is married, she is 45 years old and has five children. She has specialized secondary education. She sells women's undergarments, socks and other clothing. She has been selling on the market for 20 years. Mainly what sells well is socks and mahsi (Tajik national socks from leather). Her business is expanding each year. Zuhro travels for the merchandise herself. She brings over the goods, but sometimes she pays her business neighbors. Thanks to Kiva's support she is expanding the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Солиева Зеби клиентка в Микроинвесте уже четвёртый год. Её бизнес это пошив женских платьев с вышивками. Раньше у неё в цеху вышивальная машинка была в аренду, поняв что выгоднее купить собственную машинку , Зеби решила в кредит купить вышивальную машинку. Сейчас у нас очень модно носить национальные платья с вышивками, поэтому сейчас сезон данного бизнеса. Сама   Зеби одна из лучших клиентов в Микроинвест, поэтому мы рады с ней сотрудничать.
.
texts.en:
Zebi S. has been a client of MicroInvest for four years. Her business is making of women's dresses with embroidery. She used to rent an embroidery machine before, but after realizing that it's more profitable to own a machine Zebi has decided to buy this machine in credit. Right now it is very fashionable to wear national dresses with embroidery and this is why it is a good season for this type of business. Zebi is one of the best clients of MicroInvest and we are happy to collaborate with her.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making of national dresses

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Гулмурод 1978 года рождения, он женат имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Он занимается разведением скота  с детства, но выводит на рынок   скот только  1 год.  Теперь его отец посоветовал обратится в Микроинвест для начинания своего бизнеса. Ведь у него есть своя семья, он должен обеспечивать их.  Жена сидит дома, она домохозяйка. Жена его также помогает ухаживать за скотом, кормит и убирает там.  Она доит корову и когда много молока продают соседям. 
Гулмурод благодарен КИВА за  поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulmurod was born in 1978, he is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He has been in the animal husbandry business since childhood, but has only been selling on the market for one year. His father has advised him to come to MicroInvest to start own business. Gulmurod has his own family and needs to support it. His wife is a housewife and stays at home. She also helps him to take care of the livestock, feeds and cleans up after it. She also milks a cow and when there's a lot of milk she gives some to the neighbors. Gulmurod is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат 1982 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование , но по специальности работать не хочет так как заработная плата очень низкая. Она торгует на рынке  более 3 лет. Она продает материалы , ее покупатели в основном женщины, портнихи. Сейчас весна и сезон шитья платья и других национальных изделий. Портные заказывают ей материалы , и она привозит то что заказали клиенты. Товар привозит сама так как не доверяет вкусу других. Для расширения бизнеса и ассортимента товара, ей потребовалось необходимая сумма, и она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой.
texts.en:
Shafoat was born in 1982, she is married and has two children. She has high education, but does not want to work in her profession because the salary is very low. She is selling on the market for more than three years. She sells fabrics and her customers are mostly women who are seamstresses. Right now is spring and it's a season for sewing of dresses and other Tajik national clothing. Seamstresses order the fabrics from Shafoat and she brings in what her clients have requested. She choses the fabrics herself because she does not rely on the taste of others. To expand her business and variety of her merchandise she needs a certain amount of money and she has come to MicroInvest for support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar S., 32, operates a small grocery store providing daily necessities such as staple foods, soda, cleaners, etc.  Married with four children between the ages of four and nine,  Sahar started the business to help her husband pay for their children's education as well as the household expenses. 

Sahar is always looking for ways to increase business and attract new customers. With the $1000 loan she is hoping to receive, she will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La Señora Elisa tiene 62 años de edad y esta casada con su marido Juan, quien tiene 65 años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos todos casados. 

Doña Elisa es propietaria de una despensa en el cual se inició en el año 1990, la cual heredo de su madre. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que les ofrece a sus clientes. En dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de su Marido.

Ña Elisa como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mejor comodidad y mas variedades de productos.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias varias.
texts.en:
Elisa is 62 years old. She is married to Juan who is 65. They have 4 children who are all married. Elisa inherited a general store from her mother. Elisa became the proprietor of the store in 1990. She has a well formed customer base because of the good attention she offers her customers. Her husband helps her with the business. Elisa’s personal dream is to expand her business to be able to offer her customers more comfort and a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
This is Mosses T., Alhaji K., Emmanuel K., and Samuel L. K.. They named their group Tamensu. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They had received several loans through SMT. Previously, each one of the group received a loan of Le 800,000. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mosses (right) is the leader of the group. He is thirty-five years of age. He was born in a village called Makump Bama, five miles from Makeni. His wife is a businesswoman and the two have three children – two of them are in secondary schools and the last is still not of school-going age. Mosses has been a businessman since 2000.

Mosses owes a small kiosk where he sells both soft and hard drinks. With this new loan, he will buy ten cartons of bottled drinks and ten cartons of canned drinks. Depending on the type of drink, prices for canned drinks range between Le 40,000 – 85,000, and prices for bottled drinks range between Le 30,000 – 85,000.

With this loan, Mosses' profit margin will increase and with the increase in profit, he will be able to develop his business by reinvesting the profit into the business, sustaining himself and family.

loans.use: Buy crates of hard drinks and soft drinks

loans.name: Sara Auma

texts.en: Sara Auma B. is a 25-year-old mother of three children ages 10, 8, and 2 and a half. The older two are in school. She sells second-hand clothes in the Nyamasaria slum where she also lives. She buys the clothes from the Kibuye market in town and transports them to the slum. When she can, she buys spices from Nairobi and sells them as well. When asked what she enjoys doing in her free-time she looked surprised and responded, “I have no free-time! I work for the kids!” She is asking for a loan of 10,000 KSH.

loans.use: buying used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Millicent Akinyi

texts.en: Millicent Akinyi W. is a 26-year-old mother of three children, ages 10, 6 and 4. All are in school.  Millicent is married though her husband is not employed. On the weekends, Millicent works as a caterer. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 KSH so she can start her own business selling food. She hopes that her business will turn enough profit to allow her to go back to school so that she can one day start her own catering company as a professional.

loans.use: ingredients to make food for sale and classes

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita O., one of Paglaum's members, is married to a very industrious farmer. Rita has four children. The couple is presently residing at Magsaysay, Sibutad, ZDN.

They are engaged in fish and "sari-sari" (variety) store vending. Presently, Rita is applying to access a loan amounting to five thousand pesos Php 5,000 as additional capital for her fish-selling, so she can cope with the demand of her customers.

As always, Rita is hoping that someday she can expand her present businesses and can send her children to school and have them finish their desired courses in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for fish-vending

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday K. was born in Kabala and is thirty-seven and married, with four children. He has been an entrepreneur for over five years now. Foday K. has received several loans from SMT. With previous loans, he was able to expand his business, made more profit, paid school fees and other related charges for the children and bought house-building materials. Having repaid the last loan successfully, he is requesting a new loan to further improve his business and standard of living.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Josephine Obiero

texts.en: Josephine Obiero M. is forty-one years old and the mother of three, ages twenty, sixteen and ten. She told us during the interview that one of her children recently passed away. The rest of her children are currently in school and she and her husband combine incomes to pay for their school fees. She sells second-hand clothes in the Kibuye market while her husband is a bike mechanic. Normally, Josephine buys her second-hand clothes from those who can afford to purchase full bales. With the loan, Josephine hopes to purchase a bale on her own, cutting out the cost of dealing with another middle man. She says the profit will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Jane Auma

texts.en: Jane Auma A. is a thirty-year-old mother of four children, ages sixteen, ten, nine and eight. She is married to a glass cutter and their combined incomes help pay the school fees for the children. She runs a small kiosk where she sells vegetables, tomatoes and kale that she buys from the Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. Jane hopes her children become teachers, nurses or police officers.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single mother with two children. She hails from Marapong, Sibutad, ZDN.  Judith is involved in baking cakes and pastries. She's been in this business since she was still single. She raises her children using the income from her baking business. In addition to baking, she is also selling ready-to-wear items.

Currently she is asking for her third loan, amounting to $150, for the purchase of additional baking materials, such as flour, baking soda, yeast and shortening. Judith is hoping that her business will grow big and hopes that she can retire someday with enough savings. She is thankful to Kiva and PMPC for this credit opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata A. is twenty-six years old and the mother of three children, ages nine, six and three. She sells cereals in the Nyamasaria slum where she lives. She says her dream is to finance her children all the way through college and that she enjoys running her own business. She buys most of her goods from the Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. Her husband also helps finance things as a tailor. Consolata is asking for $125 to expand her business.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine K. was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Alusine is forty-two years of age, married with five children. Alusine sells local produce such as rice, ground-nuts and beans. He also serves as a storekeeper in Kabala town market. With the previous loans from SMT, Alusine has seen a lot of improvements in his life. With previous loans, he has been able to buy a plot of land, educate his children and solve most of his domestic problems. Having repaid the last loan successfully, he is now requesting a new loan to further strengthen his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea A. is twenty-one years old and the mother of two children aged six and four. Both children are in school and she hopes she can pay for their education so they can find good jobs. She is a vegetable vendor and wants a loan of $125 to expand her business. She buys her vegetables from Sondu, a small town near Kisii. Lea works and lives in Nyamasaria slum with her husband, a tow-truck driver.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: Mr. Rodolfo M. is fifty-four years old and married with no children. Rodolfo is responsible and a good member of Paglaum MPC. Their income is from fishing. He needs to have a fishing net and accessories for his fishing business. He decided to borrow the amount of $225 from the cooperative to buy what he needs. It will help them a lot to have additional income to sustain their daily needs. His future plan is to improve their living situation and to live happily with his wife.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and accessories for fishing

loans.name: Sulmena

texts.en: Sulmena A. has three children, ages twelve, ten and eight, whom she is raising on her own as a widow.  She works in an orphanage, and in the past she has used her extra money to sponsor children at work. She is very excited to be eligible for a loan and eager to pay this one back so she can get a larger one. She lives and works in Nyamasaria slum in Kisumu and is asking for $125.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase items for her variety store

loans.name: Kondowulay P.

texts.en:
Kondowulay P. K. was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. He is in his early thirties, married with two children. Kondowulay runs a guest house in Kabala town with a small bar.  In his bar, he sells both hard and soft drinks. With previous SMT loans, Kondowulay has been able to build two more structures onto his guest house to add to the two he previous had. Loans through SMT have made tremendous impact in the life of Kondowulay. 

Having repaid the last loan successfully, he is now requesting a new one in order to further strengthen his business. With the profit he makes from the loan, he will be able to make his monthly repayments, feed himself and his children and wife, and send the children to school.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen Tabuñagn lives in the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is twenty-seven years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She got married at a young age and had some difficulty, especially in providing for the needs of the family. It is very hard for her to budget a small amount of income considering the rising prices of basic commodities. According to her, she must have another source of income to add to what her husband earns. Last year, she decided to join the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to take advantage of its loan facilities and benefits. She was able to start her buying and selling of vegetables and food vending. Her customers are her neighbors, tricycle-taxi drivers, students and Paglaum co-members. Now, she is applying for $325 to buy vegetables for selling as well as other ingredients needed for her food vending.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Jackline Anyango

texts.en: Jackline Anyango O. is a 25-year-old mother of two children, aged 7 and 3, both in school. She is a dressmaker and is wearing her own product in this photo. Typically, she purchases the material she uses for her dresses in Busia, about an hour from Kisumu. She is married to a farmer who grows tomatoes, kale, tomatoes, and onions. She is asking for 30,000 KSH to stock her business as well as to buy farm vegetables and poultry to increase her food security.

loans.use: dress-making material

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla O. is fifty-nine years old, married and blessed with one child. She is a member in good standing of the cooperative and has availed herself of more than nine loan cycles. Recently, she applied for a $425 loan for her piggery. She is comfortable in handling her business and enjoying it at the same time. Through her project she is able to send her child to college and to sustain the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainabu S. lives in a village called Yogomaia, Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years of age. Her husband passed away three years back, leaving her with the whole responsibility of taking care of the family.   She has five children. Zainabu sells market food. With a loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more profit and consequently improve her living standard.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Artelieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Artelieta O., 52 years old, is married and blessed with seven children, three of them in school. She has a "Sari-Sari" (variety) store at their residence. She started it from the money borrowed from the Cooperative and sells items such as toiletries, food supplies, and other household materials. Mrs. O. is an active member of the micro-finance program of Paglaum under PDP-LP.

Over more than four years of membership, she has accessed 9 loans. Her present loan amounts to PHP 5,000 to be used to purchase additional inventory. She is also engaged in bread-making as an extension of her business and another income source.

Mrs. O. is very thankful to Paglaum because it helps a lot not only for their living but also for the education of her children. And aside from that she gained more knowledge from the program, especially the value of savings. She used to think that only rich people who have extra income could save at the banks.

Her hope is that her business will expand and become a mini-grocery someday and that all of her children can finish a course. She would also like to be able to build a concrete house for the family.

loans.use: Purchase addtional goods for her "sari-sari" (variety) store

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Flordelina T., 56 years old, is married and lives at San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a government employee. She has also other source of income derived from her “sari-sari “(general) store.

She started it up with a small amount of capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, having joined in September 2004. Fortunately, the business has been going well until now. Some of their daily needs such as food come from the income from the store. Today, she is applying for Php 10,000 to buy additional goods for re-sale. She’s looking forward to having a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Benter Adhiambo

texts.en: Benter Adhiambo O. is 34-year-old mother of four children, two girls and two boys, all in school. She is a shopkeeper who lives and works in Nyamasaria slum and sells “daily-need” items like sugar, soap, and flour.  Her husband is a mechanic. She is asking for 40,000 KSH to expand her stock so that she can be more appealing to a wide range of customers.

loans.use: expand her stock of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 50 years old and married. She has three children, two of them working. Her husband is engaged in farming and also a caretaker of her cousin’s house. Before, she was engaged in barbecue-selling but it consumed much effort so she decided to have another kind of business. She tried out buying and selling RTWs (Filipino wholesale clothing). She found that kind of business was very good because she earned more profit compared to her previous business.

She started her business from the capital she borrowed from Paglaum, amounting Php 3,000 as her 1st loan. She found that she needed a bit more capital for the RTWs so she needed to request a loan for additional capital amounting to Php 5,000 as her second loan. The money will be used to buy pants, T-shirts, sandals, and underwear.

Mrs. C. is very happy that she became a member of Paglaum because with Paglaum she started up a business that helps her family a lot. They have another source of income for their livelihood.

Mrs. C. wants her business to grow bigger and become stable in order to support the needs and dreams of the family and to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: Buy addtional stock of RTWs such as pants, T-shirts and underwear

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is Mohamed M., a local entrepreneur in Kabala town. Mohamed was born in Kabala, northern Sierra Leone. He is age twenty-seven, married with three children. He started his business in 2002 and with the help of SMT loans, he has been a very successful businessman ever since. From the proceeds of his business, he is able to take care of his children – feeding, clothing, and educating them. Mohamed is requesting a loan of 1,000,000.00 to help him further strengthen his business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en:
Vasile is 35 years old and he is the father of three children. His wife works as a teacher in kindergarten in the city. Both spouses love children very much. So, Vasile has decided to open a small shop where he will sell many things needed for children as small toys, nipples, clothing and more things babies require.

Vasile came to Microinvest to borrow the amount of money needed to start up a business, namely to rent the shop from the beginning, in order to pay monthly rent and then to increase the stock of goods. In this district the birth rate exceeds mortality, so business will be profitable.

Vasile is quite satisfied with what he does for himself in the first round and of course for young children.

loans.use: starting up a business

loans.name: Sophie Apiyo

texts.en: Sophie Apiyo O. is a 28-year-old mother of two children, aged 5 and 3. Both are in school. She lives in the Manyatta slum where she sells food purchased wholesale from Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 KSH and hopes to use it to open a depot for soda and chips. Because she has been selling food for so long, she wanted a change of pace. She wants KIVA lenders to know that she loves the work that K-MET does and hopes they continue to assist women who want to open businesses. She says one of the great benefits is that they send their children to school.

loans.use: Soda, Chips depot

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion is 29 years old and he is a specialist in computers. He has an internet cafe that works non-stop. Besides his job Ion has a family with a small child. He wants to have more time together with his family, to be more around his small child. He needs some money to hire a new person who will replace him at the work, even on a day and a night. Besides that new employee, he wants to purchase some parts for his computers to be more efficient, and of course the business will go better.

loans.use: hire a new employee

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles Y. is thirty-six years old. He is married with four children, three of whom are currently in the basic school. The last-born is still breast-feeding. Charles says as a family man, it is necessary for him to work very hard to make income to meet the family’s expenses. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Charles deals in polythene rubber manufacturing. He produces polythene rubbers and distributes to retailers and food vendors. Food vendors normally use the rubber to sell food to their customers.

He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure more raw materials to expand his business. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To expand rubber manufacturing business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
A PDP-LP Micro-finance member of PMPC, Elene S., of legal age , resides at Magsaysay Sibutad, ZN. She has two children and is married to Francisco S., a farmer. Mrs. S. owns and manages her business, full of hope that it will grow big in the future.

She has accessed a loan amounting to Php 5,000 for the purchase of additional stock such as canned goods, dried fish, noodles, and other related food items.

She aspires to be healthy always so she can pursue her dreams of becoming one of the big business owners in the future so as to be able to gain enough earnings for her family, especially for their retirement phase.

loans.use: Buy canned goods, dried fish, spices, noodles, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda T., 56 years old, is married and blessed with nine children, six of them married. A member in good standing of Paglaum MPC since 2004, her source of income comes from pottery-making. Her project started only thanks to her experience from her neighbors. 

Short of capital to start her pottery business, she accessed a loan in the amount of  PHP 3,000 from Paglaum. The business is doing well and now she needs a bigger amount to buy some stocks of clay, and for cost of labor and transportation expenses. Her hopes and aspirations are to generate employment in the future and send all her children to college.

loans.use: To buy clay and pay labor  and transport expenses

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O. is thirty-five years old. She is married with three children. All of her children are in school – junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Dora’s husband is a commercial driver while she is a petty trader. Dora sells onions. She procures her goods (bags of onions) all the way from Yeji in the north and sells them in the local market square in Mampong. She also treks to sell her goods in other markets. Dora has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure onions in bulk so as to be able to reach out to more customers. She hopes to send her children to school up to high levels.

loans.use: To procure onions in bulk

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba R. is a small businesswoman in Tanzania. She runs a café at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. She also sells soft drinks in her café. She sells different types of cooked and fried food. She purchases the business requirements from wholesale shops and also from the city market. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to top up her business inventory.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Dioso

texts.en: Mr. Dioso B. is a 48-year-old fisherman from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mr. B. wants to have a new set of fishing nets so as to have additional earnings to support his family. He applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 for this project. His wife supports him by selling his catch in the neighboring barangay (township). He plans to do his project continuously and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Josephy

texts.en: Josephy I. is a small businessman in Tanzania. He runs a business selling stationery goods at Tabata in Dar es Salaam.  He also does printing and binding in his shop. He purchases the business items from Kariakoo business city center wholesale shops. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business items so as to extend the business.

loans.use: To buy more business items

loans.name: Carren

texts.en: Ms. Carren M. is 32 years old and a single mother to her daughter. They are presently residing  at  Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC and has an existing small barbecue and food-vending business at their place. She decided to request a 1st loan of PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her businesses. She religiously pays her obligations to the cooperative so she can access another loan when she has paid off her present loan, because she plans to have  a little restaurant  and be more successful in her business. She wants to have a better living and a great  future  for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy kilos of pork and chicken for barbecue and spices

loans.name: Amusatu

texts.en:
Amusatu A. is 37 years old. She is married with five children.  Four of her children are in either junior high or the basic schools. One of them is a seamstress by profession. Amusatu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a plumber by profession.
Amusatu sells iced sachet water. She procures bags of sachet water from the manufacturers who come around in trucks to distribute to her community. Amusatu then puts the water in the fridge to be iced. She hawks the water at the market centre. She says sales are best in the afternoons when the weather is warm and many are dehydrated. She has been in this business for barely one year and wants a loan to procure more bags of sachet water to maximize her profit margin. Amusatu hopes to sponsor her children in higher levels of schooling.

loans.use: To procure sachet water

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda R. is 45 years old and married to Rico, a farmer and at the same time, a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver. They have three children; all are studying. Imelda sells her ready-to-wear clothes  or "RTWs" (local wholesale clothing brand) to her  neighbors and in the neighboring barangays (townships) in their area. Imelda is a good member of the cooperative, in fact she has accessed more than 10 loans for her business and she manages it well. She wants to expand her business and to have a better life and a great future for her children.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of assorted RTW clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil R. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur business man.  He runs a business to provide transport services at Chanika, in Dar es Salaam.  He owns a taxi and receives 30,000 Tshs per day, equivalent to four hundred thousand Tshs per month.  He has been in the business for three years and plans to extent his services by buying more taxis.   He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to extent his business.

loans.use: Expand taxi business.

loans.name: Emiry

texts.en: Mrs. Emiry D. is 42 years of age and married to Jimmy, who is a fisherman. The couple is blessed with two children, still studying. Their source of income is  her husband's fishing business and Emiry's fish-vending. She sell the fish of her husband to their neighbors and during market day of the neighboring town. Her business is growing. That's why she applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 to sustain the capital of her business and for the maintenance of her husband's fishing as well. Her hope and aspiration is to have their own fish car, great future for their family, and a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy  fishing equipment

loans.name: Fredis  Omar

texts.es:
Fredis A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Estelí y cuya labor es la crianza de ganado al cual se dedica con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en su municipio.

La actividad de la crianza de Ganado del señor Fredis abarca el cuido y mantenimiento de la vaquillas por lo que procura con mucho esfuerzo extraer la leche para posteriormente venderla en su local. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para invertir en la retención de vaquillas y así continuar mejorando su situación y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis A. is a gentleman from Estelí city. He works very hard and with dedication raising cattle in his municipality. For Fredis raising cattle encompasses the care and maintenance of the heifers. It takes him great effort to milk the cows, and later sell the milk in his locale. He is hoping to receive a loan from Ceprodel to be able to keep the heifers and continue improving his situation and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep heifers

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia H. is 37 years old.  She is married with three children, two of whom are currently in school; junior high and the basic school.  One of them is learning a trade.  Afia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Her husband is a farmer.  She trades to make some income to support her husband financially.  Afia trades in hard wares.  She sells building and construction wares such as shovels, machetes, paint, cements, etc., in a store in her community.  She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.  Afia hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure hard wares.

loans.name: Daima

texts.en: Daima A. is a small business woman.  She runs a food shop at Makangarawe ward, in Dar es Salaam, Tanzanian.  She sells different types of cereal and leguminous crops to retail customers.  Business items purchased direct from producers include; beans, cashew nuts, ground nuts and rice.  Others are purchased from wholesales and retail shops.  She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to purchase more business goods.

loans.use: Purchase more business items to sell.

loans.name: Carla Mercedes

texts.es: La Señora Carla Mercedes M. M. tiene 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Carla tiene 2 hijos y estudian para ser unos profesionales. La actividad económica de Doña Carla es una pulpería, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una pulpería en donde ofrece gran variedad de productos de consumo diario, produciéndose para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Carla son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que Carla solicito ayuda es Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar mas productos para su negocio como golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y sardianas aprovechando la temporada de verano. Los sueños de Doña Carla son de ampliar su establecimiento para suministrar su pulpería de una variedad de productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$14.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Señora Carla Mercedes M. M. is 34 and married. Doña Carla has two children who are studying to be professionals. She has owned a small grocery store for more than eleven years. She offers a large variety of products for daily consumption so she can provide an income for her family. Her goals are to get ahead with her business since everything she currently has has cost her a lot of effort, and she won't lose it. This is why Carla is requesting the help of Fundación León with the aim of buying more products for her business like candy, soft drinks, and juice to make the most of the summer season. Her dreams are to expand her location to supply her store with a larger variety of products. The amount she is requesting is 14,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Con mucha satisfacción y alegría la señora Guadalupe F. se ha dedicado a laborar arduamente para llevar a cabo la reconstuccion de su casa y al haber realizado los pertinentes cambios en su vivienda, hoy en día requiere de la compra de pintura para pintar su vivienda.

Por esta razón ella se ha esforzado mucho y ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dicha pintura y así mejorar la condición de su familia y la de su pequeño hijo el cual tiene el deber de brindarle las mejores condiciones por ser madre soltera. Espera ser beneficiada inmediatamente y así cumplir su sueño de tener una vivienda digna donde habitar.
texts.en:
Señora Guadalupe F. has worked very hard, with a lot of satisfaction and happiness, to carry out the reconstruction of her house. After making the appropriate changes to her house, she now needs to buy paint to paint it. This is why she has worked hard and turned to Ceprodel to receive a credit to buy the paint and improve the living conditions of her family. She has a young son and wants to offer him the best conditions that a single mother can. She hopes to receive the credit immediately so she can fulfill her dream of having a worthy house to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint to paint her house

loans.name: Noel De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Noel B. se dedica a su actividad agrícola en la ciudad de Estelí. Inicialmente Ceprodel le otorgo un crédito para la compra de un panel solar y posteriormente se le brindó crédito para compra de insumos para el cultivo de las papas  , los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también a poder comprar los insumos a mas bajos precios y también a comprar lo necesario para la producción  de papas.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual acude una vez mas a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un nuevo crédito para la compra de insumos químicos para la cosecha de papas y así poder tener una producción exitosa en su comunidad y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Noel B. is a farmer in the city of Estelí. Ceprodel initially offered him a credit to buy a solar panel and then offered him a credit to buy supplies to grow potatoes. The credits have helped him improve his family's living conditions, to purchase supplies at lower prices, and to buy what he needs to grow potatoes. Today he is turning to Ceprodel one more time for a loan to buy chemicals for his potato harvest so he can have a successful production and benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for his potato harvest

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Sra Rosalina B. tiene 46 años de edad. Está casada con el señor Bernardo Ojeda de 57 años de edad y las dos personas se dedican a trabajar en una despensa que funciona en su domicilio. El señor tambien suele hacer trabajos temporales para una maderera conocida de la cuidad, con lo cual ayuda a solventar los gastos de la casa.

Tienen dos hijos menores que todavia estan estudiando y otra mayor que ya esta casada y vive al lado de ellos en un predio dentro de un asentamiento. La señora Rosalina siempre se dedico a la despensa. Anteriormente, su negocio lo tenia en otra parte hasta que lograron comprar un terreno donde construyeron para su casa. 

El prestamo quiere para poder surtir de mercaderias su despensa como ser la compra de azucar,harina,pan, fideos y articulos de primera necesidad,la cual tiene mucha demanda porque es uno de los pocos que funciona en la zona.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalina B. is 46 and is married to señor Bernardo Ojeda, who is 57. Both of them work at a grocery store that they have in their house. Bernardo also does temporary jobs at a lumber yard in their city, which helps them pay for their home's expenses. They have two young children who are in school and an older one who is married and lives in a settlement on a piece of land next to them. Señora Rosalina has always worked in her grocery store. She used to have her business in another area until they were able to buy some land where they built their house. She would like this loan to be able to stock her store with merchandise such as sugar, flour, bread, noodles, and basic goods. She has a lot of demand for these items because hers is one of the only grocery stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, flour, and oil

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu S. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur business woman.  She runs a clothing shop at Miembeni Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different types of clothes for men, women and children . Tatu purchases the clothes from wholesales shops.  Sometimes she imports from Zanzibar Island and sells to retail customers at her shop.  She meets her family's daily demand from her business income.  Tatu needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase more business items to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia S. is a Tanzanian business woman.  She runs a business selling fruit in her shop at Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam.  She purchases fruit from wholesalers; bananas, oranges, paw paws, lemons, and mangoes.  She has been in the business for six years.  She meets her family's daily demand from business income, including paying school fees for her children.  She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to keep up her business.

loans.use: Puy more business items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí distante a 200 mts. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres activas con ganas de salir adelante, quienes se pusieron en contactos con nosotros (Fundacion Paraguaya) para conocer el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Luego de la reunión informativa decidieron aceptarlas, por los beneficios que les presenta. Además de darle la materia prima el “El Capital” tanto para aumentar y a otras para poder emprender alguna actividad comercial. Actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo del programa y están integradas por 15 activas y trabajadoras mujeres, quienes han mejorado considerablemente sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias, brindándoles lo mejor posible.

Eunilda A.	      Venta de Leche, dulce y azúcar.
Ramona O.	      Despensa
Arminda M.	      Panadería
Lilian González	      Despensa
Leónidas M.      Empleada
Brigida P.       Chipera
Nilsa G.	      Empeada
Evangelista A.   Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Tomasa O.	      Empleada
Natalia A.	      Venta de Comestibles 
Cintia B.	      Docente
Ramona Servían	      Panadera
Reina V.      Venta de Pescado
Dora R.            Flores Artificiales
Zulma Servían	      Panaderia
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, which is 200 meters from the office in Paraguarí, some very active women meet with the desire to get ahead. The contacted us (Fundación Paraguaya) to become familiar with the Enterprising Women program. After the informative meeting, they decided to become members because of the benefits they would receive. They were also given capital to expand or to start a commerical activity. Currently they are on their seventh loan with the program. The group is made up of 15 active and hard-working women, who have considerably improved their incomes and the quality of live of their respective families, offering them the best that they possibly can. Eunilda A. Milk, sweets, and sugar sales Ramona O. Grocery store Arminda M. Bakery Lilian González Grocery store Leónidas M. Employee Brigida P. Snack sales Nilsa G. Employee Evangelista A. Fruit and vegetable sales Tomasa O. Employee Natalia A. Food sales Cintia B. Teacher Ramona Servían Baker Reina V. Fish sales Dora R. Artificial flower sales Zulma Servían Bakery

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They have invested in their respective businesses to buy dairy scales, sugar, flour, yeast, anise, meat, eggs, noodles, dairy products, drinks, fruit, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas A. is thirty-five years old. He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in junior high and basic school. Thomas says that, as a family man, it is necessary for him to work very hard to make enough income to meet the family’s expenditures. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

He owns a corn milling machine in his locality. Thomas says that he also runs a cassava mill in addition to the corn milling machine. He sells his services to all, but especially to food vendors who need to have some of their products, such as maize, cassava, roasted groundnut, and vegetables, ground before they prepare their meals.

Thomas says he doesn't have a vegetable milling machine at the moment, so wants a loan to acquire one. Thomas has been running this business for three years.

loans.use: To expand corn milling business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida F. de Zaracho tiene casa propia, esta casada, y tiene 45 años de edad.  Brigida tiene 4 hijos.

Ella es propietaria de una  despensa carniceria, con 10 años de funcionamiento.

Su marido es agricultor y tambien tiene animales vacunos, para cria y venta de leche. Tienen buenas referencias comerciales y personales, son personas muy trabajadoras.

Quiere ampliar su local comercial para trabajar y atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brigida F. de Zaracho has her own house, is married, and is 45 years old. Brigida has four children. She is the proprietor of a grocery and butcher’s shop which has operated for ten years. Her husband is a farmer and also has cattle, both to breed and to sell milk. They have good commercial and personal references and are very hard workers.

She wants to increase her commercial premises for work and to better attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana Ramona R. es de Cruce Liberación, Choré. Ella tiene casa propia y tiene 57 años de edad. Esta casada con el señor Eladio Maldonado, quien es de 64 años, y ellos tienen 2 hijos .

La cliente es propietaria de una despensa con 13 años de funcionamiento, tiene buena ubicación, clientela formada, su marido es agricultor y tiene varios cultivos de productos de consumo. 
     
El cliente quiere comprar màs mercaderias ya que su local es amplio y tiene muchos pedidos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Victoriana Ramona R. is from Cruce Liberación, near Choré, Paraguay. She is 57 years of age and has her own house. She is married to Señor Eladio Maldonado who is 64 and they have two children. Victoriana is the proprietress of a grocery store that has been doing business for 13 years. It has a good location and an established clientele. Her husband is a farmer and he has several fields of food crops. Victoriana wants to buy more merchandise since her business is increasing and she has lots of requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. All of her children are in school – junior high and basic school. Gifty lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

She works very hard to support her husband financially and help him to provide for the family. Gifty runs a grocery store in her community. She sells products such as tins of milk, sugar, bread, milo (instant chocolated drink), etc. She says her shop is located by the side of the road. Gifty has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy more goods. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia T. is forty-one years old. She is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons. All of her children are still in school. Some are in the senior high school and the junior high school. Others are in the basic schools.

She trades to make some income to support her husband financially. Olivia sells building and construction wares such as shovels, machetes, paints, and cements, in a store in her community. Her shop is located at the market square. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock her shop. Olivia hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy hardware to sell.

loans.name: Henry José

texts.es:
El señor Henry R. se dedica a laborar arduamente en la venta de ropa ambulantemente en el municipio de Somotillo para llevar a cabo su obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda para así brindarle buenas condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos a los cuales también debe brindarles el estudio que ellos necesitan. 

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito ya que requiere de la compra de materiales de construcción. Una vez obtenido el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción y continuará reconstruyendo su vivienda para así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry R. is dedicated to working arduously in the mobile sale of clothes in the municipality of Somotillo in order to carry out his labor of reconstructing his home and thereby providing good living conditions for his family which is composed of two small children to whom he should also provide the education that they need.

Today he has gone to Ceprodel to ask for a loan as he needs to buy construction materials. Once he has obtained the loan he will buy the construction materials and continue reconstructing his home in order to provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es:
La señora Julia A. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de venta de cosméticos en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha sufrido debido a los fenómenos naturales que la han azotad.  

Por esta razón ella nunca ha dudado en acudir a Ceprodel siendo este su apoyo para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para obtener a lo inmediato los materiales de construcción e invertirlos en su vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julia A. is dedicated with much strength to her activity selling cosmetics in her own home in the Somotillo municipality with the purpose of improving the living conditions from which she has suffered because of the natural phenomenoms which have scourged her. For this reason she has never doubted approaching Ceprodel being there for her support to buy construction materials. It's for this reason that she hopes to benefit froma loan to immediately obtain the construction materials and invest them in her home to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucha dedicación a su labor, en el municipio de Somotillo la señora María P. ha iniciado el mejoramiento de su vivienda siendo esta labor el sueño que por mucho tiempo ha tenido y son sus objetivos brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus tres pequeños hijos que tanto ama.

Por lo antes dicho, la señora María P. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones de vida propia y la de su amada familia en el municipio de Somotillo.
texts.en:
With diligence and hard work, Señora María P. has begun to make improvements to her house in the town of Somotillo. She has dreamed of doing this for a long time and her objective is to provide better living conditions for her three small children who she loves so much. To do that, she has sought the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purchase of construction materials. In this way, little by little, she is going to improve her own life and that of her beloved family in the town of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two children. One of her children is in junior high school. The other has completed junior high school and is currently working for a while before he continues. Her husband is a farmer. Adwoa is a food vendor. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adwoa prepares and sells sugar kenkey (dumpling). It is produced from corn dough. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages to prepare the kenkey. She adds the sugar to the dough and cooks it. She sells the kenkey in the local market square and also distributes it to retailers.

Adwoa has been in the kenkey business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a 45-year-old trader. She is divorced and the mother of two children. Her older child is a seamstress and her younger child is a journalist in a radio station at Kumasi. As a single parent, the responsibility of the family rest on her shoulders. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard work brings livelihood to the family.

Faustina supports her two grandchildren through the sale of used clothing, curtains, clothing materials and bedsheets. There is a large market for used clothing, curtains, and bedsheets in Ghana, because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for eighteen years.

Sales of used clothing have created a market for many women. Faustina travels to the nearby city of Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and clothing materials to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bedsheets and used towel sales.

She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to trade. Faustina belongs to a village bank called "Tabitha Kum." These words can be found in Luke 8:54 in the Bible.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and clothing materials.

loans.name: Nohemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Nohemy M. se desempeña como maestra en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Somotillo donde reside. Ella está comprometida con el bienestar de su familia y para ello ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación mejorando las condiciones de esta.

Para llevar a cabo esta obra es importante destacar que no es poca inversión sino que debe invertir mucho dinero en la compra de los materiales de construcción y en la mano de obra. Por este motivo es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera salir adelante siempre mejorando su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Young Nohemy M. works as a teacher in a small school in the municipality of Somotillo where she also lives. She’s very committed to the wellbeing of her family and she has started to rebuild her one bedroom house making small improvements. In order to carry out this works it is important to note that this is not a small investment, but it takes a lot of money purchase construction materials and work labor. For that reason, she went to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase construction materials and be able to improve her monetary situation and her families’.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maame Afua

texts.en:
Maame Afua A. started her fish business twenty years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, so many customers buy from her stand. She buys fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a strong customer base and her customers travel from the other parts of the region to buy her fish.

She is now 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Currently, two of her children are in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger assortment of fresh fish to increase her sales and income, to support her children's education, and to improve her business's growth. She belongs to the Amazing Grace village bank. She hopes to receive GH¢700 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Petrona Del Rosario

texts.es:
Actualmente en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Petrona P. ha iniciado a mejorar su vivienda por medio de la reconstrucción de esta ya que su construcción tiene muchos años y hoy en día ha requerido mejorarla.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito porque requiere un crédito lo más pronto posible para comprar los materiales de construcción para continuar con su obra y por razones de que el invierno pronto entrará y no quiere atravesar el riesgo de que el agua atraviese sus cuartos y sala. Por esto espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Today, in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega, Petrona P. has stated to make home improvements for her home that is already in construction. The house is very old and it’s time to rebuild. She went to Ceprodel to obtain a loan because she needs the money as soon as possible to purchase construction materials to continue with the works and because it will be winter soon and she doesn’t want to take a risk that water would filter into the house. For this reason, she is confident she will successfully get this loan, so she can move on.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. is 52 years old. She is a widow and has four children who are still in school. She lives in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Her husband died five years ago after a prolonged illness. She is now trying her best to support her family. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school.

Cecilia owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood in which she sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, and pastries that she prepares by herself. She says that prices of commodities have gone up drastically, so she is requesting a loan. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory.

Cecilia lives in the coastal area where most of the people are fishermen. The fishermen buy lots of kerosene to generate light for night fishing. For this reason, she has added the sale of kerosene to her existing business.

She belongs to the village bank called Amazing Grace. She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢900 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has two children, one at the university and the other in senior high school. She has been married for almost thirty years. Her husband is a teacher who teaches in the government school in their community.

Mary enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress.

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes that, with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream.

She belongs to the Maranatha village bank. She hopes to receive GH¢800 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Rubenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rubenia M. es una dama que desde hace 15 años inició su propio negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo donde actualmente vive y atiende en su pulpería que tanto ha invertido en ella.

Sus inicios fueron un poco difíciles como todo negocio pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha venido mejorando su situación y hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta forma continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubenia M. is a lady that 15 years ago started her own grocery shop business in the city of Chinandega, specifically in the municipality of Somotillo where she currently lives and works in the grocery shop where she has invested so much. Her beginnings were tough as in any business but as times went by were was able to improve her situation and today she came to Ceprodel to request for a loan to purchase items for her store and, that way, continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She has been married for ten years and her husband is a trotro (Urvan) driver.

She sells cereals, such as maize, and groundnuts (peanuts). She treks to the farming communities like Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, which you must visit one day soon. She has been selling food for ten years. She treks frequently to buy goods because she does not have enough money to buy larger quantities. To offset the risk involved, she is requesting a loan to buy cereal and store it. She believes this would save her from frequent traveling.

She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called Amazing Grace. She hopes to receive GH¢900 to improve her business.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy cereals, like maize, and groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza Groups 1 And 2

texts.en:
Mayra lives in Santiago, the Dominican Republic's second largest city, with her husband and six children. She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy silver jewelry that she can sell from her house, while still being able to care for her children. Mayra hopes to use the profits from her jewelry business to pay for the education of her six children. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education so that they can become working professionals.

Mayra is the coordinator of the MuJ. con Esperanza (Women with Hope) bank group. She takes great pride in leading her successful bank group. This will be the second loan for the MuJ. con Esperanza bank group.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa P. started her fish sales business fourteen years ago in Elmina in the central region of Ghana. Theresa prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, so many customers buy from her stand. She uses clever words to convince her suppliers to sell her more fish when demand is high and supply is low.

She buys fish from the fishermen and smokes the fish at a nearby stand. She has a strong customer base and customers who travel from the other part of the region to buy her fish. They buy both the fresh fish and smoked fish.

She is now 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband is a driver. Currently, three of her children are in basic school. The last born is still breastfeeding.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger assortment of fish to increase her sales and income and to support her children's educational needs. She belongs to the village bank called Amazing Grace. She hopes to receive GH¢700 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice C. is 55 years old. She is divorced and the mother of one child. She was divorced a long time ago. She has been providing for herself and her child, too. Life has not been that easy for her. At one point, she was very sick and getting money for the hospital was a horror for her until the government introduced a health insurance plan.

She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. For the past fifteen years, she has run a clothing stand where she sells clothing materials, lace and slippers. When the pace of business slowed, she opened a grocery shop in front of her house where she sells items like milk, sugar, canned tomatoes, flour etc.

Unfortunately, she has insufficient working capital to run her business. With this loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to improve her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality items in large quantities to upgrade her inventory.

She says she would be grateful for the assistance. She belongs to the Maranatha village bank. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials, lace materials, slippers sugar, flour and tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria Naa Mensah is widowed with four children. She is a 48-year-old trader. She sells mother care products, such as diapers and Pampers, by hawking (selling door-to-door). When the market for these products falls, she quickly switches to selling food, such as yam and eggs.

She says that her business has been a great help to her in taking care of her children's educational needs as single parent. She buys Pampers and diapers in boxes in Accra. Then she opens the boxes and sells the diapers one at a time.

Gloria has been in this business ten years. She lives with her family in Elmina, a fishing community where most of the people fish in the sea. She identified mother care products to be the very things that most mothers require, because a whole pack of diapers is expensive to buy. She started her business on a small scale, thinking that her market size would be static. She took the advice of an officer about how to treat and retain customers, and she has lived by that advice, which is working for her business. Now, she can boast of an increase in her market size.

However, her problem is that she does not have sufficient working capital to run her business now that her customers base is increasing. With this loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to the village bank called "Try God."

loans.use: Gloria wants a loan to buy more diapers, napkins, eggs, and yams.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She lives in Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells wheat and rice porridge in the streets of the community in which she lives.
