Rice and wheat porridge are enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She boils the porridge in a big pot and sells it by hawking (selling door-to-door). She has been in this business for four years with no regrets. She said it is far better than being idle and begging for bread.

Through her hard work, demand for her food has increased, making it difficult to meet the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients, such as wheat, rice, sugar, and milk, so that she can prepare more porridge to meet the daily demands of her customers.

Her picture was taken while she was selling. She would appreciate your support. She belongs to the village bank called "Yesu Abusua Kuo," which means "God’s Family."

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, wheat, sugar and charcoal etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty H. is a 42-year-old woman. She is widowed and the mother of four children. All of her children are currently in school. She lives with the children in Eguase in the central region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor who sells fante kenkey by the roadside in her neighborhood. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. It can also be mashed for iced kenkey or kenkey porridge. She has added the sale of sweet potatoes to her inventory.

She has been in this business for ten years. She has many customers because many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes and firewood. She would appreciate your support. She belongs to the village bank called Awake.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina M. started her fish business fourteen years ago in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Faustina prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, so many customers buy from her stand. She has has eighteen years of experience in serving customers.

She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and fries them at a nearby stand. She has a strong customer base and her customers travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She also sells bags of maize in bulk to her customers who prepare kenkey (corn dumplings).

She is now forty years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Her husband is a mason. Currently, three of her children are working while the rest are still in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy larger stocks of assorted fish, vegetable oil and bags of maize to increase sales and income and to support her children's educational needs and business growth. She belongs to the village bank called Awake. She also hope to receive GH¢1000 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more fried fish and bags of maize.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently, all of her children are in school. Her husband is a professional carpenter. They live together at Eguase in the central region of Ghana.

Elizabeth has been operating a drinking bar or spot in her neighborhood for four years. She sells items like Coke products, Pepsi products, and assorted paper and canned drinks. Lots of people buy from her bar because of its competitive prices. There is a guy who sells kebabs besides her bar and that has attracted many customers to buy from her.

She is facing financial problem in restocking her inventory, so she is requesting a loan to realize her dreams. She belongs to the village bank called Awake.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Pepsi, Coca-Cola products etc.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group 6

texts.en:
Paul G. is the leader of the group called Paz y Amor, or in English, “Peace and Love.” Paul is the owner of a used clothing business that he operates in his community. He and his wife of six years, Girena, have three children, ages 4, 3, and 16 months.

Paul’s dream for his business is to keep growing and have a larger capacity to sell clothing. Eventually he would like to buy a storefront for his business. He would like to be able to own his own house and be able to provide a good life for his children. In his free time, Paul enjoys attending his church with his family. This is his second loan and because of his faithfulness in repaying his last one, it is for a larger amount of money.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs and effort to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Dulce R. V. is the coordinator of the group called “Jesus Nuestra Esperanza,” which means “Jesus Our Hope” in English. She is the mother of four children and is married to her husband, Julian, who is 37 years old. This will be Dulce’s third loan with Esperanza and she will use the money to buy more supplies to sell in her bookstore.

Dulce has a passion for books and reading. She loves to read and reads about a variety of subjects, but her favorite thing to read is her Bible. In the future, she would like to open a school next to her church. Dulce and her family live in Maimon, a town that is just outside of Puerto Plata, which is also where her business is.

This is Dulce's third loan and she has been rewarded with a larger amount this loan cycle because she repaid her previous loans so faithfully.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy more books to sell in her bookstore

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La Señora Fulvia G. es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai. Ella tiene su casa propia. Fulvia tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera con 4 hijos, queines son todos mayores de edad y que trabajan en forma independientes.

Se dedica en las compras y ventas de productos de carne en el mercado municipal de Santani. Tiene buenos ingresos, mediante una buena clientela y buenos servicios.

Posee exelentes referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora y conocida en el barrio.  El cliente sueña en construir un salon de material en su domicilio para poner su negocio y asi poder trabajar desde su propia casa.
texts.en:
Fulvia G. lives in the City of San Estanislao, Ycua Pai Neighborhood. She is a home owner. Fulvia is 48 years old. She is single and she has 4 children, all of them of age and independent. She buys and sells meat products in the municipal market in Santani. Her income is fairly good, as she has a nice clientele and she provides good service. She has excellent business and personal references. She is very hard working and well known in her neighborhood. Her dream is to build a new brick room in her house to open a shop and, then, be able to work from home

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia Z. de Quintana es de la ciudad de Santanì. Ella tiene casa propia y tiene 42 años de edad. Antonia esta casada y tiene 2 hijos.

La cliente es comerciante y vende mercaderias de primera necesidad. Hace 10 años que trabaja en esta actividad y ya tiene formado una buena clientela gracias a los buenos precios de sus mercaderias. 

El cliente quiere comprar màs mercaderias ya que tiene muchos pedidos por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia Z. de Quintana lives in the City of Santanì. She is a home owner. She is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is a business woman. She sells basic products. She’s been working on this area for 10 years and she has a vast clientele thanks to the fair prices of the products she sells. She would like to buy more products as she has a lot of requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El Señor Marcial G. tiene 47 años de edad, está casado con  Antoliana Trinidad, y ellos tienen 2 hijos menores, de edad escolar.

    El cuenta  que 10 años atrás heredaron una despensa de sus padres quienes, por motivo de salud, tuvieron que mudarse a la capital con una hija para poder seguir su tratamiento. Desde entonces, él se quedo como encargado de la despensa junto con su esposa y comenzaron a trabajar. Con el ingreso que le dejaba el negocio, ellos salieron adelante. Hoy día  son los propietarios, y día a día van aumentando su stock, así brindan una buena atención a sus clientes.
 
    Antoliana  también nos comentó que gracias al trabajo  y sacrificio de los dos, pueden  solventar los gastos de la casa y darles una  buena educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro  puedan ser útiles en la sociedad y para ellos mismo.

El crédito solicitado es para las  compras  de mercaderías, tales como (almidón, maíz, harina, arroz, azúcar, etc.), de modo que pueda aumentar su stock de mercaderías y así aumentar su nivel de vida económica.
texts.en:
Marcial G. is 47 years old. He is married to Antoliana Trinidad. They have 2 minor children, who go to school. Ten years ago, they inherited a grocery shop from their parents, who due to health problems, had to move downtown with one of their daughters to continue their treatment. Since then, he has been in charged for the grocery shop together with his wife. With the business’ income, they were able to make ends meet. Today they are owners, and day by day they increase their stock, which help them provide a great service for their customers. Antoliana also told us that thanks to the work and sacrifice of both of the, they can cover their house expenses and provide their children with a good education for their future, so they can be useful to society and to themselves. The loan they have requested will be used to purchase products such as starch, corn, flour, rice, sugar, and others, so they can increase their stock and improve their economy.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as starch, corn, flour, rice, sugar, and others

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con  Elsa Franco. Ellos tienen 2 hijos, de 4 y 6 años de edad.

El nos contó que desde muy joven, había viajado a la Argentina, en busca de un puesto de trabajo. Por suerte  el  empezó a trabajar en una carpintería y ahí  aprendió este oficio. Luego de varios años de trabajo, el regreso a su país. Con el ingreso que obtuvo en la Argentina, pudo comprar las herramientas necesaria para poder montar su propia carpintería, y así trabajar en forma independiente. Con la ayuda de su señora, pudieron mejorar su nivel de vida y solventar los gastos de la casa y el estudio de su hijo.
   
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de madera y una máquina Cepilladora, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro M. is 42 years old and is married to Elsa Franco. They have two chidren, 4 and 6 years old.

He told us that ever since he was very young, he would travel to Argentina in search of a job. Fortunately, he began to work in a carpenter's shop and there he learned this trade. After several years working, he returned to his own country. With the earnings he got in Argentina, he was able to buy the tools necessary to be able to set up his own carpenter's shop, and in this way work independently. With the help of his wife, they were able to improve their standard of living and to pay for their household expenses and for their son's studies.

The loan sought is for the purchase of wood and a planing machine, so that he will be able to increase production and satisfy the needs of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and a planing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles Group

texts.en:
Josefina P. R. is the leader of a group called “Mujeres Habiles,” which means “Able Women” in English. This is Josefina’s second loan with Esperanza and she is hoping that this investment in her business will help it grow. She sells a variety of products in her store, such as bathroom products and intimate wear.

Josefina and her husband of seven years, Julio, have two children, ages five and six. Her goals are to improve and expand her business and be able to buy more products to sell. Eventually she would like to be able to buy a place to house her business, which is currently run out of her home. Another goal is to buy supplies in bigger quantities. When not working or spending time with her family, Josefina loves to read.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy more supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa en su rostro, todos los días la señora Marta B. atiende a sus clientes en su pulpería ubicada en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua donde habita.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos para continuar ofertándolos en su propia pulpería cuyo sueños es crecer en su municipio.
texts.en:
With a smile on her face every day, Mrs. Marta B. serves her customers at her store located in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua where she lives. She has been characterized as a very hardworking person and has now turned to Ceprodel because she requires a loan for the purchase of products she will continue to offer in her own shop. Her dream is to grow her business in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her shop

loans.name: Ricarda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ricarda T. con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado levantar su propia pulpería el cual se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde reside actualmente.

Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente porque le ha brindado créditos los cuales los ha invertido en la compra de mercadería y en la inversión del negocio. Una vez mas hoy en día ha acudido a solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así ofertarla en sus estantes a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ricarda T. has managed with great effor to open her own convenience store in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino, where she lives. She has benefited greatly from her relationship with Ceprodel: the loans which she has been granted have allowed her to invest in the purchase of merchandise as well as to invest in her business. Today, once again, she is requesting a loan to buy goods in order to sell them to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El negocio del señor Adrian Zambraba es el de fotógrafo. Su actividad se lleva a cabo por lo general ambulantemente en diversas actividades tomando fotografías y filmando algún evento especial siendo este trabajo el sustento de su hogar en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito porque requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo son los rollos para revelado, cassettes y películas de videos para continuar con su actividad de fotografía.
texts.en:
Adrian Zambraba is a photographer. He usually conducts business at various events taking pictures and filming special events. His work allows him to support his family in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. It is noteworthy that he has approached Ceprodel for a loan because he needs to buy materials for his business such as rolls of film for developing, cassettes and videotapes in order to continue with his photography business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his photography business

loans.name: Fe Y Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Group 1 from the Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress) Bank of Hope is taking their seventh loan through Esperanza International. These entrepreneurs do their activities in the San Pedro de Macoris area, in southeast Dominican Republic. Due to the sugar cane industry debacle a few years ago, this province suffers the devastation of unemployment. This is why many people have decided to become self-employed in order to guarantee income to provide for their families.

Celina F. is this group's coordinator, and she is currently maintaining a very successful clothing sales business. Her sales volume allows her to purchase in bundles, so she has more merchandise to sell for a more extended period of time. With this particular loan, she will buy more women's and children's clothing, which is more in demand. Celina finds "improving her life condition", her biggest challenge. She has six children who are all grown up (the youngest is 16 years old). She would like to see her business grow to one day be a clothing bundle distributor/supplier.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing bundles for resale

loans.name: Benita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Benita labora en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa ofertada todos los días en su propia casa de habitación. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha atravesado difíciles situaciones económicas pero tiene un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito ya que requiere la compra de la ropa para ofertarla en su negocio y así suplir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
In the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, Benita works away at her little business selling clothes every day from her own home where she lives. It is important to emphasize that she has gone through difficult financial situations, but she has a great talent for excelling in her business.

At this time, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan as she needs to buy clothes to offer for sale in her business, and in this way to supply for her own needs.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Keila Patricia es una esforzada dama cuya labor es la venta de especies como lo son salsas diversas, salsas de tomate, mayonesa, vinagre, entre otras. A este negocio se dedica desde hace 15 años en su propia habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Hoy en día el motive por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las especies y así ofertarla a sus clientes en su establecimiento en su municipio.
texts.en:
Keila Patricia is an enterprising woman whose work is the sale of goods such as various sauces, tomato sauces, mayonnaise and vinager, among others. She has worked in this business for 15 years out of her own home in the township of Ciudad Sandino.

At this time, the reason for which she has turned to Ceprodel is to apply for a loan for the purchase of goods and in this way offer them to her customers in her establishment in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
The members of this Bank of Hope are starting their fifth loan cycle with Esperanza International. The name of their Bank is "Confianza y Desarrollo" which means, in English, Trust and Development. Definitely one cannot go without the other. The two group coordinators are Hector O. and Jackelin M.. 

Hector makes candy. He makes several kinds of staple Dominican sweets, which have milk, coconut, and peanuts usually. They are sweetened with sugar and enhanced with spices like cinnamon and cloves for a more distinctive flavor. Hector's hopes are to make his business into a candy factory where he can hire staff to make the candy and move forward to a more administrative position. He hopes to become a lead candy distributor in the San Pedro province. 

Jackelin, on the other hand, has a colmado: a small convenience store where she sells the daily meal items. She will use this loan to buy canned goods like beans and sardines. The Dominican Republic suffers serious power outages and a lot of people do not own a refrigerator, so canned goods are a more convenient option, being less perishable. Her hopes are that the profits of her colmado will allow her one day to build a house with firmer materials.
 
These entrepreneurs have shown outstanding credit behavior and great will to work. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coconut, milk and spices to make candy

loans.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Miguela P., quien escucho sobre el programa en el barrio de su Madre y lo llevo al Asent. 15 de Mayo donde estan mujeres trabajadoras necesitadas de apoyo económico.  Las mujeres del comite son muy humildes y se esfuerzan dia a dia para el sustento de su familia. Realizan diferentes actividades como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de biyouteries, venta de chipa, venta de accesorios para celulares y minicargas, venta de CD, venta de verduras, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 408.000 cada una, quienes invierten en la compra de sus materia prima y mercaderias.

Blanca B.	Vta. Minicarga Cel.
Miguela P.	Vta. Pan Cacero
Martha S.	Vta. Cosméticos
Ediltrudis M.	Vta. de Ropas
Carmen T.	Vta. de Ropas
Flora F.	Vta. de Comidas
Porfiria T.	Vta. de Comidas
Norli Cáceres	Vta. de Merceria
Tomasa N.	Vta. de Ropas
Lidia S.	Vta. de Tortas
Guillermina B.	Vta. Menudencia
Reinalda B.	Vta. de Plasticos
Iluminada A.	Vta. Ropa Usada
Eleuteria Sarabia	Almacen
Dominga H.	Vta. de Chipa 
Liz C.	Vta. de Lenceria
Narcisa V.	Vta. de C.D.
Mirta O.	Vta. de Biyouteris
Pablina A.	Vta. de Comidas
Mercedes E.	Vta. de Lenceria
Nancy L.	Vta. de Verduras
Margarita R.	Vta. de Chatarra
Zunilda B.	Vta. de Tortas
Amada A.	Vta. de Biyouteri
Olga Dávalos	Vta. de Huevos
texts.en:
This committee was formed through Mrs. Miguela Portilla, who heard about the program in her mother's neighborhood and brought it to the 15 de Mayo township, where there are working women in need of financial support. The women of the committee are very humble and they exert themselves from day to day to maintain their families. They carry out different activities such as selling clothes, food, costume jewelry, chipas (a cheesey snack food made of manioc or corn flour), accessories for cell phones and rechargers, CDs, vegetables, etc. They will each receive an average of Gs. 408,000 from the loan, which they will invest in the purchase of their raw materials and merchandise. Blanca B. - Recharger/Cellphone Stall Miguela P. - Homemade Bread Stall Martha S. - Cosmetics Stall Ediltrudis M. - Clothing Stall Carmen T. - Clothing Stall Flora F. - Food Stall Porfiria T. - Food Stall Norli Cáceres - Hardware Stall Tomasa N. - Clothing Stall Lidia S. - Cakes Stall Guillermina B. - Knick Knacks Stall Reinalda B. - Plastic Goods Stall Iluminada A. - Used Clothing Stall Eleuteria Sarabia - Grocery Stall Dominga H. - Chipas Stall Liz C. - Linens Stall Narcisa V. - CD Stall Mirta O. - Costume Jewelry Stall Pablina A. - Food Stall Mercedes E. - Linens Stall Nancy L. - Vegetable Stall Margarita R. - Scrap Iron Stall Zunilda B. - Cakes Stall Amada A. - Costume Jewelry Stall Olga Dávalos - Eggs Stall

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, meat, corn flour, cheese, milk, eggs, cattle, T-shirts, jewelry, costume jewelry, linen, carbonated beverages, beauty products (creams, perfumes, lipsticks, face-powders), scrap iron and seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Francelina E. R. is the leader of the group called “Nuevo Renacer”, which means “New Birth” in English.  Francelina is the mother of five, ranging in age from three months old to fourteen.  She owns a salon and will buy a hair dryer and more products with her loan.  Her business started up as a bag full of supplies that she used to bring to houses of clients. It has grown into a community salon that has a physical location thanks to her Esperanza loan and good old-fashioned hard work.  She eventually hopes to be able to offer all of the offerings of a spa including massage.

She hopes her children can grow up to be professionals and be strong in their Christian faith.  Francelina does not have much free time between her five children and business, but when she does get to relax, she enjoys watching telenovelas (soap operas, which are very popular here in Latin America) on TV.

Because of Francelina’s hard work and diligence in repaying her previous two loans, this loan will be for a bigger amount.  She hopes this one will help her business as much as the previous loans have.  

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: A hair dryer and personal products for her salon

loans.name: Adela María

texts.es:
La señora Adela C. habita en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que ha sido levantada producto de sus esfuerzos ya que se ha dedicado grandemente para sacar adelante su negocio.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito porque requiere invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los productos de pulpería para ofertarlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Adela C. lives in the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She tends her own general store which has been built as a product of her endeavours, as she has greatly devoted herself to carry on her business. Despite the difficult financial situations she has come through, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan because she needs to invest in her business by means of the purchase of general store merchandise to offer it for sale in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Zeneyda M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños teniendo sus vitrinas donde los exhibe a diario.

Ella actualmente require invertir en su negocio y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le sirva para la compra de los perfumes  y así llenar sus estantes de los perfumes.
texts.en:
In the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, Mrs. Zeneyda M. works with great spirit and effort at her business of selling perfumes for women, men and children, having display cabinets where she displays them daily. At the moment, she needs to invest in her business, and for that she has sought support from Ceprodel to receive a loan, which would serve for the purchase of perfumes and in this way fill her shelves with perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of perfume

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Berta es casada, tiene 60 años y 2 hijos,  Berta tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, además los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Berta son mejorar su negocio y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Berta is a partner of the Communal Bank Santa Rita. She is 60, married with two children. She has a warehouse at home from which she sells groceries and vegetables. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells typical meals with help from her husband. Berta needs a USD $325 load for the purchase of rice and sugar. Berta's goals are to improve her business and provide more products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 5 Group

texts.en:
This group of five is the newest addition to the Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd) Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. This is their first loan for their micro enterprises and they all believe it'll be a great help to their business activities. 
Joselin M. is the group representative. She started her business selling clothes, but now is looking to expand by starting a nail salon with this micro loan. She will use the loan amount to buy the materials to do acrylics in her small booth, which will be located at her house. She will also buy the machine used to polish the nails and make them look smooth and natural. She will also use a small portion of the loan to buy pants, blouses and undergarments for her clothing clientele. She believes her hard work will help her achieve her goals and provide a better life quality for her children.
Please help us support the creativity and determination of these ladies. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a nail polishing machine and acrylic nails materials

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Martha es soltera y tiene 31 años, Martha se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra los ganados y luego los comercializa en la feria de la ciudad de ayacucho, además vende quesos de casa en casa.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, carnero.
Los sueños de Martha son tener una tienda en su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a partner of the Communal Bank Santa Rita. She is 31 and single. She buys and sells livestock. She travels to regional fairs to buy the livestock and then sells them in the city market of Ayacucho. She also sells cheeses from home. Martha needs a USD $275 loan in order to purchase cheeses and sheep. Martha's goals are to open a store at home and enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, sheep

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Maruja es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maruja viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, ajos, cuy, luego los comercializa en los mercados y recreos de la ciudad de ayacucho. Además Maruja se dedica a la crianza de cuy en su casa.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy, queso.
Los sueños de Maruja son tener una tienda en su casa y ampliar su galpón de cuy.
texts.en:
Maruja is a partner of the Communal Bank Santa Rita. Maruja is 42, married, and has four children. She travels to regional fairs where she buys cheses, garlic, and guinea pics to sell in the marketplace and recesses in the city of Ayacucho. Maruja also raises guinea pigs at home. Maruja needs a USD $325 loan for investment in guinea pigs and cheese. Maruja's goals are to open a storefront from her house and enlarge her guinea pig barn.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and cheese

loans.name: San Jose De Viñaca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José D. Viñaca inicia su cuarto ciclo con 22 socias, todas ellas son D. la comunidad D. San José D. Viñaca, que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. AyaC., la población se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en mayor proporción y la ganadería. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales, abarrotes en general, verduras y la agricultura, ganadería.

Como es el caso D. Natalia que es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Natalia junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra D. alfalfa, producto que luego comercializan en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. AyaC..

Por otro lado Rosa es casada, tiene 43 años y 7 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra D. verduras, alfalfa.

Mientras que Nery es casada, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Nery se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, verduras, además a la crianza D. cuy.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, ladrillo, semilla, alfalfa y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank San José D. Viñaca begins its fourth cycle with 22 partners, all hailing from the community of San José D. Viñaca, located 40 minutes from the city of AyaC.. Its inhabitants dedicate themselves to raising vegetables, primarily, and livestock. The partners are involved in different activities, such as raising and selling crops and livestock, selling groceries and vegetables. Such is the case of Natalia, who is 47, married and has six children. Natalia and her husband raise alfalfa and sell it in a supply market in the city of AyaC.. Rosa, on the other hand, is 43, married and has seven children. Rosa and her husband raise vegetables and alfalfa. Meanwhile, Nery is 23, married and has two children. Nery raises alfalfa, vegetables and guinea pigs. The partners need different loans for different amounts like $100 USD, $145 USD, $195 USD, $290 USD, for a total of $4300 USD needed in loans at the Communal Bank. Your loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, brick, seed, alfalfa and to pay laborers. The partners' goals are to improve their business and proviD. a good education to their children so they may have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, brick, seed, alfalfa, and laborers' salary

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Silvia G., a quien le gusto el programa, decidio invitar a sus vecinas y amigas del Asentamiento Bonanza para trabajar juntas y poder progresar. Ellas estan acostumbradas a organizarse por lo cual su grupo prospera. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas, Peluquera, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs. 433.000 cada una, quienes invierten en compra de azúcar, carne, harina,huevo , baquero, remeras,polleras,camisas,joyas, biyouteri, lenceria, bebidas gaseosas, verduras, escoba, champu, tinte.

1	Juliana G.	        Venta de comida
2	Marta P.	        Despensa
3	Laura M.	        Venta de Ropa
4	Ramona M.	        Venta de Ropa
5	Juana C.	        Despensa
6	Silvia G.	        Venta de Fruta
7	Vicenta B.	        Despensa
8	Julian M.	        Venta de comida
9	Ignacia R.	        Venta de escoba
10	Francisca B.	Venta de Ropa
11	Liz López	        Venta de gallina
12	Antolina G.	Venta de Escoba

22	Ada G.	        Peluquera
23	Bella R.	        Venta de Joya
24	Griselda Fleitas	Venta de ropa
texts.en:
This committee was formed through Mrs. Silvia G. who, on liking the programme, decided to invite her neighbours and friends from the Bonanza Settlement to work together and make progress. They are used to being organised so their group is successful. They work independently selling clothes, food, fruit, jewellery, as a hairdresser, etc. They receive a loan that is on average Gs. 433,000 each which they will invest in the purchase of sugar, meat, flour, eggs, jeans, t-shirts, skirts, blouses, jewellery, lingerie, fizzy drinks, vegetables, brooms, shampoo and hair dye.

1 Juliana G. – food seller

2 Marta P. – sells groceries

3 Laura M. – clothes seller

4 Ramona M. – clothes seller

5 Juana C. – sells groceries

6 Silvia G. – fruit seller

7 Vicenta B. – sells groceries

8 Julian M. – food seller

9 Ignacia R. – broom seller

10 Francisca B. – clothes seller

11 Liz López – sells chickens

12 Antolina G. – broom seller

13 Maria E. – clothes seller

14 Norma B. – clothes seller

15 Librada M. – clothes seller

22 Ada G. - hairdresser

23 Bella R. – jewellery seller

24 Griselda Fleitas – clothes seller


Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, jewellery, lingerie, fizzy drinks, vegetables, brooms, shampoo and hair dye

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
Bonifacia Y. is the leader for the group called Mujeres Emprendedoras, which means in English, “Enterprising Women.”  Bonifacia is the owner of a small convenience store and is going to buy clothing and shoes to sell in her store. Bonifacia and her partner named Modesto S. are the parents of three daughters in their twenties, and grandparents of five grandchildren ranging in ages from four months to seven years.  She hopes to see continued growth for her business and be able to proviD. more for her family.  

She hopes someday to be able to fix up her house and improve it by adding various things. In her free time, Bonifacia enjoys reading her bible and helping the sick in her community.  This is the first loan for Mujeres Emprendedoras and they are excited for this opportunity.

On behalf of Bonifacia Y., Mujeres Emprendedoras, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs and support!

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes venD. leña en su casa, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, la leña lo adquiere D. los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Mercedes junto a su esposo compran y venden alfalfa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Mercedes sueña con educar a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Gratitud Communal Bank.

Mercedes is married, 38 years old, and has 3 children. Mercedes sells firewood from her house; her sales are by wholesale or retail. She purchases the firewood from producers who bring it to her house. In addition, Mercedes together with her husband buy and sell alfalfa.

Mercedes needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) that will be invested in the purchase of firewood.

Mercedes dreams of raising her children well and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of firewood

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Olivia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Olivia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verdura, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Olivia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Olivia son surtir su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olivia is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank. She is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Olivia has a store in her home where she sells groceries--mainly vegetables and fruit. She works in the store every day with the help of her children. Olivia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Olivia's dreams are to supply her business and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Albina L., a quien le llamo la atención el programa y se decidio a propagar en el vecindario de Jose Maria Alfonzo Godoy. Las mujeres del comite son muy humildes y trabajadoras. Aprendieron a valorar el trabajo en grupo y realizan diferentes actividades comunitarias para solidarizarse. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como venta de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de helados, realiza primeros auxilios, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs.386.000 cada una, quienes invierten en la compra de sus productos.

1	Ramona Carrillo	        Venta de comida
2	Lidia G.	        Venta de comida
3	María Velásquez	        Venta de comida
4	Ana F.	        Venta de comida
5	Albina López	        Venta de comida
6       Pablina R.            Venta de cubierto
7	Ada López	        Modista
8	Silveria L.	Comedor
9	Florentina V.	        Venta de Frutas
10	Fátima D.	        Bordados Aho poì
11	Justina D.	        Copetin
12	Irene Ruíz	        Venta de comida
13	Liz V.	        Despensa
14	Fatima P.	        Venta de Ropa
15	Mirian C.	Venta de Ropa 
16	Stefania P.	Primeros Auxilios
17	Cinthia C.	        Heladeria
18	Clara A.        Heladeria
19	Ilda N.	        Venta de comida 

Tambien hay un integrante que esta en la foto, Carmen Roa, que no saco un credito en este ciclo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Albina L., who brought attention to the program and decided to expand in the Jose Maria Alfonzo Godoy neighborhood. The women in the committee are very modest and are hard workers. They learned to value working as a group and they perform different community activities to support each other. They are independent in their work activities such as clothing sales, food sales, ice cream sales, first aid, etc. Each person receives an average loan of 386,000 guarani to invest in the purchase of their products. 1 Ramona Carrillo, Food Sales 2 Lidia G., Food Sales 3 María Velásquez, Food Sales 4 Ana F., Food Sales 5 Albina López, Food Sales 6 Pablina R., Silverware Sales 7 Ada López, Dressmaker 8 Silveria L., Cafeteria 9 Florentina V., Fruit Sales 10 Fátima D., Aho poi (Embroidered fine linen clothing) 11 Justina D., Appetizers 12 Irene Ruíz, Food Sales 13 Liz V., Pantry 14 Fatima P., Clothing Sales 15 Mirian C., Clothing Sales 16 Stefania P., First Aid 17 Cinthia C., Ice Cream Parlor 18 Clara A., Ice Cream Parlor 19 Ilda N., Food Sales There is also a member in the photo, Carmen Roa, who is not taking out a loan this cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, meats, jeans, T-shirts, thread, aho poi, cloth, silverware, lingerie, carbonated beverages, cotton, gauze, alcohol, penicillin

loans.name: Marithza Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marithza se desempeña de Secretaria en una empresa privada lleva diez años dando sus sevicias laborales. Tiene 26 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, con un hijo de 5 meses el cual ha venido hacer una alegría en su vida, su esposo es operador de moto carga en unos almacenes. La joven Marithza inicio en la empresa de afanadora pero por su buen comportamiento y superacion logro sus objetivos. Con esta solicitud es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer  un muro en la parte de enfrente para estar un poco segura con su familia y poder gozar de los beneficios de su trabajo y beneficios que Afodenic ha dado a la oportunidad para salir adelante con sus metas
texts.en:
Señora Marithza carries out her duties as a secretary in a private company where she has been employed for ten years. She is 26 years old and lives in Barrio 380 in the city of Managua. She has a five month old son who has brought joy into her life. Her husband is a warehouse motor freight operator. When she was younger, Marithza started work as a cleaning lady but with her good demeanor and job performance she has accomplished her objectives. This loan request is for the purchase of construction materials to build a wall in front of their house. This would be for the security of her family so they can enjoy the benefits of her work and the benefits made possible by Afodenic for her to move forward with her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a wall.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Juana es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de libros referidos al tema de derecho, su local esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad, el cual es alquilado.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de libros diversos.
Juana sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank. She is 34, is married and has 2 children.

With her husband, she sells law books in a rented store in the city centre.

She needs a loan of 1000 sol to buy books. Juana's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy books

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Rita es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Rita junto a su esposo tienen un grifo llamado WB, cuenta con 2 personas, además en el mismo lugar brindan el servicio de engrase y lavado a los carros.
Rita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de petróleo.
Rita sueña con tener un carro mas grande para transportar el combustible y mejorar la infraestructura de su grifo.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank.She is 43; she is married and has 3 children.

Rita and her husband have a gas station called WB, with 2 employees. They also provide oil changes and have a car wash.

Rita needs a loan of 2000 sol to buy gasoline. She dreams of having a larger truck to transport fuel and improve the gas station's infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es: Don Jairo es agente de la Policía Nacional, desde hace seis años, brinda su servicio de seguridad a los Nicaragüense las desventaja es que el salario es bajo, tiene 30 años, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, su esposa le tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmético ambulante para apoyar a las necesidades de su familia. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte de atrás de su casa para tener  seguridad para su familia ya que lo tiene con zinc y desea que sea mas seguro. Sus planes es poder hacer las mejoras necesarias en su casa para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo has been a member of the Nicaragua National Police Force for six years. The disadvantage is that wages are low. Jairo is 30 and he lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district.

He and his wife have two children, both at school. His wife sells cosmetics door to door to support the family.

He will use the loan to build a wall behind his house to provide his family with more security, since the current wall is made of zinc is not so secure.

He plans to make necessary improvements in his home for his family's welfare.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall behind his house

loans.name: Marlene De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Marlene tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, tiene dos niños gemelos, su esposo es coordinador de red de Enitel, el negocio de doña Marlene es la venta de cosmético y prendas de plata, lleva dos años en las ventas el cual inicio para obtener sus propios ingresos y superarse. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para invertir en la compra de perfúmenes y más prenda de plata, que se venden mucho a los jóvenes, al contado y al crédito, sus planes es poder poner una tienda grande con productos variados, que le generen buenas ganancias. También poder apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38 and lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district. She has twins. Her husband is a network coordinator for Enitel. Marlene sells cosmetics and silver jewelry.

She set up the business two years ago in order to obtain her own income and to progress. She will use the loan to buy perfumes and silver jewelry to sell to young people, both for cash and on credit.

She plans to set up a big store with a range of products that will provide her with a good income. She also wants to support her children so that they can study.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, perfume and jewelry

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La señora Dominga vende ropa y perfumes, también tiene una maquina de coser donde realiza trabajo de costura, en estas ventas lleva cinco años, El cual inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia para cubrir las necesidades. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, tiene dos hijos ambos estudian, su esposo trabaja en la construcción. Con este quiere invertir en la compra de ropa, y cosmético para vender  a sus clientes. Con este inversión espera obtener buenas ganancias, captar clientes. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos, obtener mejores utilidades y poder hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Dominga has been selling clothes and perfumes for five years. She also has a sewing machine and works as a seamstress. She started her business in order to help support her family.

She is 34 and lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district. She has two children, both of whom are studying. Her husband works in construction.

She wants to invest the loan in clothes and perfumes to sell to her customers.

With the investment, she expects to get new customers and turn a profit.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El señor Mario se dedica la venta de videos de cd, películas. Venta de leña y carbón, lo comercializa desde hace nueve años, negocio que inicio con ahorros propios y luego con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo son cinco ciclos los que leva trabajando con la institución el cual ha sido de mucho beneficios para su familia. Tiene 35 años de edad, reside en Villa Reconciliación, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de leña, carbón, y muchas películas para poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad. Sus planes es poder tener un terreno en la Ciudad de Rivas por que viaja hasta allá por las ventas de películas días por medio. El quisiera poder comprar un terreno para tener un local fijo y poder tener mejores ganancia para un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario sells videos and movies on CD. He has also been selling firewood and coal for nine years, a business he started with his own savings and later with loans from Afodenic. He has obtained five loans from this institution, with very beneficial results for his family.

He is 35 and lives in Villa Reconciliación. He and his wife have 2 children, aged 4 and 6.

He will use the loan to buy firewood and coal, as well as many movies to offer his customers a variety.

He plans to buy a plot of land in Ciudad de Rivas because he travels there to sell movies for days at a time.

He would like to buy land so as to have a permanent store, the aim being to improve his earnings and give his children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy movie CDs, firewood and coal

loans.name: Filena De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Filena inicio su negocio desde hace seis años, en la venta de ropa, zapatos el cual inicio con dinero propio, algunas veces con ventas bajas debido al desempleo de muchos nicaragüense, pero ha sobresalido a flote con los prestamos que Afodenic ha prestado. Tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación,  tiene cuatro hijos que son independientes, su esposo tiene un taxi y es muy responsable. Este es su onceavo ciclo de préstamo el cual va invertir en comprar ropa variada para adulto y niños como zapatos, para incrementar el inventario y poder obtener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos económicamente.
texts.en:
Filena opened her business six years ago with her own money, selling clothing and shoes. Sometimes sales were slow because of the high unemployment rate in Nicaragua, but she has stay afloat thanks to the loans from Afodenic. She is 52 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Reconciliació. She has four children who no longer depend on her financially; her husband has a taxi and she is very responsible. This is her 11th loan cycle. She will use the loan to buy a variety of adult and children's clothing as well as shoes in order to increase her inventory and make a better income in order to be able to help her children financially.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Melania tiene 58 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida y refrescos que desde hace varios años inicio con ayuda que sus hijos dieron. Reside en Villa reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, sus hijos son mayores de edad, su negocio se ha incrementado con los fondos de crédito que Afodenic ha otorgado este es su séptimo crédito el cual va comprar materiales para reparar el sistema eléctrico de sus casa ya que le esta dando problema y quiere evitar que su casa se le queme. Su planes es poder seguir creciendo en venta, seguir mejorando el local de venta y poder dar siempre un mejor servivicio.
texts.en:
Melania is 58 years old. She has been selling food and refreshments for a number of years. She started her business with her children's help. She lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. Her children are now adults and her business has grown thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic. This is her seventh loan, which she will use to repair the electrical wiring of her home as it is giving her problems and she wants to avoid having her house burn down. Her goals are to continue growing her sales, improving her business locale and always give better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical components in order to change the electrical system of her home.

loans.name: Edgar Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Edgard S. es originario del municipio de Nagarote donde se dedica a trabajar arduamente en su negocio de compra y venta de chatarras comprando todo tipo de producto de material de lata y aluminio para posteriormente venderlo a lugares donde son procesados.

Actualmente él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de las chatarras y es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel porque es la única institución que puede ayudarle a salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgard S. comes from the municipality of Nagarote where he works arduously at his business buying and selling scrap. He buys products of tin and aluminum in order to resell them to be processed. He has now approached Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan to be used to buy scrap and because of this he is very confidently optimistic that Ceprodel will grant him the loan as it is the only institution which can help him build his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es: La joven Fátima es una mujer que desde muy joven se dedica  a las ventas de ropa, zapatos y cosmético, ella inicio  con ahorro de ella y de su mama, la cual la apoyado para que salga adelante en su vida y valla formándose para cuando tenga su familia. Tiene 24 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Smit, soltera. Con esta solicitud va invertir en ropa variada para niños y adultos para seguir ofertando sus variedades a sus clientes. Sus panes a futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del frente  de la casa para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa y el local es pequeño.
texts.en:
Young Fátima is a woman who has been selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics since she was very young. She began with her own and her mother's savings: her mother helped her so that she could continue to progress in her life and prepare herself for when she has her own family. She is 24 years old and lives in the Enrique Smit neighbourhood. She is single. She will use this loan to buy a variety of clothes for children as well as for adults in order to continue offering her customers a good selection. Her goals are to improve the infrastructure of the front of her home in order to give her customers better service as her business is in her home and the store is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Mario Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Mario Gilberto P. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Se ha destacado por ser excelente trabajador habiendo llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación.

A través de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel ha mejorado sus ingresos y aumentado  su hato ganadero ya que le ha permitido comprar alimentos para el ganado ya que ha aumentado su producción de leche  y con dichos créditos se ha beneficiado grandemente. EL motivo por el cual solicita un nuevo crédito es para la mejora del hato ganadero  y  dar lugar a la retención de los terneros ya que requiere de esto lo mas pronto posible para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mario Gilberto P. raises livestock in the municipality of Nagarote of the city of Leon. He has distinguished himself because he is an excellent worker and has supported his household. Thanks to the loans from Ceprodel he has improved his income and increased his herd as he has been able to buy food for his livestock and has increased their milk production and greatly benefitted from these loans. The reason he is asking for this loan is to improve his herd and keep the calves as he needs this as soon as possible in order to continue to progress in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in livestock

loans.name: Roberto Daniel

texts.es: El Señor Roberto Daniel C. A. tiene 39 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Roberto tiene 2 hijos y ellos dependen de el. La actividad económica de Don Roberto es ofrecer el servicio de video juegos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con muy pocos recursos ya que solo tenía  1 televisor y un video juego, pero debido a la demanda de sus pequeños clientes decidió realizar un financiamiento para la compra de más equipos y así fue como dio inicio a este negocio. Los propósitos de Roberto son de invertir cada día en nuevos videos juegos. Este es motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya si comprar controles, nuevos videos juegos y otro televisor. El deseo de Roberto es de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le gustaría que sus hijo pasen necesidades y así no tendrían problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Daniel C. A. is 39 years old and married. Don Roberto has two children that depend on him. The way that Don Roberto makes a living is through a video game service. He has been in this business for more than 7 years, he started it with few resources since he only had one television set and one video game console. Due to the demand from his small customers, he decided to finance the purchase of more equipment and thus his business started. Don Roberto's goal is to invest in new video games every day. This is the reason for his loan request, to increase his working capital, purchase controllers, new video games and another television set. Don Roberto's wish is to improve the quality of life for his family, not seeing his children in need and not having any finacial difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidio Manuel

texts.es: El señor Lidio Solis se dedica arduamente a laborar en su actividad ganadera en el municipio de Nagarote de donde es originario. Es un caballero muy trabajador y con muchos deseos de salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en día ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y por eso ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de terneros ya que le urge adquirirlos para así proceder a su crianza y luego sacarles el máximo provecho. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Lidio Solis ardously dedicates his time to raising livestock in the municipality of Nagarote where he resides. He is a very hard working gentleman and has a strong desire to get ahead in his business. He is currently looking for a way to improve his financial situation in order to be able to bring a better standard of living for his family. This is the reason for his turning to Ceprodel to get a loan so that he can purchase more calves. He needs to buy them so that he can proceed to raise them and then get the most profit from them. This loan will benefit both him and his family in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Reyna Azucena

texts.es: Reyna Azucena M. S. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Reyna tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Reyna es una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente Reyna trabajaba en Costa Rica para sustentar a sus hijos, pero decidió establecer una pulpería en su vivienda para cuidar a sus hijos. Los propósitos de Doña Reyna son de seguir invirtiendo en sus productos para proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que estos piden. Es por esto que Doña Reyna solicito financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así invertir en golosinas, gaseosas, pan y jugos. Sus deseos son de continuar con este negocio para salir adelante con sus planes.
texts.en:
Reyna Azucena M. S. is 37 years old and single. Reyna has 2 children both of whom are in school. She makes a living running a general store. She has been in this business for more than 9 years, prior to that Reyna worked in Costa Rica to support her children. She decided to open a general store in her home so that she could take care of her children. Reyna's goal is to continue to invest in her products and be able to have available what her customers request. This is the reason for Reyna's loan request that will be used to increase her working capital. This will allow her to buy candies, sodas, bread and juices. Her wishes are to continue with this business and get ahead with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlin Jony

texts.es:
La señora Marlin R. es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la venta de carne de cerdo dedicándose a esta actividad con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda de habitación la cual posee actualmente.

Un problema que ella atraviesa es que se le ha agotado los materiales de construcción y para ello requiere la compra de estos para proceder al mejoramiento de su vivienda en su localidad. Es debido a esto que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos materiales y continuar en su labor. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su familia por lo que lo requiere con urgencia.
texts.en:
Marlin R. is a vigorous woman who sells pork in order to improve the conditions of her home that she now possesses.

A problem that she comes across is that she has run out of construction materials and needs to purchase more to proceed in the improvement of her home in her community. Because of this, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of said materials and continue her work. It’s important to point out that this loan will benefit her as well as her family, whom urgently need it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maximino José

texts.es:
El señor Máximo M. se dedica a la actividad de crianza de terneros en su municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León donde se esfuerza arduamente con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así mantener a sus dos hijos.

La razón por la que el señor Maximo ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los terneros y de esta forma salir adelante dando lugar a la crianza de estos animales para sacarles el máximo provecho en su localidad donde él vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo M. works raising calves in his district of Nagarote in the city of León. He works very hard in order to bring food home and support his two children. Mr. Máximo is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to buy calves to raise to get ahead and get the most benefit from his business in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in livestock

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Smit, su esposa le tiene dos hijos, de 6 y 10 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de medicina natural, lleva doce años en las ventas, que inicio con fondos propios, todo estos medicamentos los compra en el mercado oriental, los cuales son: zepol, cofal fuerte, panadol, y otros. Con este crédito va a comprar medicina para vender en los departamentos y poder captar clientes. Sus planes es poder crecer en inventario y poder mantener los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Francisco is 33 years old, lives in the Enrique Smit neighborhood, he has two sons with his wife, 6 and 10 years old. His business is the sale of natural remedies. He has been in sales for twelve years. He started his business with his own money. He buys all his remedies at the oriental market, they consist of zepol, cofal fuerte, panadol and others. With the proceeds of this loan he will buy products which he can sell in the departments and attract customers. He plans to grow his inventory and support the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various remedies.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Harry Group

texts.es: El Grupo Harry conformado por las tres integrantes, sus nombres son Mayra Carina A. P., Areli Guadalupe País P. y Alicia Catalina P.. Las actividades de cada una son diferentes. La Señora Mayra Carina tiene 52 años ella se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace 9 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, ella dio comienzo vendiendo en el Ingenio San Antonio, pero posteriormente se de traslado al parque central, pero debido a la difícil situación decidió establecerse en su vivienda. Areli Guadalupe tiene 32 años, la actividad económica es venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante por las calles. Sus aspiraciones son de ampliar y establecerse en un lugar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Alicia Catalina tiene 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos como sillas, mesas, vasos, platos y cucharas. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que comercializa sus productos de manera ambulante. Los propósitos para el negocio son de invertir en mas productos para sus clientes  y  es así como decidieron unirse para solicitar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Harry Group consists of three members; their names are Mayra Carina A. P., Areli Guadalupe Pais P. and Alicia Catalina P.. They each are involved in different activities. Mrs. Mayra Carina is 52 years old, has been selling food for 9 years, is a single mother of 3 children. She started selling in the Ingenio San Antonio, later moved to the central park, but due to financial difficulties decided to establish her business in her home. Areli Guadalupe is 32 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics. She has been in this business for more than 12 years, and sells as a street vendor. Her wishes are to expand and be able to establish herself in a place where she can present her products. Alicia Catalina is 54 years old, she makes a living selling plastic goods such as chairs, tables, glasses, plates and spoons. She has this business for more than 10 years, and she also sells her wares as a street vendor. Their goal is to provide more products for their customers and that is the reason for their decision to unite and request this loan for the investment in each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Delma

texts.es:
En el Mercado El Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora María Delma se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de comida el cual posee dese hace 5 años siendo este el negocio con el cual sustenta su hogar.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimento porque requiere de ella actualmente para así salir adelante mejorando cada día su situación económica ya que esta en su deber mantener a su familia y a dos nietos que están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Delma Z. works really hard selling food at the "El Bisne" market in the city of Chinandega for the last 5 years. This business supports her home. She is waiting to receive a loan from Ceprodel in order to buy groceries to prepare her dishes. She wants to improve her economic situation, because she has to support her family and 2 grand children who are under her care.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Sugey Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven Sugey tiene 26 años de edad, reside en Ciudadela de Nicaragua en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijitos de 6 y 9 años de edad,  su esposo es comerciante de ropa al igual que ella vende ropa variada, negocio que inicio con fondos  prestado. Con esta solicitud de crédito quiere invertir en comprar más ropa, en esta temporada de verano como short, camisolas, trajes de baño entre otros, sus planes es poder seguir con su negocio, poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, da las gracias ala institución por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Young Sugey is 26 years old, lives in the neighbourhood of Nicaragua in the city of Managua, she has 2 kids who are 6 and 9 years old, her husband works selling clothes. Sugey sells diverse clothing too, she started her business with a loan. With the current loan request she wants to buy more merchandise for this summer season like shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits, among others. She plans to keep on with her business and cover her family needs. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell for this summer season

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Natividad L. se dedica con gran esfuerzo y dedicación a su actividad de elaboración  y venta de tortillas teniendo este negocio en su casa de habitación donde a diario  es visitada por sus clientes que compran dichas tortillas.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una muy excelente trabajadora y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del maíz ya que requiere de este para continuar elaborando las ricas tortillas y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Natividad Lopez works with great effort and dedication preparing and selling tortillas in the city of Chinandega. She works from her one room home, where she is visited daily by her clients, who stop by to buy her tortillas. She is an excellent worker and is coming to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan to buy corn to prepare her delicious tortillas and keep on growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La labor a la que se dedica la señora Marta A. es a la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son preparadas por ella misma en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega donde actualmente vive.

Es de importancia destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora ya que elabora deliciosas tortillas preparadas por ella misma. La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de maíz para elaborar las tortillas y así seguir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de mucha inversión en estos momentos.
texts.en:
The work that Mrs. Marta A. dedicates her time to is the making and selling of tortillas. She prepares them herself in her home which is located in the city of Chinandega. It is important to note that she is a very hard working woman as can be attested by the delicious tortillas that she prepares. She is waiting for a loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase corn for the making of the tortillas and thus be able to keep moving ahead with her business which currently requires a large investment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: From a great smile of the Cambodian citizen, H., 39 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province and is a mother of three children: one is married and lives separately, and the other two are still young. She is married to Tith, 59 years old, who is employed as a fish seller in the market in the morning and late afternoon. H. has been raising piglets in the pigpen behind her house for more than one year. And with her husband, she owns a stall distilling traditional white wine too. The family has improved their standard of living in the village. But recently, Tith is facing difficulty with transportation. So H. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Yok

texts.en:
A gentle face with a great, admirable attitude from Phnom Penh, Cambodia living in a family she leads. Widowed mother E., 60, is the mother of four children: one is married and lives separately, the second two are single and sell vegetables in the market, and the last one is a student.

E. has earned her living selling vegetables in the market for more than five years. This is the harvest season; E. wants to increase the income from her stall. Therefore she is applying for a loan of $900 to buy more vegetables for her to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: S. is a 57-year-old widowed mother. Her son is employed as a worker in a private factory. S. has been working as a primary school teacher for more than four years. She also provides a vehicle parking service in the school, which fetches her up to $9 a day. She is requesting a loan of $900 to buy a new motorbike for herself so that her son need not drop her to work as always.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for herself

loans.name: Him

texts.en: A. S., 55, is a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of three children: one is married and lives separately, and the other two are employed at a private company. A. S. has been selling dry fish in the market since 2000. She sometimes uses her bicycle for selling dry fish along the street, so that she can earn much more than what she earns at the market. A. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to improve her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her fish-selling business

loans.name: Rodriga

texts.en:
Rodriga E. is 56 years old and has only one child. She owns a small "sari-sari" store. Before she got herself engaged into selling goods, she used to sell dried fish in her village. Her husband is very supportive of her business and diligently provides the needs of his family. She is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to renovate her small store. In this way, she could attract more customers and earn more income. The loan will also be used to buy other items to sell in her store. 

CEVI helps Rodriga achieve business growth. She receives credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To renovate her store and buy other items to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is a fish vendor. She buys fish from the fishermen and sells them all in the wet market for family income. She is married to a fisherman, Vitaliano B.. Every night, her husband goes out in the sea, throws his old nets and baits to catch more fish. Her husband also helps her sell fish in their village to feed and clothe their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy new fishing materials. She will also use some of the loan to repair his old boat and also buy more fish from other fishermen to sell.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI helps people start and have their own business. They give their clients not only credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy new fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
V. is 23 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a mother of a child who is still young. She is married to Mao, 20, who works in a restaurant as a cashier with a salary of $80. She is famous for always getting admirable comments from the manager.

To help reduce the family's expenses, V. is taking out a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her and her family's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her family's transportation

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
C. is 34 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a father of six children: one is married and lives separately, the second two work as motor taxi drivers, and the last three are students. He is married to Thy, 31, who sells clothes in the market.

C. owns a tuk tuk and has provided a transportation service throughout the whole town of the province since 2002. C. recently had a problem with the motor because it's too old to run. So he is looking for a loan of $1000 to buy a new tuk tuk for his service. He wants to have a degree for his children.

loans.use: To buy a new tuk tuk for his service

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
K., 24, is a mother of two children: both of them are still young. She is married to Savuth, 29, who is a middle trader in rice. K. has been a vegetable planter for more than three years. She always harvests her products four times a year and customers always buy her vegetables in bulk in the market.

Because this is the harvest season, her husband needs to spread his business. So K. is looking for a loan of $1200 for her husband to buy hundreds of kilos of rice. K. was not available during the photograph so her husband, Savuth, is shown instead.

loans.use: For her husband to buy hundreds of kilos of rice

loans.name: Lourdelyn

texts.en:
Lourdelyn D. specializes in manicure and pedicure treatment. She took a thorough seminar on this work and is now serving the entire community, especially wives wishing to have their nails polished and cleaned. Lourdelyn, the 35-year-old mother of three children, is married to Cuneberto, a farmer. They have worked together to endure the global crisis that has created instability in businesses such as hers.

Lourdelyn is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI to buy new sets of materials for her pedicure/manicure business. The loan will help her gain more customers and earn a larger income.
