CEVI is helping people to start and maintain their own businesses. They also provide credit, training and insurance coverage services to help clients achieve business growth.

loans.use: To purchase sets of materials for her manicure/pedicure business.

loans.name: Maria Luvis

texts.en:
Maria Luvis R. owns a tricycle (a motorcyle with a side car which is being used as a common public utility vehicle in the rural areas). She is 42 years old and has only 1 child. Her husband, Ricardo R. is driving their small tricycle to supplement the family income. She is planning to establish her own sari-sari store. 
She is now requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI to  repair her tricycle and start buying merchandise for her store. She believes that by selling more items she will have more profit; therefore, the loan will truly help her family to earn bigger income. 

CEVI is helping Maria Luvis to sustain her business, providing credit, training and insurance coverage to feed and clothe her family.

loans.use: To repair his tricycle and purchase permit and start a new business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: “Poor but full of hope” - that’s what Mrs. Fe L. said during her interview. She is 39 years old, married and lives at Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children and her husband is a farmer. Her small business was started in September 2005 after she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is engaged in fruit selling and other "buy-and-sell" products. Her primary customers are her friends, neighbors and members of Paglaum MPC. She's happy that somehow she has been able to give daily allowances to all her children. She was able to repair her house also. Today, she is applying for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits for sale. She hopes that someday, she can support the education of all her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits for sale

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en: Mrs. Maridel A. is 54 years old and married to Bernard, a fisherman. They have 9 children and 6 of them are married. Their source of income relies on her husband's fishing and her fish vending. Mrs. A. has been a Co-op member since 2004. She is good and religiously pays her obligations to the cooperative. She is borrowing the amount of PHP 20,000 for the acquisition of a new set of fishing nets. The loan will help her with additional income generation and with sustaining the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy a new set of fishing neta

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Mrs. Belen C., 42 years old, is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are studying. She is a fish vendor and her husband is a fisherman. She sell fish caught by her husband, and sometimes she gets some from their neighbors for her to sell in the market and gain more income. Mrs. C. is borrowing the loan amount of PHP 5,000 for additional capital for her existing business. Her hopes are to have her own stall in the market and to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy fish for her business

loans.name: Waled

texts.en:
Waled, 24, lives with his parents in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where he has been installing  satellite receivers for six years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new satellite receiver and settle his debts. This is the first time that Waled has requested a loan. 

A fast and skilled worker, Waled has built up his client base to include friends, neighbors and people from his village. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new satellite receiver and settle his debts.

loans.name: Ley's Group
loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for her family's business.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 38-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their one child. He has worked as a car repairer and painter for the last fifteen years. Abass has applied for a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his garage. He has been a microcredit client for the last eight years and has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him improve his garage and his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and car dealers. When Abass started his business, things went smoothly because of his experience in this trade. In the future, he plans to expand his business by trading in cars.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their one child. For the last three years, he has owned a pet store where he sells birds and fish. He has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua to buy more merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mouhamad has applied for a loan from our organization, but we are confident he will be able to repay because he has clients from all over the area and much experience in this field.

loans.use: To buy merchadise for his shop.

loans.name: Boshor

texts.en: B. is a 53-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. For the last 25 years, B. has owned a coffee shop. He is seeking a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to buy merchandise for his business. This is the first time that B. has requested a loan from us, but we are confident he will be able to repay because his store is cozy and people like being there. His clients are also largely his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, B. had some difficulties getting customers, but he was determined to improve his financial situation and work hard to make the business a success. He is committed to continue to improve it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 53-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. For the last two years, Malek has made a living selling dairy products. He is applying for a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua to buy a new refrigerator. This is the first time that Malek has requested a loan from us, but we are confident he will be able to repay because he sells a wide range of products and knows how to treat his clients, who come from all across his area.

When Malek first started his business, he didn’t have startup capital, but he did have lots of experience that helped him succced. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Ramadane

texts.en:
Ramadane is a 45-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their one child. Ramadane has owned a home-products shop for the last five years, and is applying for a $1,500 loan to buy a new washing machine for his company. This is the second loan he has requested from us, and he has always made payments on time. 

His clients are people from all over the region region. When Ramadane first started his business, things went smoothly because of his strong commitment to improve his financial situation and to start his own business. In the future, he plans on expanding his small company.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for his business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He is a tailor, and he also sells tailoring materials and wall clocks. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more wall clocks and tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and clocks to sell

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah L. owns a small parcel of land. She grows rice on her farm and sells some of her harvest in her village. She is 20 years old and has 2 small children. She invests much in farming because she believes that her family has a bright future in this kind of endeavor. Her husband, Renante L., is also a farmer. Together they work hard under the heat of the sun to support their children's needs.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to enrich the soil on her farm. The loan will help her whole family achieve a better harvest. In that way, she could earn much of what she needs to supply their needs.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own businesses and livelihoods. CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to support its clients achieve business growth.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Pabling

texts.en:
Pabling T. is a farmer. He grows rice and manages a small farm to feed and clothe his family. He is 56 years old and has 4 children studying. He dreams that some day all his children will graduate from college, so that when they are older and have their own families, they will have jobs to support their future needs.

He is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for the farm. The loan will truly help him increase his yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own business. CEVI gives not only credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng H., 39, is a modest villager living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.  She currently grows vegetables on her small farmland.  Beside this, she distills traditional Khmer wine out of her home.  Seng can make over 10 liters of wine per day for selling to buyers.  To help feed her family, her husband sells firewood.  The couple has three children who are attending school.  Because the business of selling firewood is growing, Seng has requested a $1000 loan to support her husband's business, by buying a cart and a horse for transportation.

loans.use: Buy a cart and horse.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo D. is engaged in rice farming. He owns a small parcel of land that he uses to support the needs of his family. He is 42 years old and has three children. Danilo has been into farming since he was just a small kid. His parents are farmers and everything he knows about growing crops came from them. Danilo's life is on the farm and he wanted to support his children.

Danilo is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, and herbicides for his farm. The loan will help enrich the soil and result in good harvests. They need the loan to sustain their business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses. They give their clients credit, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita M. is a 43 year-old mother of three who lives in Sebaste, Antique Province, at the northern end of the island of Panay.   Her husband is a farmer.   Anita applied for this loan to buy items for resale at her sari sari shop.  "Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and she sells an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages and everyday commodities.  Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.   Anita hopes to earn enough income from her shop to support her children's education.

loans.use: Buy inventory for a small general store.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua A. is 38 years old and married with three children.  He sells electronics.  Joshua is requesting a N100,000 loan to purchase more electronics to sell.  He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is 40 years old and married with four children.  She sells stockfish to her customers.  Gladys is requesting a N50,000 loan to purchase more stockfish to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more stockfish to sell.

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en:
Rosane P. has spent her whole life on the farm. Her parents are farmers, and she has understood the process of growing rice and producing a good harvest ever since she was a child. Now, she is 37 years old and has two children. She wants to expand her farm in order to support her children's education. Schooling is quite expensive, so she needs to double her yield to pay tuition and other school fees.

Rosane is requesting a loan of 12 000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and foliar pesticides for her farm. The loan will really help Rosane attain maximum crop yields.

More about CEVI
CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and run their own business. It gives its clients credit, training and insurance to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Boeb

texts.en: Boeb M., 34, lives with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has three children, two of whom are married and live independently. Boeb earns a living planting crops, and his wife helps him with this physical work. He also sells carving wood from his home as another source of income. In this way he can earn $3 a day to provide for his family's needs. With the crop-growing season approaching, Boeb M. wants to borrow $200 USD to buy seed for growing corn, and with the rest of the loan he intends to increase his stocks of carving wood.

loans.use: To buy seed for growing corn, and stocks of carving wood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 35 years old and married with three children. Victoria sells motor spare parts and is requesting a loan of 100 000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Grace Bosede

texts.en: Grace Bosede A. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells plastics such as bowls, spoons, plates, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy O. is 52 years old and married with 4 children. He sells provisions. He hopes to expand this business. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura M. is a rice grower. All her life, she has spent wisely growing and taking good care of their crops. Her farm enables her to feed and clothe her family easily. She is 40 years old and has 2 children. She is married to a farmer, Eduardo M.. Together, they till their small farm to provide the growing needs of their family.

Laura is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She wants to protect her crops from insects to not inflict disease and affect her yield.

She has been a CEVI client for a long time already. Aside from the credit assistance that she receives, CEVI also gives training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose S. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She travels to Cotonou to purchase sarongs to sell in Ogbomosho, Oyo State. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan K., 47, is a good homemaker who cooks tasty foods and cares for the children in the family home. Besides her daily housework, she always helps her husband in boiling palm juice into palm sugar for sale.

Her husband works as a palm climber, as well as selling firewood. With the palm climbing, he climbs over 10 palm trees to tap palm juice. The couple has three children who are married and are living away from the family home. Lan K. is applying for a loan to buy 2 cows for her husband use to transport firewood to sell and to raise their offspring in the future. The family lives in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Adetayo

texts.en: Adetayo T. is 35 years old and married with 4 children He is a tailor. He also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials  to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Dorcas sells cosmetics such as hair cream, body cream etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V. is a 35-year-old married mother of four who lives in Sebaste, Antique Province. One of her children is already in high school, and two of her children attend elementary school. Her husband is a farmer.

Lorena has two business projects: she sells halo-halo and other treats from a small canteen, and she raises hogs. Halo-halo is a dessert made from shaved ice and condensed milk, mixed with sweet beans and/or fruit. The name of the dessert is derived from the Tagalog word "halo" (pronounced ha-low), which means "mix".

Lorena says she learned the art of making halo-halo when she worked at a canteen in Manila. Lorena will use the money from this loan to support her canteen project, and the rest to raise her pigs. She hopes to open a restaurant some day, and to earn enough money to help support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and sweets for a small canteen

loans.name: Ayoola

texts.en: Ayoola is 47 years old and married with 4 children. He is a tailor. He has 3 sewing machines and 1 weaving machine. He is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sew more clothes for his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Adekunle

texts.en: Adekunle is 33 years old and single. He sells planks. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia O. is a 53-year-old widow with 6 children. Lydia sells planks. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Alao

texts.en: Alao R. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He sells beef. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more beef to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Ejiniyi

texts.en: Ejiniyi A. is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She sells planks.  She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is 32 years old and married with a child. He sells planks. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Tunde

texts.en: Tunde A. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He hopes to expand this business. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul A. is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells planks. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. The demand for his planks is high and he hopes to meet the demand of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks  to sell

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicine and provisions. She is requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicine to sell

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola A. travels to Lagos to purchase bags, shoes, and jewelry to sell in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more bags, shoes and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sarder Muhammad

texts.en: Sarder Muhammad is the son of S. S.. He lives in district 5, Kabul, Afghanistan, and he is married and has two children. And he has got a business of sculpture-making. He wants to make his business vast so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money for business expansion and want to have a good future.

loans.use: For expanding his business

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike has a shop where she sells and rents video CDs and sells rechargeable phone cards. Her husband is a civil servant and they both have 3 children. Morenike is 42 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more video CDs and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and video CDs  to sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu O. O. is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She has a business centre where she sells rechargeable phone cards and does typing and photocopying of documents. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: K. Lawal is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She is a seamstress and she sews lovely clothes for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sew more clothes for her customers. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Mirikrom

texts.ru: Курбоналиев Мирикром житель района Варзоб. Возраст 20 лет, не женат .Живет в семье с родителями. Кроме них с ними живут его ьрат с семьей.  Имеет средне-техническое образование. Работает слесарем  на СТО. Зарабатывает около 200 $  в месяц. Работает много , так как планирует жениться , а на это нужны деньги. Обратился за кредитом для того , чтобы на него купить оборудование, необходимое в работе. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirikrom K. lives in the Varzob area. He is 20 years old and is not married. He lives with his parents. In addition, his brother and his family live with them. Mirikrom has a secondary-technical education. He works as a mechanic at an auto shop. Mirikrom earns around $200 per month. He works a lot, because he plans to get married and this requires money. He turned to us for a loan in order to purchase equipment which he needs for work. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru: Хамдамова Турсуной жительница Варзобского района. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом. Бизнес общий , работает вместе с мужем.Торгуют на Варзобском рынке детской одеждой.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти летний товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tursunoy H. lives in the Varzob area. She is married and has five children. Tursunoy has been in business for 15 years. She shares the business with her husband and they work together. They sell children’s clothing at the Varzob market. She plans to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover and purchase summer products. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Мукимова Ханифа проживает в районе Варзоб. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Возрат 32 года. Муж нигде не работает. Семью обеспечивает сама без чьей - либо помощи. Уже шесть лет занимается торговлей хлебных изделий.Покупает хлеб на заводе и продает на Варзобском рынке. Торговая точка арендуется , но теперь она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить торговую точку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hanifa M. lives in the Varzob region. She is married and has one child. She is 32 years old. Her husband does not work. Hanifa supports the family by herself without any help. She has been selling bread products for six years. She buys the bread at the factory and sells it at the Varzob market. She rents her sales location but plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a sales spot.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sales spot

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Бобоева Мамлакат проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 32 года, разведена и одна воспитывает пятерых детей. Занимается торговлей на рынке  Варзоба. Торгует женским бельем и детской одеждой. Заниается этим бизнесом уже пять лет. Доход составляет около 700 сомони в месяц. Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы  увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mamlakat B. lives in the Varzob area. She is 32 years old, is divorced and is raising five children by herself. She is a saleswoman at the Varzob market. She sells women’s lingerie and children’s clothing. Mamlakat has been in this business for five years now. She earns around 700 somoni per month. She has turned to us for a loan in order to increase her turnover and purchase seasonal products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is 42 years old and has been raising sheep for more than 5 years. Two years ago her husband went abroad to work.  He will not be back soon. It's hard for Natalia to work by herself because health does not permit her to do so. Natalia has problems with her backbone, but she is often helped by her son, who is a student at school in the village. Natalia makes dairy products that she sells at the market in the region.  She also sells wool to buyers that make fur coats for winter. 

Natalia is requesting a loan from Microinvest to buy necessary medicine. She will also use the loan to increase the number of sheep she owns.

loans.use: Buying sheep and medicine

loans.name: Florence Atieno

texts.en:
Florence Atieno O. is a 30-year-old mother of four children ages 16, 12, 8 and 6. They are all in school. Florence is married to a mason and they live in Nyamasaria slum. She sells vegetables, small fish and soap out of a small kiosk that is at the doorstep of her home.

Florence buys her goods from the Kibuye market and transports them back to Nyamasaria. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business. She tells us that most people ask for cooking oil, sugar and flour but she only has vegetables right now. She hopes her children become learned people. Furthermore, she is requesting this loan and hopes one day to get some business management lessons as she is eager to pay back the loan and expand.

loans.use: purchasing staple foods for re-sale

loans.name: Analida

texts.es:
La cliente tiene 22 años de edad.  Ella es soltera con un hijo de 2 años de edad de nombre Bruno Valentin.

La joven Analida termino el colegio y por su fuerza de voluntad de seguir adelante monto un pequeño negocio de venta de articulos de regalos y merceria con la cual actualmente mantiene a su pequeño hijo. 
Actualmente ya posee varios clientes formados, pues es la unica que posee un negocio de regalos en la zona donde vive. 

Analida viaja una vez por semana a la ciudad capital para realizar compras para su negocio y de esta manera tener más mercaderias que atraigan la atensión de sus clientes. Tiene pensado estudiar peluqueria para de esta manera complementar su negocio y de esta manera tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
The client is 22 years old. She is single and has a 2 year old son named of Bruno Valentin. The young Analida finished school and through her strong will to move ahead started a small business selling gifts and notions, this way she supports her small son. She currently has several steady customers, since she is the only one that has a gift store in the area where she lives. Analida travels to the capital city once a week to purchase items for her business, this way she has more merchandise that attracts the attention of her customers. She is thinking of studying hairdressing so that she can complement her business and this way have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bookstore items (notebook, pencils, erasers, ruler, calculator, clips, stationary, paper pads)

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Хакбердиева Мавлюда проживает в районе Варзоб. Домохозяйка , но имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 8 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы купить бычка. Этим она сможет увеличить поголовье скота и после того, как бычок подрастет сможет его выгодно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavluda H. lives in the Varzob area. She is a homemaker and has a small farm where she raises large livestock. She has been in this business for 8 years. Mavluda is married and has four children. She would like to take out a loan in order to purchase a calf. This will allow her to increase her livestock count and after the calf grows up she will be able to sell it at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sanginoy

texts.ru: Хакбердиева Сангиной проживает в Варзобском районе. Одна растит 11 детей. Муж умер и уже 10 лет она занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство у себя дома , где и откармливает скот. После откормки выводит животных на рынок для продажи. Бизнес дает доход, которого ей хватает только на питание , поэтому она решила увеличить поголовье скота , путе получения кредита.
texts.en:
Sanginoy H. lives in the Varzob area. She raises 11 children by herself. Her husband died and for 10 years now she has been raising large livestock. She has a plot at her home where she fattens livestock. After fattening the livestock she takes it to the market to sell. The business provides her with income that is only enough for food, which is why she has decided to increase her livestock headcount via a loan. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Josenta Atieno

texts.en:
Josenta Atieno E. is 23-year-old mother of two children aged 6 and 3. A widow, Josenta supports her family and sends the kids to school by selling "mandazi" in the morning and vegetables in the evening. She cooks the mandazyi herself and told us that all it takes is baking flour, sugar, a little salt and some milk to make the dough. Then she fries it.

Josente buys her vegetables from Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu and brings them back to the Nyamasaria slum. She hopes to use the loan to purchase more inventory for her business and the rest for poultry or livestock as extra food security. She is asking for 20,000 KSH and would like Kiva lenders to know that the profit will go to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: more inventory for her businesses

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr Gustavo P. Britos tiene 27 años de edad. Vive aun con sus padres, comenta que anda buscando una compañera para formar una familia.  Trabajo varios años como vendedor de lineas de telefonos moviles hasta que pudo adquirir un minibus. 

Desde entonces han pasado dos años y manifiesta que pudo lograr su sueño de poder trabajar por su cuenta propia llevando a los niños de su comunidad a la escuela. El Señor compro antes la linea y ahora pudo conseguir el dinero para comprar el minibus, solicita el credito ahora para poder cambiar las cubiertas (tires) de dicho vehiculo y arreglar los tapizados que se deterioran rapidamente.
texts.en:
Señor Gustavo P. Britos is 27 years old. He still lives with his parents but he says that he is looking for a partner to start a family with. He worked for several years selling mobile phone service until he was able to acquire a minibus. That was two years ago and he finally has been able to realize his dream of being his own boss and taking the children of his community to and from school. He had already purchased the bus route and now he has been able to get the money in order to buy the bus. He is requesting this loan to replace the tires on this vehicle and to repair the seat covers which are rapidly deteriorating.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and repair the seats.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Восиев Икром проживает  в районе Варзоб. Возраст 56 лет. Женат и имеет 9 детей. Всю жизнь занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает, откармливает и продает бычков. Сейчас сезон , когда коровы дают потомство и поэтому цены на телят немного упали. Поэтому он решил срочно получить кредит для их покупки.
texts.en:
Ikrom V. lives in the Varzob region. He is 56 years old, married, and has 9 children. He has raised and bred cattle his entire life. He buys, feeds, and resells bull calves. This is the calving season so the price of calves has fallen a bit. He thus decided to request an immediate loan for their purchase. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco O. is a 25-year-old mother of three children aged 7, 5, and 4. In between giggles, she told us all three are already in school and her husband, an employee at the Coca-Cola company, helps pays school fees. Franciso sells second-hand clothes that she purchases in Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. She transports them by matatu (small bus) to Nyamasaria slum. She is asking for 20,000 KSH to increase her stock as demand continues to rise.

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is a 35 year-old mother of three children aged 16, 13 and 5. They are all in school and she hopes she can finance their studies all through at least high school so they can get good jobs. She cooks “chips” in Nyamasaria slum to pay her children’s school fees. As a widow, she is supporting them on her own and asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business.

loans.use: Food Supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su hijo Diego de 17 años de edad que está cursando el 3º año de la media en el colegio 12 de Junio de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. El señor Jorge C. es viudo hace 6 año y desde entonces se hace cargo de su hijo y de su mantensión. 

Su trabajo de toda la vida es el trabajo en reparación de chaperia y pintura de vehiculos, ademas de soldaduras y trabajos de pintura. 

Dicho trabajo lo realiza en su propio domicilio en donde monto un tinglado para los trabajos que realiza. Solicito dicho monto para levantar un vehiculo que tiene en su taller hace tiempo.
texts.en:
The client is 45 years old, lives with his son Diego of 17 years of age who is in the third year of high school in the June 12th School of the city of Coronel Oviedo. Mr. Jorge C. became a widower 6 years ago and since then has been taking care of his son and his support. He has worked all his life in auto body repair and painting, also welding and painting. He does his work at his residence where he built a shed for this purpose. He is requesting this amount to be able to finish a vehicle that he has had in his shop for some time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward Kwalazi is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur businessman. He runs a double business at Gongolamboto ward at Ukonga in Dar es Salaam. He runs a hardware shop from which he sells a variety of items. He purchases the items from Kariakoo city shopping center from wholesale shops and sells retail to customers. Also he receives orders from customers who want to buy wholesale. Also, he provides pick-up transport services at Gongo lamboto. He has been running the business for ten years. He needs a loan of 1,000,000 to boost the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: Tatiana is a very diligent housewife. She grows cattle and also produces dairy products as well as beef to sell. She has been raising animals for more than 6 years. Tatiana lives alone in a village in the town of Leova. Tatiana wants to start a business, namely to increase her cattle and produce milk to be sold in the market of her region. Tatiana decided to request a loan from Microinvest in order to develop a business of breeding.

loans.use: starting up a cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años de edad, está  casada con Ramón Vera de 54 años. Ellos viven en  casa propia y tienen 2 hijos que son mayores de edad.

Juana empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedora. Con el tiempo pudo adquirir los conocimientos necesarios para ser una buena comerciante, hoy día tiene una despensa con muchas  mercaderias y es un sitio muy concurrido por los vecinos.

Gracias a las ganancias adquiridas en su negocio pudo hacer estudiar a sus hijos, actualmente trabaja con ella un sobrino a quien  ayuda a pagar sus estudios.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old, married to Ramon Vera, who is 54 years old. They live in their own home and have two children who are grown. Juana began working as a vendor with her father when she was very young. Over time, she was able to acquire the know-how needed to be a good businesswoman. Now she has a store full of merchandise in a location that is oft-frequented by her neighbors. Thanks to the earnings generated by the business, Juana was able to send her children to school. Now one of her nephews works with her and she is paying for his studies. She needs this loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima P. is a micro-entrepreneur and a Tanzanian woman. She is a poultry keeper. She keeps broilers. She keeps them in three different poultry cages with a variation of two weeks from one cage to another. It takes only three months to sale, thus because of the alternation, she can have sales every four weeks. She also plans to keep layers but capital limits her possibilities. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
La Sra. Justiniana  tiene 56 años y está casada con el señor Catalino Franco. Ellos viven en casa propia y tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad.

Desde muy joven, Justiniana fue a la Argentina donde trabajó durante diez años. Al regresar al país utilizó su ahorro para empezar su negocio y poder afincarse definitivamente. Primeramente empezó con la ventas de bebidas, luego vendió articulos de primera necesidad, pues en su vecindad no existía ni un negocio. Dicha despensa se encuentra a quince kilometros de la ciudad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo educar a sus hijos quienes ahora ya son todos mayores de edad.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Justiniana is 56 years old and is married to Catalino Franco. They live in their own home and have six children, all of whom are grown. When she was very young, Justiniana went to Argentina where she worked for 10 years. When she returned to her own country, she used her savings to start her own business and be able to settle down permanently. She started selling beverages, later she sold basic necessity items for in her area there wasn't one business. Said store is located 15 kilometers outside the city. Thanks to her efforts, her children were able to go to school and now they are all grown. She needs this loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
The women of group 5 from the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Bank of Hope are starting their 5th loan cycle with Esperanza International. They have experienced sustained growth in their businesses, thanks to the capital injection the loans have offered, and to the increased profits their businesses have generated.

San Pedro de Macoris is a province specially hard-hit by unemployment and lack of opportunities: the sugar cane industry that was the core of the province has been mostly closed for several years now, and the investments in areas like tourism are not as big as they are in other provinces of the Dominican Republic's southeast.

Sheila P. is this group's coordinator. She is a seamstress and makes clothing (mostly for women). She will use this loan to buy fabric for her activity and to expand to an additional area: she will also buy charcoal to sell. Propane gas is expensive, and a lot of people in rural areas do not own a stove anyway, so they use charcoal for cookiing. Sheila thinks this is something that will help her make more daily money, since the clothing takes longer to make and sell; she has 3 children and wants to ensure her income sources to make sure she will provide properly for them. These entrepreneurs have shown great commitment in their repayments and are an example to the rest of their community. Please support their business initiatives through this Kiva loan.

Thank you!

loans.use: purchase fabric to make new clothing

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane W.  is a pharmacist, a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs the business at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. The business items are purchased from the wholesale pharmacy shops at Kariakoo business city center. She has been in the business for four years. Her plan is to run a wholesale pharmacy shop but funds are the limiting factor. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more business stock

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary S. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur, a married woman with two school-age children. She runs a beauty salon at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. Maximum sales are found within the weekend, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She has been in the business for three years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost  the business.

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Kuña Kyre´ÿ Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km. De la Oficina de Paraguarí, se conformá el grupo denominado Kuña Kyre´ÿ. Quienes luego de interiorizarse sobre el reglamento de Comites Mujeres Emprendedoras, aceptaron y conformaron dicho comité integrada por 17 trabajadoras y sacrificadas  mujeres. Encontrándose en el octavo ciclo, quienes cada una de ellas ponen lo mejor de si para mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Sacrificándose al máximo para salir adelante.

Ma. Estela Cáceres	Farmacéutica
Marcelina O.	        Costurera
Arminda M.	        Despensa
Juana O.	        Venta de Leche
Ma. de la Cruz M.	Venta de Carne
Gasparina G.	Panadería
Gregoria F.	        Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Isidra M.	        Docente
Charito Fernández	Artesana
Marlene L.	        Docente
Patricia González	Artesana
Nilsa Morán	        Despensa
Yenny T.	        Docente
Elba B.	        Venta de Comestibles
María Morán	        Empleada
Concepción A.	Empleada
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguaron, which is 15 kilometers away from the office of Kiva partner Paraguari, a group formed called Kuña Kyre´ÿ. After forming, under the rules of the Enterprising Women Committees, said committee accepted and was formed of 17 hardworking and sacrificing women. They are now receiving their eighth loan; each of the group members does her best to increase her business income and give her family the best. The women sacrifice themselves to the maximum in order to continue succeeding. Maria Estela Cáceres Pharmaceuticals Marcelina O. Dressmaking Arminda M. General store Juana O. Milk sales Ma. de la Cruz M. Meat sales Gasparina G. Bread shop Gregoria F. Fruit and vegetable sales Isidra M. Teacher Charito Fernández Craftswoman Marlene L. Teacher Patricia González Craftswoman Nilsa Morán General store Yenny T. Teacher Elba B. Food sales María Morán Office clerk Concepción A. Office clerk

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loans are invested in each woman's business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha S. is a Tanzanian small business woman.  She runs a business selling charcoal to retail customers at Kisiwani ward in Dar es Salaam.  She purchases the charcoal wholesale directly from the producers.  Charcoal is the major source of power in most of the developing countries due to high cost of electricity which is also unstable.  She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business stock.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Bank of Hope is starting its fifth loan cycle with Esperanza International. A large number of members in this group are Haitian immigrants looking for better opportunities than the ones available in their home country. The lack of employment opportunities available in their area have taken them to self-employment, which allows them to guarantee some income for their families, and in many cases, send some relief money to their families back home.

Maria V. is the representative for this group of five. She has been appointed by her mates to collect their payments and in general, she watches over the others and knows the general status of everyone's businesses. This is a position of much respect. Maria sells shoes and clothing. Her highest selling items are tennis shoes. She will use this loan to buy more tennis shoes and some clothing items that sell well, like jeans. Maria hopes one day to have her own store, where customers will come to her. This would allow her to have a more relaxed lifestyle and spend more time with her children.

Please support these entrepreneurs' businesses through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy tennis shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 3 Group

texts.en:
This group of five belonging to the Dios es Amor Bank of Hope is starting its entrepreneurship endeavor with this loan. They hope to make their business activities more established. In most cases, these women have been trading for some time but had no organization or business training. Thanks to the training they received before joining Esperanza International formally, they believe they will be able to approach their customers more effectively and administer their money better.

Alerte F. is the group's representative and she sells clothes. Pants and blouses are more in demand, so she will purchase more with this loan to meet her customers' needs.. She will also buy some accessories, that also have good sales because they cost less.

She hopes that slowly but steadily, her business will gain more structure and become a store where she can offer a wide variety of clothing and accessories to all ages.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs who are just starting. Thank you!

loans.use: Purchase clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Miguelina A. N. is a bank coordinator for Union con Esperanza (The Union of Hope). She is 39 years old and single. She has three children; 21, 18 and 16 years old. The 15 women of the bank are now looking for a loan with Esperanza. Miguelina and nine of the other women have never received a loan.

Miguelina used to have a business selling clothes, but decided to go another route because there are a lot of people selling clothes near her. She wants to start a new business selling shoes for men. A friend of hers makes shoes and she wants to sell his shoes in her neighborhood, in Puerto Plata. She also thinks it will be easier to sell shoes to men than clothes to women because men do not take such a long time to make a decision and also pay more (her words).

Miguelina first heard about Esperanza because some of her family members have already received loans. Now she hopes it will be possibly for her to receive a loan so she can start her new business.

Miguelina wants to learn English and hopes that in the future she will be able to study at a school that teaches English. It is important to her that she will be able to help her children. She owns a house in the countrysiD., but lives in a rented house in Puerto Plata. Her dream is that one day she will own her own house in the city.

On behalf of Miguelina, Union Con Esperanza, and Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km. De la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas señoras con ganas de emprender actividades productivas y otras para aumentar su capital de trabajo. De ahí que se pusieron en contacto con nosotros para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por los múltiples beneficios que presenta.

El comité lleva por nombre “La Alegría”, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo. El comite esta integrada por 17 activas y sacrificadas  mujeres, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle lo  mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas ellas son muy activas y trabajoras quienes se esfuerzan día a día para poder progresar.

Dusvelia D.	Venta de Comestibles
Hilda A.	Costurera
Claudelina L.	Venta de Carne
Ninfalina D.	Costurera
Ada D.	Costurera
Vidalia D.	Costurera
Liza P.	Costurera
Gloria P.	Empleada
Braulia Aristiquí	Masajista
Cinthia B.	Venta de Chipa
Norma J.	Costurera
Ma. Ursulina C.	Empleada
Romina M.	Venta de Lencería
Arminda D.	Costurera
Ninfa A.	Empleada
Guadalupe T.	Venta de Carbón
Bety C.	Empleada
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguaron, 15 km from the capital of paraguari, some ladies met with plans to start productive activities and others to increase their working capital. From there they put themselves in contact with us to find out about the program, and were accepted for the multiple benefits it presents. The committee has the name "La Alegria," and they are actually in their eighth cycle. The committee is made up of 17 active and sacrificing women, who become beter for trying to increase their incomes and provide more for their respective families. All of them are very active and hard working who work day to day to be able to progress. Dusvelia D. Food sales Hilda A. Seamstress Claudelina L. Meat sales Ninfalina D. Seamstress Ada D. Seamstress Vidalia D. Seamstress Liza P. Seamstress Gloria P. Employee Braulia Aristiquí Masseaurs Cinthia B. Venta de Chipa Norma J. Seamstress Ma. Ursulina C. Employee Romina M. Venta de Lencería Arminda D. Seamstress Ninfa A. Employee Guadalupe T. Charcoal sales Bety C. Employee

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Their loans have been invested in their individual businesses.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
This is one of the newest groups in the Unidos Venceremos Bank of Hope, from San Pedro de Macoris. All five members are in business sell clothing, accessories, cosmetics and health care products. Due to the current economic situation, they need to infuse some capital into their businesses to keep them going.

Bladimir C. is the group's representative and has a varied sales business. He sells mostly accessories, so he will use this loan to buy accessories and perfumes, which is his newest offer to customers. Bladimir also sells tennis shoes, which sell well. He hopes to make his business grow into a store where he can sell a wider variety of merchandise and move to an administrative position where he supervises supplies, purchasing and the staff.

Please help us support the first steps of Bladimir's dream as well as the rest of this Bank of Hope group. Thank you!

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion, a farmer in Gordinesti Village, Edinet District, has worked in agriculture since childhood, having learned the profession from his father, who was also a farmer. Ion has two children, both students who want to attain higher educations. To achieve this goal, Ion is ready to do anything, and has thus decided to start up a business in agriculture that will enable him to sell vegetables and fruit year around. For this he needs to build two greenhouses at home and is thus requesting a loan to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and film for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro 6 Group

texts.en:
The members of this Bank of Hope group, group 6, have requested their sixth loan through Esperanza International. They've been clients for the last 3 years. These loans have allowed them to make their businesses more sustainable. Their business activities include clothing and accessories sales, and an internet cafe.

Marisabel P. is the group representative. She's married and has 3 children. She has a "fantasia" in her house. This is a store where mostly, you can purchase accessories like hair pins and ponytail holders, and personal care products like deodorant and shampoo. You can also find small school supplies like pencils and paper.

Marisabel wants to provide her children with the best education and quality of life so that they can excel. This is why she works so hard in her business and tries to keep it well stocked and interesting, and to achieve the financial stability that allows her to support her children's education.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs through this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase personal products for resale

loans.name: Maria Lilliam

texts.es: La señora Maria R. tiene la edad de 60 años , habita en el barrio Medardo Andino , junto a sus hijos , la señora es viuda desde hace cinco años , los hijos le apoyan con sus gastos , ella tiene tres hijas ya son casadas , los planes de doña Maria es poder darle partes iguales a sus hijas , para que cuando ella falte tenga donde vivir , la actividad es la agricultura y el comercio de la piña , desde hace 30 años trabaja con las tierras , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento ya que al cultivo no se le induce ningún fertilizantes y tiene que vender a bajo precio . Con las recomendaciones de nuestro agrónomo tiene que aplicarle fertilizantes, exfoliciación y plaguicidas para que sea un buen producto y se venda a un mejor precio. Y a si poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria R. is 60 years old, and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood with her children. Maia became a widow five years ago, and her children help her cover the costs of keeping a home. She has three daughters who are all married. Maria plans to split her property equally between them, so that when she passes away they have somewhere to live. Maria has been farming and selling pineapples for 30 years. The greatest challenge is that she lacks financing, which forces her to grow crops without the use of fertilizer and therefore sell them at a lower price. With recommendations from our agronomist, Maria will apply fertilizers, aerate the land, and apply pesticides to improve her product and sell at a higher price. By following these steps she'll be able to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Luz Marina is the president of the Sayhua 2 Village Bank, an experienced group that has been taking out loans from Asociacion Arariwa for years. She is good-natured, but runs the group in a strict, disciplined manner, insisting that all the group members be responsible and punctual. Whenever anyone shows up late to a group meeting, Luz Marina (“Luzma”) makes that person pay a late fee into the group’s collective savings account.

Luzma is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children: a nine-year-old son and a one-year-old daughter. Luzma owns a gift shop/hair salon in Urubamba, a city in the Sacred Valley, about one hour outside of the city of Cusco. She opened the store in 2000. She works there seven days a week selling jewelry, stuffed animals, and pins and working as a cosmetologist.

Luzma is requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to buy more earrings, pins, jewelry and stuffed animals for the store. Her goal for the future is to sell gifts in bulk, since she could earn more by selling a dozen at a time than she does now, selling one-by-one.

loans.use: Buy jewelry and stuffed animals for resale

loans.name: Domingo Asilo

texts.es: El señor Domingo A. B., tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el barrio san Juan de la concepción junto a su esposa  la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos una hija de 17 años que estudia en la universidad, una de 16 que estudia su secundaria y una de siete años que estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es darle mejores condiciones de vida ; el se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio ,desde hace veinte años trabaja en sus tierras , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que atacan al cultivo por la falta de fertilizantes ya que el no tiene capital suficiente  para hacer esta inversión , el inicio la actividad agrícola por sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar su producción y compra mas terreno , con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y vender mejor la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo A. B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife in the Juan de la concepción neighborhood. Domingo's wife works as a fruit vendor. The couple has three children: a 17 year old daughter who attends university, a 16 year old daughter who is in high school, and a 7 year old daughter who is in primary school. Domingo and his wife would like to give their family the best quality of life. Domingo has been a farmer for 20 years, and also sold his produce. He became a farmer because his parents were also farmers. The greatest challenge is the plagues which attack the crop because of a lack of fertilizers. Domingo doesn't currently have sufficient capital for this investment. In the future he'd like to improve production and buy more land. With this loan he'll purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve the harvest and sell better crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for a better harvest
